[They should be] chaste, neither [of] those who commit unlawful intercourse randomly nor those who take [secret] lovers. But once they are sheltered in marriage, if they should commit adultery, then for them is half the punishment for free [unmarried] women. This [allowance] is for him among you who fears sin, but to be patient is better for you. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un kurš no jums [neatrod] nozīmē precēties bezmaksas, ticēt sievietes, tad [viņš var laulāties] no tiem, kam ticēt vergu meitenēm piemīt labās rokās. Un Allah ir visvairāk zinot par savu ticību. Jūs [ticīgie] ir viena no otras. Tātad precēties tos ar saviem iedzīvotājiem atļauju un dot viņiem par to pienākas kompensācija saskaņā ar to, kas ir pieņemams. [Tās] nevainīgs, ne [,], kuri nejauši izdarītu nelikumīgu dzimumakta, ne tiem, kas [noslēpums] mīļotājiem. Bet pēc tam, kad tie ir patvērusies laulībā, ja viņi būtu pārkāpt, tad viņiem ir puse sods par brīvu [neprecējies] sievietes. [Kvotu] ir viņu vidū, kuri baidās no grēka, bet esiet pacietīgi ir labāks par jums. Un Allah, piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: Allah wants to make clear to you [the lawful from the unlawful] and guide you to the [good] practices of those before you and to accept your repentance. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Allah vēlas skaidri jums [likumīgi no nelikumīgas] un [labu] prakse, no tiem, kas pirms jums palīdzēs un pieņemt savu grēku nožēlu. Un Allah ir zinot un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: Allah wants to accept your repentance, but those who follow [their] passions want you to digress [into] a great deviation.
trans-unit.target: Allah vēlas pieņemt savu grēku nožēlu, bet tiem, kuri seko [to] kaislības gribu jūs novirzīties [uz] liela novirze.

trans-unit.source: And Allah wants to lighten for you [your difficulties]; and mankind was created weak.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah vēlas atvieglot jums [jūsu grūtības]; un cilvēce tika izveidots vāja.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ir uzskats, ne patērēt viens otru bagātības netaisnīgi tikai [likumīga] uzņēmumu savstarpēji vienojoties. Un nav nogalināt sevi [vai kādu citu]. Patiešām, Allah ir jums kādreiz žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And whoever does that in aggression and injustice - then We will drive him into a Fire. And that, for Allah, is [always] easy.
trans-unit.target: Un kurš tas, ka agresija un netaisnību - tad mēs viņam iedzīt uguni. Un tas, par Allāhu, [vienmēr] viegli.

trans-unit.source: If you avoid the major sins which you are forbidden, We will remove from you your lesser sins and admit you to a noble entrance [into Paradise].
trans-unit.target: Ja jums izvairīties no lielu grēku, kas ir aizliegts, mēs noņemtu no jums mazāku grēku un uzņemt cēlu ieejas [ieved paradīzē].

trans-unit.source: And do not wish for that by which Allah has made some of you exceed others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask Allah of his bounty. Indeed Allah is ever, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Un nemaz nevēlas par to, kas Allah ir veikusi dažus jūs pārsniegt citiem. Vīriešiem ir daļa no to, ko viņi ir nopelnījuši, un sievietem ir daļa no to, ko viņi ir nopelnījuši. Un lūdzam Allah savas veltes. Patiešām Allah ir kādreiz, par visām lietām, zinot.

trans-unit.source: And for all, We have made heirs to what is left by parents and relatives. And to those whom your oaths have bound [to you] - give them their share. Indeed Allah is ever, over all things, a Witness.
trans-unit.target: Un visiem, mēs esam panākuši mantiniekus, kas ir palicis, vecākiem un radiniekiem. Un tiem, kam savu zvērestu būt piesaistīta [tu] - dot viņiem savu daļu. Patiešām Allah ir kādreiz, pār visām lietām, liecinieks.

trans-unit.source: Men are in charge of women by [right of] what Allah has given one over the other and what they spend [for maintenance] from their wealth. So righteous women are devoutly obedient, guarding in [the husband's] absence what Allah would have them guard. But those [wives] from whom you fear arrogance - [first] advise them; [then if they persist], forsake them in bed; and [finally], strike them. But if they obey you [once more], seek no means against them. Indeed, Allah is ever Exalted and Grand.
trans-unit.target: Vīrieši ir atbildīgi par sievietēm ar [tiesības] kādi Allah ir devis vienu virs otra un ko viņi pavada [apkopei] no savas bagātības. Lai taisnīgs sievietes, ir dievbijīga paklausīgs, apsardzes [vīra] prombūtnes laikā kādi Allah būtu viņiem aizsargs. Bet šie [sievas], no kuriem jums bailes, augstprātība - [pirmā] konsultēt tos; [tad, ja tie saglabājas] pamest tos gultā; un [beidzot], sasit tos. Bet ja viņi paklausīt jums [vēlreiz], meklēt nekādā ziņā pret viņiem. Patiešām, Allah ir kādreiz cildenais un Grand.

trans-unit.source: And if you fear dissension between the two, send an arbitrator from his people and an arbitrator from her people. If they both desire reconciliation, Allah will cause it between them. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Acquainted [with all things].
trans-unit.target: Un, ja jums bailes domstarpības starp divām, sūtīt arbitru no savas tautas un arbitru no savas tautas. Viņi abi vēlēšanās saskaņošanas Allah izraisīs to starp tām. Patiešām, Allah ir jebkad uzzināt un iepazīties [ar visām lietām].

trans-unit.source: Worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, and to parents do good, and to relatives, orphans, the needy, the near neighbor, the neighbor farther away, the companion at your side, the traveler, and those whom your right hands possess. Indeed, Allah does not like those who are self-deluding and boastful.
trans-unit.target: Dievkalpojumu Allah un asociētais nekas ar viņu, un vecākiem to labs, un uz radiniekiem, bāreņiem, trūkumcietējiem, blakus kaimiņš, kaimiņu tālāk, biedrs jūsu pusē, ceļotājs un tiem, kam piemīt labās rokas. Patiešām, Allah nepatīk tie, kuri ir self--deluding un lielīgs.

trans-unit.source: Who are stingy and enjoin upon [other] people stinginess and conceal what Allah has given them of His bounty - and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment -
trans-unit.target: Kurš skopojas un liek uz [citiem] cilvēku skopumu un noslēpt to Allah ir devis viņiem savas veltes - un mēs esam gatavi disbelievers pazemojošs sods-

trans-unit.source: And [also] those who spend of their wealth to be seen by the people and believe not in Allah nor in the Last Day. And he to whom Satan is a companion - then evil is he as a companion.
trans-unit.target: Un [arī] uz tiem, kuri pavada savas bagātības cilvēki pamanītu un ticēt nevis Allah, ne pēdējā dienā. Un viņš kam sātans ir biedrs - tad ļaunumu viņš kā sabiedrotais.

trans-unit.source: And what [harm would come] upon them if they believed in Allah and the Last Day and spent out of what Allah provided for them? And Allah is ever, about them, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Un ko [kaitēt nāks] pār viņiem, ja viņi tic Allah un pēdējā dienā un izlietoti no Allah paredzētie, viņiem? Un Allah ir kādreiz, par tām, zinot.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight; while if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, Allah nedara netaisnību [pat] daudz atomu svaru; bet ja tur ir labs darbs, viņš to reizina un dod no sevis liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: So how [will it be] when We bring from every nation a witness and we bring you, [O Muhammad] against these [people] as a witness?
trans-unit.target: Tā kā [būtu] kad mēs celt no katrai tautai liecinieks, un mēs nest, [O Muhammad] pret [ļaužu] kā liecinieks?

trans-unit.source: That Day, those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger will wish they could be covered by the earth. And they will not conceal from Allah a [single] statement.
trans-unit.target: Šajā dienā, kuri disbelieved un neklausīt Messenger vēlēsies tās aizsedz zemes. Un tie būs ne slēpt no Allah [vienu] paziņojumu.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not approach prayer while you are intoxicated until you know what you are saying or in a state of janabah, except those passing through [a place of prayer], until you have washed [your whole body]. And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and find no water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it]. Indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ir uzskats nav pieejas lūgšanu, atrodoties apreibinošu vielu līdz brīdim, kad jūs zināt, ko jūs sakāt, vai janabah, izņemot tos, kas iet caur [lūgšanu vieta], līdz brīdim, kad ir mazgāti [jūsu visu ķermeni] stāvoklī. Ja jūs esat slims vai ceļojumā vai viens no jums nāk no vietas atbrīvojot sevi vai jūs esat sazinājies ar sievietēm un atrast bez ūdens, tad meklēt tīru zemi un noslaukiet jūsu sejas un rokām [ar to]. Patiešām, Allah ir kādreiz Pardoning un piedošanu.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, purchasing error [in exchange for it] and wishing you would lose the way?
trans-unit.target: Jums nav redzējuši tie, kuri tika dota daļa no rakstiem, kas pērk kļūda [apmaiņā pret to] un Novēlot jums zaudēt ceļu?

trans-unit.source: And Allah is most knowing of your enemies; and sufficient is Allah as an ally, and sufficient is Allah as a helper.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah ir visvairāk zinot jūsu ienaidniekiem; pietiekama ir Allah kā sabiedrotais un pietiekama ir Allah, kā palīgs.

trans-unit.source: Among the Jews are those who distort words from their [proper] usages and say, "We hear and disobey" and "Hear but be not heard" and "Ra'ina," twisting their tongues and defaming the religion. And if they had said [instead], "We hear and obey" and "Wait for us [to understand]," it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.
trans-unit.target: Starp ebrejiem ir tie, kas kropļo vārdus, no savām [pareizu] paražas un teikt, "mēs dzirdam un nepakļauties" un "klausīšanās, bet nevar tikt uzklausītam" un "Ra'ina", spiež viņu mēles un neslavas celšanā reliģija. Un, ja viņi būtu teikuši [vietā]: "mēs dzirdam un paklausīt" un "Gaidīt mums [saprast]," tas būtu bijis labāk par viņiem un vairāk piemērots. Bet, Allah ir nejauks tos par viņu neticību, tāpēc viņi uzskata, ka nav, izņemot dažus.

trans-unit.source: O you who were given the Scripture, believe in what We have sent down [to Muhammad], confirming that which is with you, before We obliterate faces and turn them toward their backs or curse them as We cursed the sabbath-breakers. And ever is the decree of Allah accomplished.
trans-unit.target: O kas tika dota rakstiem, kas tic to, ko mēs esam nosūtījuši uz leju [Muhammad] apstiprina, kas ir kopā ar jums, pirms mēs iznīcināt sejas un pārvērst tos pret viņu mugurām vai nolādēt tos kā mēs nejauks sabats drupinātājiem. Un kādreiz ir dekrēts par Allah, kas paveikts.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly fabricated a tremendous sin.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, Allah nepiedod asociācija kopā ar viņu, bet viņš piedod, kas ir mazāka par to, kam viņš vēlas. Un tas, kas citiem ir saistījis ar Allah ir noteikti gatavo milzīgu grēku.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who claim themselves to be pure? Rather, Allah purifies whom He wills, and injustice is not done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].
trans-unit.target: Vai jums nav redzams, ka tiem, kas apgalvo paši būt tīrs Drīzāk, kam viņš vēlas, un netaisnību nav izdarīts, [pat] tāpat kā pavediens [iekšpusē datums sēklu] attīra Allah.

trans-unit.source: Look how they invent about Allah untruth, and sufficient is that as a manifest sin.
trans-unit.target: Skatīties, kā viņi izdomāt par Allah nepatiesība un pietiekami ir tas, ka kā acīmredzamas grēks.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, who believe in superstition and false objects of worship and say about the disbelievers, "These are better guided than the believers as to the way"?
trans-unit.target: Vai jums nav redzams, ka tie, kuri tika dota daļa no rakstiem, kas tic māņticība un viltus pielūgsmes objektus un teikt par disbelievers, "tie labāk vadīties nekā par to, kā ticīgie"

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed; and he whom Allah curses - never will you find for him a helper.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir tie, kuriem ir nejauks Allah; un viņš, kam Allāhs lāstiem - jūs nekad atrast viņa palīgam.

trans-unit.source: Or have they a share of dominion? Then [if that were so], they would not give the people [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
trans-unit.target: Vai tie ir valdīšana daļu? Tad [ja vien tas būtu tik], cilvēki neveiks [pat tik daudz kā] punktiņu uz datumu sēklu.

trans-unit.source: Or do they envy people for what Allah has given them of His bounty? But we had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom and conferred upon them a great kingdom.
trans-unit.target: Vai viņi apskaužu cilvēkus par to Allah ir devis viņiem savas veltes? Bet mēs jau bija devis Abraham ģimeni, rakstos un gudrību un piešķir viņiem liels Karaliste.

trans-unit.source: And some among them believed in it, and some among them were averse to it. And sufficient is Hell as a blaze.
trans-unit.target: Daži no tiem ticēja to un daži no tiem bija negatīvās uz tā. Un pietiekami spoža kā elle.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our verses - We will drive them into a Fire. Every time their skins are roasted through We will replace them with other skins so they may taste the punishment. Indeed, Allah is ever Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kuri neticēt mūsu vārsmas - mēs viņus iedzīt uguni. Katru reizi, kad to apvalki tiek grauzdētas caur mēs tos aizstāj ar citu ādas, tāpēc tās var garša sods. Patiešām, Allah ir cildens kādreiz varētu un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide forever. For them therein are purified spouses, and We will admit them to deepening shade.
trans-unit.target: Bet tie, kam ticēt un darīt taisns darbiem - mēs uzņemt tos dārzi, zem kura upju plūsma, kur tos ievērot uz visiem laikiem. Viņiem tur ir attīrīts laulātie, un mums būs uzņemt tos padziļināt ēnā.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah commands you to render trusts to whom they are due and when you judge between people to judge with justice. Excellent is that which Allah instructs you. Indeed, Allah is ever Hearing and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, Allah komandas jūs padarīt fondi, kuriem tie pienākas un kad jūs tiesnesis starp cilvēkiem ar tiesu spriest. Lieliski ir tas, ko dod norādījumu Allah. Patiešām, Allah ir kādreiz dzirdes un redzēt.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allah and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. That is the best [way] and best in result.
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ticējusi, paklausīt Allah un paklausīt Messenger, un šo iestādi jūsu vidū. Un, ja jūs nepiekrītat, vairāk nekā jebkas, nodot to Allah un Messenger, ja būtu tic Allah un pēdējā dienā. Tas ir labākais [ceļu] un labāko rezultātu.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who claim to have believed in what was revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you? They wish to refer legislation to Taghut, while they were commanded to reject it; and Satan wishes to lead them far astray.
trans-unit.target: Vai jums nav redzams, tiem, kas apgalvo, ka ir uzskats, kas tika atklāts [O Muhammad], un kas tika atklāts pirms jums? Viņi vēlas vērsties tiesību Taghut, kamēr viņi bija pavēlējis noraidīt un sātans grib aizvest tālu apmaldīties.

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger," you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.
trans-unit.target: Un kad tā pagriezās pret viņiem "Nāc Allah ir atklāts un Messenger," jūs redzat liekuļi, pagrieziena virzienā prom no sevis riebums.

trans-unit.source: So how [will it be] when disaster strikes them because of what their hands have put forth and then they come to you swearing by Allah, "We intended nothing but good conduct and accommodation."
trans-unit.target: Tā kā [būtu] kad katastrofa tiem sakarā ar to, ko viņu rokās ir nodot tālāk un tad viņi nāk pie jums nodod zvērestu, Allah, "Mēs paredzēts nekas bet labu uzvedību un izmitināšanu."

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones of whom Allah knows what is in their hearts, so turn away from them but admonish them and speak to them a far-reaching word.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir tie, par kuriem Allah zina, kāda ir viņu sirdis, tātad novērsties no viņiem, bet brīdināt viņus un runāt ar viņiem tālejošas vārdu.

trans-unit.source: And We did not send any messenger except to be obeyed by permission of Allah. And if, when they wronged themselves, they had come to you, [O Muhammad], and asked forgiveness of Allah and the Messenger had asked forgiveness for them, they would have found Allah Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs nesūtīja visas messenger, izņemot lai jāklausa, Allah atļauju. Un, ja viņi paši pāri, viņi bija pasākuši tu [O Muhammad], un lūdza piedošanu un Allah Messenger bija lūdzis piedošanu tiem, viņi ir atraduši Allah pieņemt grēku nožēlošanas un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: But no, by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you, [O Muhammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission.
trans-unit.target: Bet nē, ar savu kungu, tie netiks [patiesi] uzskatu, ka līdz brīdim, kad tie liks jums, [O Muhammad], tiesnesis, attiecībā uz, pār kurām tie strīdu savā starpā un pēc tam atrast sevī nekādas neērtības tas, ko jūs esat spriedis tiesu pār un iesniegt [pilna, gatava] iesniegumā.

trans-unit.source: And if We had decreed upon them, "Kill yourselves" or "Leave your homes," they would not have done it, except for a few of them. But if they had done what they were instructed, it would have been better for them and a firmer position [for them in faith].
trans-unit.target: Un, ja mums bija izsludinājusi pēc tiem, "Nogalināt sevi" vai "Atstāt jūsu mājās," viņi nebūtu darījis, izņemot dažas no tām. Bet ja viņi bija darījis to, ko viņi bija uzdots, būtu bijis labāk, ja viņus un Stingrāka nostāja [labā ticībā].

trans-unit.source: And then We would have given them from Us a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Un tad mums būtu dota tiem no mums lielu atlīdzību.

trans-unit.source: And We would have guided them to a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs varētu vadīties tos ar taisnu ceļu.

trans-unit.source: And whoever obeys Allah and the Messenger - those will be with the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor of the prophets, the steadfast affirmers of truth, the martyrs and the righteous. And excellent are those as companions.
trans-unit.target: Un tas, kurš pakļaujas Allāha un Messenger - tie būs tie, pēc kuriem Allah ir apveltīts ar labu praviešiem, nelokāms affirmers patiesības, mocekļu un taisns. Un lielisks ir tādi kā biedri.

trans-unit.source: That is the bounty from Allah, and sufficient is Allah as Knower.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir devība no Allah un pietiekama ir Allah kā zinātājs.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, take your precaution and [either] go forth in companies or go forth all together.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, lietojat savu piesardzības un [nu] iet tālāk uzņēmumiem vai iet tālāk visi kopā.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, there is among you he who lingers behind; and if disaster strikes you, he says, "Allah has favored me in that I was not present with them."
trans-unit.target: Un patiešām, tur ir jūsu vidū Viņš uzka-vējas aiz; un ja katastrofas, streiki, viņš saka, "Allah ir privileģēts mani, ka es nebiju klāt ar tiem."

trans-unit.source: But if bounty comes to you from Allah, he will surely say, as if there had never been between you and him any affection. "Oh, I wish I had been with them so I could have attained a great attainment."
trans-unit.target: Bet, ja balva nāk pie jums no Allah, viņš droši vien sacīs: kā tad, ja tur vēl nekad nebija bijis starp jums un viņam ne mazākās simpātijas pret viņu. "Ak, es vēlos bija bijusi kopā ar viņiem tāpēc varētu ir sasnieguši lielu sasniegšanai."

trans-unit.source: So let those fight in the cause of Allah who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter. And he who fights in the cause of Allah and is killed or achieves victory - We will bestow upon him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Tātad ļaujiet tiem cīņu cēlonis Allah, kas turpmāk pārdot šīs pasaules dzīvē. Un tas, kurš cīnās Allah cēlonis un ir gājusi bojā vai gūst uzvaru - mēs dāvināt viņam virsū liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: And what is [the matter] with you that you fight not in the cause of Allah and [for] the oppressed among men, women, and children who say, "Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper?"
trans-unit.target: Un kas noticis [] ar jums, ka jūs cīnīties nav iemesls Allah un [] apspiesto vidū vīriešu, sieviešu un bērnu, kuri saka: "Mūsu Kungā, izraut mūs no šīs pilsētas nomācošs cilvēku un iecelt mums no sevis aizsardzība un iecelt mums no sev palīga?"

trans-unit.source: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allah, and those who disbelieve fight in the cause of Taghut. So fight against the allies of Satan. Indeed, the plot of Satan has ever been weak.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kas tic Allah cēlonis cīņā, un tie, kuri neticēt cīņu Taghut cēlonis. Tātad cīņa pret sātanu sabiedrotie. Patiešām, sātana gabals ir bijis vājš.

trans-unit.source: Have you not seen those who were told, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakah"? But then when fighting was ordained for them, at once a party of them feared men as they fear Allah or with [even] greater fear. They said, "Our Lord, why have You decreed upon us fighting? If only You had postponed [it for] us for a short time." Say, The enjoyment of this world is little, and the Hereafter is better for he who fears Allah. And injustice will not be done to you, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed]."
trans-unit.target: Vai jums nav redzams, ka tiem, kas tika teikts, ka "Ierobežot jūsu rokās [no cīņas pret] un izveidot lūgšanu un dot zakah" Bet tad, kad cīnās par viņiem tika ordinēts, uzreiz puse no tiem baidījās vīriešiem tās bailes Allah vai [vēl] lielākas bailes. Viņi teica: "mūsu kungs, kāpēc jums ir izsludinājusi pār mums cīnās? Ja vien jums bija jāatliek [to] mums uz īsu brīdi. " Teikt, prieks šajā pasaulē ir maz, un turpmāk ir labāk, lai viņš, kurš baidās no Allah. Un netaisnību nav izdarīts, [pat] tāpat kā pavediens [iekšpusē datums sēklu]."

trans-unit.source: Wherever you may be, death will overtake you, even if you should be within towers of lofty construction. But if good comes to them, they say, "This is from Allah "; and if evil befalls them, they say, "This is from you." Say, "All [things] are from Allah." So what is [the matter] with those people that they can hardly understand any statement?
trans-unit.target: Kur vien iespējams, nāves pārsniegs, pat tad, ja jūs būtu cēls konstrukcijas torņi. Bet ja labu nāk viņiem, viņi saka: "Tas ir no Allah"; un, ja ļaunums befalls viņiem, viņi saka: "tas ir no jums." Teiksim, "visas lietas ir no Allah." Tātad kas notiek [] ar tiem cilvēkiem, ka viņi diez vai var saprast jebkuru paziņojumu?

trans-unit.source: What comes to you of good is from Allah, but what comes to you of evil, [O man], is from yourself. And We have sent you, [O Muhammad], to the people as a messenger, and sufficient is Allah as Witness.
trans-unit.target: Kas nāk par labu, ir no Allah, bet kas nāk par ļaunu, [O vīrs] ir no sevis. Mēs esam nosūtījuši jums [O Muhammad], cilvēki kā kurjers un pietiekama ir Allah kā liecinieks.

trans-unit.source: He who obeys the Messenger has obeyed Allah; but those who turn away - We have not sent you over them as a guardian.
trans-unit.target: Viņš, kurš paklausa Messenger ir paklausīja Allah; bet tie, kuri savukārt prom - mums nav nosūtīti jums pār viņiem kā sargs.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "[We pledge] obedience." But when they leave you, a group of them spend the night determining to do other than what you say. But Allah records what they plan by night. So leave them alone and rely upon Allah. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: Un viņi saka: "[mēs ķīlu] paklausība." Bet, kad tie atstāj jums, grupa tos pavadīt nakti, nosakot to darīt, izņemot to, ko jūs sakāt. Bet Allāha fiksē to, ko viņi plānu līdz vakaram. Tātad lieciet viņus mierā un paļauties uz Allah. Un pietiekami Allah kā lietu aizvākšanu.

trans-unit.source: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur'an? If it had been from [any] other than Allah, they would have found within it much contradiction.
trans-unit.target: Tad tie neatspoguļo uz Qur? Ja tas būtu bijis no [] izņemot Allah, viņi ir atraduši tajā daudz pretrunu.

trans-unit.source: And when there comes to them information about [public] security or fear, they spread it around. But if they had referred it back to the Messenger or to those of authority among them, then the ones who [can] draw correct conclusions from it would have known about it. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have followed Satan, except for a few.
trans-unit.target: Un tad, kad tām pienāk informācija par [valsts] drošības vai bailes, tās izplatību, tai apkārt. Bet, ja viņi bija nodevusi atpakaļ Messenger vai iestādes starpā, tad tie, kas var izdarīt pareizu secinājumu no tā būtu zināms par to. Un ja ne par Allah favor pēc jums un viņa žēlsirdība, jums būtu sekojusi sātans, izņemot dažus.

trans-unit.source: So fight, [O Muhammad], in the cause of Allah; you are not held responsible except for yourself. And encourage the believers [to join you] that perhaps Allah will restrain the [military] might of those who disbelieve. And Allah is greater in might and stronger in [exemplary] punishment.
trans-unit.target: Lai cīņa, [O Muhammad] iemesls Allah; ir nevar saukt pie atbildības, izņemot sevi. Un mudinātu ticīgo [pievienoties jums] varbūt Allah būs savaldīt [militāro] iespējams, kuri neticēt. Un Allah ir lielāka spēka un spēcīgāku [priekšzīmīga] sods.

trans-unit.source: Whoever intercedes for a good cause will have a reward therefrom; and whoever intercedes for an evil cause will have a burden therefrom. And ever is Allah, over all things, a Keeper.
trans-unit.target: Tas, kurš aizbildina par labu iemeslu būs atlīdzība un kurš aizbildina par ļaunuma cēlonis būs apgrūtinājums tiem. Un vispār Allāham, pār visām lietām, apsaimniekotājs.

trans-unit.source: And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet [in return] with one better than it or [at least] return it [in a like manner]. Indeed, Allah is ever, over all things, an Accountant.
trans-unit.target: Un kad jūs sveic ar sveicienu, [savukārt] sasveicināties ar vienu labāks par to, vai [vismaz] atgriež to [līdzīgā veidā]. Patiešām, Allah ir kādreiz, pār visām lietām, grāmatvede.

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him. He will surely assemble you for [account on] the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. And who is more truthful than Allah in statement.
trans-unit.target: Allah - nav neviens, izņemot viņu dievība. Viņš jums noteikti organizēsim [kontam] augšāmcelšanās dienā, par kuru nav šaubu. Un kas ir vairāk nekā Allah pārskatā patiesu.

trans-unit.source: What is [the matter] with you [that you are] two groups concerning the hypocrites, while Allah has made them fall back [into error and disbelief] for what they earned. Do you wish to guide those whom Allah has sent astray? And he whom Allah sends astray - never will you find for him a way [of guidance].
trans-unit.target: Kas lēcies [ka jums ir] [lietu] divās grupās, kas attiecas uz liekuļi, kamēr Allah ir veikusi tām atkrist atpakaļ [kļūda un neticība] par to, ko viņi nopelnījuši. Vai vēlaties, lai palīdzētu tiem, kam Allāhs ir nosūtījusi apmaldīties? Un viņš, kam Allāhs sūta apmaldīties - jūs nekad atrast viņu veids, kā [vadlīnijas].

trans-unit.source: They wish you would disbelieve as they disbelieved so you would be alike. So do not take from among them allies until they emigrate for the cause of Allah. But if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them and take not from among them any ally or helper.
trans-unit.target: Viņi vēlas, kā viņi disbelieved tāpēc jums būtu līdzīgi vai neticēt. Tātad nebūt ne-apejos no tiem sabiedrotajiem, līdz tie emigrē Allah cēlonis. Bet, ja tās novērsties, tad tos konfiscēt un nogalināt tos, kur tos atrast un veikt nevis no tām jebkādu sabiedrotais vai palīgs.

trans-unit.source: Except for those who take refuge with a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty or those who come to you, their hearts strained at [the prospect of] fighting you or fighting their own people. And if Allah had willed, He could have given them power over you, and they would have fought you. So if they remove themselves from you and do not fight you and offer you peace, then Allah has not made for you a cause [for fighting] against them.
trans-unit.target: Izņemot tos, kuri patvērumu ar cilvēkiem, starp sevi un kuriem ir līgums, vai tiem, kas nāk pie jums, savās sirdīs saspringa, iedomājoties vien [par] jūs cīņa vai cīņa pret saviem cilvēkiem. Un, ja Allāha gribas, viņš varētu būt, ņemot vērā viņiem varu pār jums, un tie būtu cīnījušies jums. Tātad ja tās izņemt sevi no jums, nevis jūs cīnīties un piedāvāju jums mieru, tad Allah nav veicis jums rada [cīņā] pret viņiem.

trans-unit.source: You will find others who wish to obtain security from you and [to] obtain security from their people. Every time they are returned to [the influence of] disbelief, they fall back into it. So if they do not withdraw from you or offer you peace or restrain their hands, then seize them and kill them wherever you overtake them. And those - We have made for you against them a clear authorization.
trans-unit.target: Jūs atradīsiet citiem, kuri vēlas saņemt nodrošinājumu, no jums un [] iegūtu drošību, no savas tautas. Katru reizi, kad tie tiek atgriezti [ietekmi] neticība, viņi nonāk atpakaļ tajā. Tātad, ja viņi nevar izstāties no jums piedāvāju jums mieru vai aizkavē viņu rokās, tad tos konfiscēt un nogalināt tos, kur jūs noķert tos. Otri - esam devuši jums, pret tiem skaidra atļauja.

trans-unit.source: And never is it for a believer to kill a believer except by mistake. And whoever kills a believer by mistake - then the freeing of a believing slave and a compensation payment presented to the deceased's family [is required] unless they give [up their right as] charity. But if the deceased was from a people at war with you and he was a believer - then [only] the freeing of a believing slave; and if he was from a people with whom you have a treaty - then a compensation payment presented to his family and the freeing of a believing slave. And whoever does not find [one or cannot afford to buy one] - then [instead], a fast for two months consecutively, [seeking] acceptance of repentance from Allah. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Un nekad nav to nejauši nogalināt ticīgais, izņemot ticīgais. Un tas, kurš nogalina ticīgais nejauši - tad atbrīvošana ticēt vergu un kompensācijas maksājumu, kas uzrāda mirušā ģimenes [ir], ja vien viņi atdot [savas tiesības kā] labdarība. Bet, ja mirušais bija no cilvēkiem, kas karo, un viņš bija ticīgais - tad [tikai] ticēt vergu, atbrīvojot un, ja viņš bija no cilvēkiem, ar kuriem jums ir līgums - tad kompensācijas maksājumu iepazīstināja ar savu ģimeni un ticēt vergu atbrīvošanu. Un kurš neatrod [vienu vai nevar atļauties nopirkt vienu]-[vietā], tad ātru divus mēnešus pēc kārtas, [meklē] pieņemšana no Allah nožēlošana. Un Allah ir jebkad zinot un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and has prepared for him a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Bet tas, kurš nogalina ticīgais tīši - viņa atlīdzība ir elli, kur viņš mūžīgi būs ciest un Allah ir kļuvis dusmīgs ar viņu un ir nolādēts viņam ir sagatavojis viņam liels sods.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you go forth [to fight] in the cause of Allah, investigate; and do not say to one who gives you [a greeting of] peace "You are not a believer," aspiring for the goods of worldly life; for with Allah are many acquisitions. You [yourselves] were like that before; then Allah conferred His favor upon you, so investigate. Indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, kad iet tālāk [cīņā] Allah, iemesls izpētīt; un nav teikt vienu, kas dod jums [sveicienam] miera "jums nav ticīgs," sapņot par precēm no pasaulīgās dzīves; ar Allah ir daudz iegādēm. [Sev] bijāt tāds agrāk; pēc tam Allah piešķirto viņa favor pār jums, lai izmeklētu. Patiešām Allah ir jebkad agrāk, ar to, ko jūs darīt, iepazinies.

trans-unit.source: Not equal are those believers remaining [at home] - other than the disabled - and the mujahideen, [who strive and fight] in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives. Allah has preferred the mujahideen through their wealth and their lives over those who remain [behind], by degrees. And to both Allah has promised the best [reward]. But Allah has preferred the mujahideen over those who remain [behind] with a great reward -
trans-unit.target: Nav vienāda ir šos atlikušos [home] - Izņemot invalīdu - ticīgie un mujahideen, [kas censties un cīnīties] Allah cēloni ar savu bagātību un savu dzīvi. Allah priekšroku mujahideen caur savu bagātību un savu dzīvi vairāk nekā tiem, kuri paliek [aiz], grādiem. Un lai gan Allah ir apsolījis labāko [atlīdzība]. Bet Allah ir preferred mujahideen pār tiem, kas paliek liela atlīdzība - [aiz]

trans-unit.source: Degrees [of high position] from Him and forgiveness and mercy. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Pakāpes [augstas pozīcijas] no viņu un piedošanas un žēlsirdība. Un Allah ir kādreiz piedodošs un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those whom the angels take [in death] while wronging themselves - [the angels] will say, "In what [condition] were you?" They will say, "We were oppressed in the land." The angels will say, "Was not the earth of Allah spacious [enough] for you to emigrate therein?" For those, their refuge is Hell - and evil it is as a destination.
trans-unit.target: Patiesi, tos, ko eņģeļi ņemt [nāves] vienlaikus wronging paši - [angels] teiks: "ar ko [stāvokļa] tu biji?" Viņi saka, "Mums bija apspiesto zemi." Eņģeļi teiks, "Nebija Allah [gana] plašuma, jums emigrēt tajā zemes?" Tiem, to patvērumu ir elle - un ļauno ir kā galamērķi.

trans-unit.source: Except for the oppressed among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan nor are they directed to a way -
trans-unit.target: Izņemot apspiesto vidū vīrieši, sievietes un bērni, kuri nevar izstrādāt plānu, ne tie vērsti uz ceļu - ir

trans-unit.source: For those it is expected that Allah will pardon them, and Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, paredzams, ka Allah atvainot tos, un Allah ir kādreiz Pardoning un piedošanu.

trans-unit.source: And whoever emigrates for the cause of Allah will find on the earth many [alternative] locations and abundance. And whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allah and His Messenger and then death overtakes him - his reward has already become incumbent upon Allah. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un kurš emigrates Allah iemeslu atradīs uz zemes daudz [alternatīva] vietās un pārpilnību. Un tas, kurš atstāj savu māju kā emigrants Allah un viņa Messenger un pēc tam nāve viņu panāk - viņa atlīdzība ir kļuvis jau uzlikts Allah. Un Allah ir kādreiz piedodošs un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And when you travel throughout the land, there is no blame upon you for shortening the prayer, [especially] if you fear that those who disbelieve may disrupt [or attack] you. Indeed, the disbelievers are ever to you a clear enemy.
trans-unit.target: Un, kad jums ceļot visā zemē, nav nekādas vainas pār jums lūgšanu, saīsinot [it] Ja jums bailes, ka tiem, kuri neticēt var sagraut [vai uzbrukuma]. Patiešām, disbelievers ir kādreiz jums skaidru ienaidnieks.

trans-unit.source: And when you are among them and lead them in prayer, let a group of them stand [in prayer] with you and let them carry their arms. And when they have prostrated, let them be [in position] behind you and have the other group come forward which has not [yet] prayed and let them pray with you, taking precaution and carrying their arms. Those who disbelieve wish that you would neglect your weapons and your baggage so they could come down upon you in one [single] attack. But there is no blame upon you, if you are troubled by rain or are ill, for putting down your arms, but take precaution. Indeed, Allah has prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Un kad esat starp tiem un radīt viņiem lūgšanā, ļaujiet grupa no viņiem stāvēt [lūgšanā] kopā ar jums un ļaujiet viņiem veikt savus ieročus. Un, kad viņi ir Džo-Ans, ļaujiet viņiem būt [pozīcija] aiz jums un ir otra grupa nāks klajā kas nav [vēl] lūdza un ļaut viņiem lūdzieties kopā ar tevi, piesardzīgi, un kurš pārvadā ieročus. Tiem, kuri neticēt kaut ka jūs varētu neņemt ieročus un jūsu bagāžu, lai viņi varētu nokāpt pār jums viens [vienu] uzbrukums. Bet nav nekādas vainas pēc, ja ir gadījies lietus vai slikti par savu ieroču nolikšanu, bet veikt piesardzības pasākumus. Patiešām, Allah ir sagatavojusi disbelievers pazemojoša sodīšana.

trans-unit.source: And when you have completed the prayer, remember Allah standing, sitting, or [lying] on your sides. But when you become secure, re-establish [regular] prayer. Indeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers a decree of specified times.
trans-unit.target: Un, kad esat pabeidzis lūgšanu, atcerieties Allah stāv, sēž vai jūsu puses [guļ]. Bet kad tu kļūsti drošs, atjaunotu [regulāru] lūgšanu. Patiešām, lūgšanu pasludinot pēc laulības noteiktos laikos ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: And do not weaken in pursuit of the enemy. If you should be suffering - so are they suffering as you are suffering, but you expect from Allah that which they expect not. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Un nedrīkst vājināt saskaņā ar ienaidnieku. Ja jūs cieš - Tātad tie cieš kā jūs cieš, bet jūs sagaidāt no Allah, ko viņi nevar sagaidīt. Un Allah ir jebkad zinot un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth so you may judge between the people by that which Allah has shown you. And do not be for the deceitful an advocate.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, mēs atklāja jums [O Muhammad] patiesību, tāpēc varam spriest starp cilvēkiem, kas Allah ir parādījusi, jūs grāmatu. Un nedrīkst būt maldinošs par advokātu.

trans-unit.source: And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un lūgt piedošanu par Allah. Patiešām, Allah ir kādreiz piedodošs un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves. Indeed, Allah loves not one who is a habitually sinful deceiver.
trans-unit.target: Un nestrīdieties vārdā tiem, kuri sevi maldināt. Patiešām, Allah mīl nevis vienu, kas ir pastāvīgi grēcīgs blēdis.

trans-unit.source: They conceal [their evil intentions and deeds] from the people, but they cannot conceal [them] from Allah, and He is with them [in His knowledge] when they spend the night in such as He does not accept of speech. And ever is Allah, of what they do, encompassing.
trans-unit.target: Viņi slēpj [to ļauno nodomiem un darbiem] no cilvēkiem, bet viņi nevar noslēpt [tiem] no Allah, un viņš ir ar tiem [viņa zināšanas] kad viņi pavadīt nakti, kā viņš nepieņem runas. Un vispār Allāham, ko viņi dara, aptver.

trans-unit.source: Here you are - those who argue on their behalf in [this] worldly life - but who will argue with Allah for them on the Day of Resurrection, or who will [then] be their representative?
trans-unit.target: Šeit jums ir - tiem, kas apgalvo, viņu vārdā [šo] laicīgo dzīvi - bet kurš apgalvos ar Allah viņiem par augšāmcelšanās dienu vai [tad] kurš būs viņu pārstāvis?

trans-unit.source: And whoever does a wrong or wrongs himself but then seeks forgiveness of Allah will find Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un tas, kurš dara nepareizi vai pats netaisnības, bet pēc tam lūdz piedošanu par Allah atradīsiet Allah piedodošs un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And whoever commits a sin only earns it against himself. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Un tikai tas, kurš uzņemas grēku pelna to pret sevi. Un Allah ir jebkad zinot un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: But whoever earns an offense or a sin and then blames it on an innocent [person] has taken upon himself a slander and manifest sin.
trans-unit.target: Bet tas, kurš pelna apvainojums vai grēks un tad vaino to par nevainīgu [persona] ir veikusi uz sevis neslava un manifestu grēks.

trans-unit.source: And if it was not for the favor of Allah upon you, [O Muhammad], and His mercy, a group of them would have determined to mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they will not harm you at all. And Allah has revealed to you the Book and wisdom and has taught you that which you did not know. And ever has the favor of Allah upon you been great.
trans-unit.target: Un ja tas nav favor Allah būtu noteikuši maldināt. Bet tie nemaldina, izņemot sevi, un tie nedrīkst kaitēt jums vispār. Un Allah atklāja jums grāmatu un gudrība māca jums to, ko jūs nezināt. Un kādreiz ir Allāha pār jums bijis liels favor.

trans-unit.source: No good is there in much of their private conversation, except for those who enjoin charity or that which is right or conciliation between people. And whoever does that seeking means to the approval of Allah - then We are going to give him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Nav labi vai ir daudz to privātu sarunu, izņemot tos, kuri liek labdarības vai to, kas ir labi vai samierināšanu starp cilvēkiem. Un tas, kurš dara tas meklē nozīmē apstiprinājumu par Allah - tad mēs gatavojamies dot viņam lielu atlīdzību.

trans-unit.source: And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination.
trans-unit.target: Un tas, kurš iebilst pret kurjers pēc virzības ir kļuvis skaidrs, viņam un šādā veidā, kas nav ticīgie - veidā mums dot viņam to, ko viņš ir veicis un vedu uz elli, un ļauno ir kā galamērķi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly gone far astray.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, Allah nepiedod asociācija kopā ar viņu, bet viņš piedod, kas ir mazāka par to, kam viņš vēlas. Un tas, kas citiem ir saistījis ar Allah noteikti ir aizgājusi tālu apmaldīties.

trans-unit.source: They call upon instead of Him none but female [deities], and they [actually] call upon none but a rebellious Satan.
trans-unit.target: Viņi aicina viņu vietā, neviens, bet sieviete [dievības], un viņi [faktiski] pieaicināt neviens taču dumpīgs sātans.

trans-unit.source: Whom Allah has cursed. For he had said, "I will surely take from among Your servants a specific portion.
trans-unit.target: Kam Allāhs ir nejauks. Viņš sacīja, "es noteikti veiks kādu no jūsu darbiniekiem noteiktas daļas.

trans-unit.source: And I will mislead them, and I will arouse in them [sinful] desires, and I will command them so they will slit the ears of cattle, and I will command them so they will change the creation of Allah." And whoever takes Satan as an ally instead of Allah has certainly sustained a clear loss.
trans-unit.target: Un man būs maldināt tos, būs modina viņos [grēcīgs] vēlmes un es pavēlu viņiem, lai viņi būs pārgriezis lopu ausis, un es komanda viņus, lai viņi mainīs Allah izveidi." Un tas, kurš uzņemas sātans kā sabiedrotais, nevis Allah noteikti cietusi skaidrus zaudējums.

trans-unit.source: Satan promises them and arouses desire in them. But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
trans-unit.target: Sātans tiem solījumiem un modina viņos vēlmi. Bet sātans nesola tos, izņemot maldi.

trans-unit.source: The refuge of those will be Hell, and they will not find from it an escape.
trans-unit.target: Patvērumu no tiem būs elle, un viņi neatradīs no tā aizbēgt.

trans-unit.source: But the ones who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. [It is] the promise of Allah, [which is] truth, and who is more truthful than Allah in statement.
trans-unit.target: Bet tie, kas domāt un darīt taisns darbiem - mēs uzņemt tos uz dārziem, zem kura upju plūsma, kur tos ievērot uz visiem laikiem. [Ir] solījumu par Allah, [kas ir] patiesība, un kas ir vairāk nekā Allah pārskatā patiesu.

trans-unit.source: Paradise is not [obtained] by your wishful thinking nor by that of the People of the Scripture. Whoever does a wrong will be recompensed for it, and he will not find besides Allah a protector or a helper.
trans-unit.target: Paradīze nav [iegūst] karojošs domāšana, ne ka rakstos cilvēki. Tas, kurš dara pāri recompensed par to, un viņš nevar atrast papildus Allah aizsargs vai palīgs.

trans-unit.source: And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer - those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged, [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
trans-unit.target: Un kurš nav taisns darbiem, vai vīrietis vai sieviete, būdami ticīgais - šie ievadiet paradīze un nav nodarījis, [pat tik daudz kā] punktiņu uz datumu sēklu.

trans-unit.source: And who is better in religion than one who submits himself to Allah while being a doer of good and follows the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth? And Allah took Abraham as an intimate friend.
trans-unit.target: Un kas ir reliģija ir labākas nekā vienas, kas apgalvo pats Allah, būdams labs izpildītājs un seko reliģiju Abraham, piešķiebdama pret patiesību? Un Allah ņēma Abraham kā intīms draugs.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allah, of all things, encompassing.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah pieder kāds ir debesīs un kāds ir uz zemes. Un kādreiz ir Allah, visas lietas, ietverot.

trans-unit.source: And they request from you, [O Muhammad], a [legal] ruling concerning women. Say, "Allah gives you a ruling about them and [about] what has been recited to you in the Book concerning the orphan girls to whom you do not give what is decreed for them - and [yet] you desire to marry them - and concerning the oppressed among children and that you maintain for orphans [their rights] in justice." And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is ever Knowing of it.
trans-unit.target: Un tie pieprasa no jums [O Muhammad] [tiesību] nolēmumu attiecībā uz sievietēm. Teiksim, "Allah dod nolēmumu par viņiem un [] kāda ir skaitīja tev grāmatu attiecībā uz reti sastopamu slimību ārstēšanai meitenēm, kam nedot, ko izsludinājusi par viņiem - un [vēl] vēlies precēties tos - un attiecībā uz apspiesto bērnu vidū un kas uztur bāreņiem [tiesībām] tieslietu". Un neatkarīgi no jums par labu - patiešām, Allah ir kādreiz zināt par to.

trans-unit.source: And if a woman fears from her husband contempt or evasion, there is no sin upon them if they make terms of settlement between them - and settlement is best. And present in [human] souls is stinginess. But if you do good and fear Allah - then indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja sieviete baidās no viņas vīrs noniecināt vai izvairīšanos no nodokļu maksāšanas, ir grēks viņiem virsū, ja tos vienādotu norēķināšanās starp tām - un norēķinu ir labākais. Un klāt [cilvēka] dvēseles skopumu. Bet, ja jūs darīt labu un bailes Allah -, tad patiešām kādreiz ir Allah, ar ko tu iepazīties.

trans-unit.source: And you will never be able to be equal [in feeling] between wives, even if you should strive [to do so]. So do not incline completely [toward one] and leave another hanging. And if you amend [your affairs] and fear Allah - then indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un jūs nekad nespēs būt vienāds [sajūta] starp sievām, pat ja jums ir jācenšas [to]. Tātad nav slīpums pilnībā [pret vienu] un atstāt vēl piekārtiem. Un ja grozītu [savu lietu] un bailes Allah - tad tiešām, Allah ir kādreiz piedodošs un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: But if they separate [by divorce], Allah will enrich each [of them] from His abundance. And ever is Allah Encompassing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Bet ja viņi atsevišķas [laulības šķiršanas], Allah bagātināt katra [tiem] no viņa pārpilnību. Un kādreiz ir Allah aptver un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And We have instructed those who were given the Scripture before you and yourselves to fear Allah. But if you disbelieve - then to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allah Free of need and Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah pieder kāds ir debesīs un kāds ir uz zemes. Un mums ir uzdot tiem, kuri tika dota pirms jums un sev bailes Allah rakstos. Bet ja jums neticēt - tad lai Allāhs pieder kāds ir debesīs un kāds ir uz zemes. Un kādreiz ir nepieciešams bez Allah un Praiseworthy.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah pieder kāds ir debesīs un kāds ir uz zemes. Un pietiekami Allah kā lietu aizvākšanu.

trans-unit.source: If He wills, He can do away with you, O people, and bring others [in your place]. And ever is Allah competent to do that.
trans-unit.target: Ja viņš vēlas, viņš var darīt prom ar jums O cilvēku un jāiesaista citi [vieta]. Un kādreiz ir Allah, kas ir kompetenta to darīt.

trans-unit.source: Whoever desires the reward of this world - then with Allah is the reward of this world and the Hereafter. And ever is Allah Hearing and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Kurš vēlas atlīdzību šajā pasaulē - tad ar Allah ir atlīdzība par šo pasauli un turpmāk. Un kādreiz ir Allah dzirdēt un redzēt.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm in justice, witnesses for Allah, even if it be against yourselves or parents and relatives. Whether one is rich or poor, Allah is more worthy of both. So follow not [personal] inclination, lest you not be just. And if you distort [your testimony] or refuse [to give it], then indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, esiet ilgstoši stāv firm tiesu lieciniekus par Allāhu, pat tad, ja tas būtu pret sevi vai vecākiem un radiniekiem. Vai viens ir bagāts vai nabags, Allah ir vairāk vērta abus. Lai sekotu ne [personas] slīpumu, nedrīkstam arī nevar būt vienkārši. Un, ja jūs traucēt [jūsu liecība] vai atteikties [tā], tad patiešām Allah ir jebkad agrāk, ar to, ko jūs darīt, iepazīties.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger and the Scripture which He sent down before. And whoever disbelieves in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day has certainly gone far astray.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, tic Allah un viņa Messenger un grāmatu, ka viņš nosūtīts uz leju pēc viņa Messenger un svēto rakstu, kurā viņš sūtīja lejā pirms. Un tas, kurš disbelieves Allah, viņa eņģeļi, viņa grāmatas, viņa kurjeriem un pēdējā dienā noteikti ir aizgājusi tālu apmaldīties.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed then disbelieved, then believed, then disbelieved, and then increased in disbelief - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a way.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kas ticēja, tad disbelieved, pēc tam ticēja, tad disbelieved un tad pieaugošā neticība - nekad netiks Allah piedot tiem, nedz viņš palīdzēs viņiem tā.

trans-unit.source: Give tidings to the hypocrites that there is for them a painful punishment -
trans-unit.target: Dot vēstis liekuļi, ka tur ir viņiem sāpīgo sods-

trans-unit.source: Those who take disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do they seek with them honor [through power]? But indeed, honor belongs to Allah entirely.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kas disbelievers kā sabiedrotie, tā vietā, lai ticīgie. Viņi meklē ar viņiem godu [varas] caur? Bet patiešām, gods pieder Allah pilnībā.

trans-unit.source: And it has already come down to you in the Book that when you hear the verses of Allah [recited], they are denied [by them] and ridiculed; so do not sit with them until they enter into another conversation. Indeed, you would then be like them. Indeed Allah will gather the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell all together -
trans-unit.target: Un tas jau nokritusies līdz jūs grāmatā, ka kad jūs dzirdat Allah [skaitīja] panti, tie ir liegusi [tiem] un izsmietas; Tātad nevis pasēdēt kopā ar viņiem, līdz tie stājas cita saruna. Protams, jūs tad būtu līdzīgi tiem. Patiešām Allah pulcēsies liekuļi un disbelievers ellē visi kopā-

trans-unit.source: Those who wait [and watch] you. Then if you gain a victory from Allah, they say, "Were we not with you?" But if the disbelievers have a success, they say [to them], "Did we not gain the advantage over you, but we protected you from the believers?" Allah will judge between [all of] you on the Day of Resurrection, and never will Allah give the disbelievers over the believers a way [to overcome them].
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kas gaidīt [un skatīties]. Tad, ja jums gūt uzvaru no Allah, saka: "tie mums nav ar jums?" Bet ja disbelievers ir veiksmīga, viņi saki [tiem], "mums nav iegūt priekšrocības pār jums, bet mēs jūs aizsargā no ticīgo?" Allah vērtēs starp [visi] tu augšāmcelšanās dienu un gribu Allah piekāpsies disbelievers pār ticīgajiem [pārvarēšanai].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the hypocrites [think to] deceive Allah, but He is deceiving them. And when they stand for prayer, they stand lazily, showing [themselves to] the people and not remembering Allah except a little,
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, liekuļi [domāju lai] maldināt Allah, bet viņš ir maldinot viņus. Un kad viņi kandidēt lūgšanu, viņi stāvēt slinki, rāda [viņiem] cilvēki un nevar atcerēties Allah maz, izņemot

trans-unit.source: Wavering between them, [belonging] neither to the believers nor to the disbelievers. And whoever Allah leaves astray - never will you find for him a way.
trans-unit.target: Svārstīšanās starp tiem ticīgajiem, nedz arī lai disbelievers [pieder]. Un tas, kurš atstāj apmaldīties Allah - nekad jūs atradīsiet viņu veidā.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do you wish to give Allah against yourselves a clear case?
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, neesat lietojis disbelievers kā sabiedrotie, tā vietā, lai ticīgie. Vai jūs vēlaties dot Allah pret sev skaidru lietu?

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire - and never will you find for them a helper -
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, liekuļi būs viszemākais galējā uguns - un nekad jūs atradīsiet tos palīgs-

trans-unit.source: Except for those who repent, correct themselves, hold fast to Allah, and are sincere in their religion for Allah, for those will be with the believers. And Allah is going to give the believers a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Izņemot tos, kas nožēlot, labot paši, turiet ātri Allah un ir patiesi viņu reliģijas par Allāhu, tiem būs ar ticīgie. Un Allah ir gonna dot ticīgajiem liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: What would Allah do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe? And ever is Allah Appreciative and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Allah darītu ar savu sodu, ja jums ir pateicīgi un uzskatu? Un kādreiz ir Allah Appreciative un zinot.

trans-unit.source: Allah does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Allah nepatīk valsts pieminēšana ļaunumu, izņemot vienu, kas ir nodarīts kaitējums. Un kādreiz ir Allah dzirdes un zinot.

trans-unit.source: If [instead] you show [some] good or conceal it or pardon an offense - indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Competent.
trans-unit.target: Ja [vietā] rāda [kaut] labs vai to noslēpt vai apžēlot apvainojums - patiešām, Allah ir kādreiz Pardoning un kompetenti.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers and wish to discriminate between Allah and His messengers and say, "We believe in some and disbelieve in others," and wish to adopt a way in between -
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kuri neticēt Allah un viņa kurjeriem un vēlme diskriminēt starp Allāhu kurjeriem un teikt: "Mēs ticam, ka daži un neticēt arī citās valstīs," un vēlas pieņemt ceļu starp-

trans-unit.source: Those are the disbelievers, truly. And We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir patiesi disbelievers. Un mēs esam gatavi disbelievers pazemojoša sodīšana.

trans-unit.source: But they who believe in Allah and His messengers and do not discriminate between any of them - to those He is going to give their rewards. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Bet tie, kuri tic Allah un viņa kurjeriem un nediskriminē nevienu no tiem - tiem viņš gatavojas dot savu atlīdzības. Un kādreiz ir Allah piedodošs un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: The People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven. But they had asked of Moses [even] greater than that and said, "Show us Allah outright," so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf [for worship] after clear evidences had come to them, and We pardoned that. And We gave Moses a clear authority.
trans-unit.target: Rakstos cilvēki lūgs samazināt viņiem grāmatu no debesīm. Bet tie bija lūdzis Moses [pat] lielāks un teica: "Mums rāda Allah turnīra," tāpēc zibens spēriens pārsteidza viņus par viņu grēks. Tad viņi paņēma teļš [dievkalpojumiem] pēc skaidras liecības ieradusies pie viņiem un mums tas apžēlots. Un mēs likām Moses skaidrs iestādes.

trans-unit.source: And We raised over them the mount for [refusal of] their covenant; and We said to them, "Enter the gate bowing humbly", and We said to them, "Do not transgress on the sabbath", and We took from them a solemn covenant.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs pacēlām virs tām mount [atteikumam] tās karagājienu; Mēs viņiem teica: "Ievadiet palocīdamies pazemīgi vārtiem", un mēs sacīja tiem, "nedrīkst pārkāpt par sabatu", un mēs ņēmām no viņiem svinīgu derību.

trans-unit.source: And [We cursed them] for their breaking of the covenant and their disbelief in the signs of Allah and their killing of the prophets without right and their saying, "Our hearts are wrapped". Rather, Allah has sealed them because of their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.
trans-unit.target: Un [mēs tos nejauks] to sadalīšana pilsētas mēru un to Allah pazīmes, neticība un viņu nogalināšanas pravieši bez tiesībām un viņu sakot, "mūsu sirdis ir iesaiņoti". Drīzāk, Allah ir noslēgti viņiem sakarā ar viņu neticību, tāpēc viņi uzskata, ka nav, izņemot dažus.

trans-unit.source: And [We cursed them] for their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander,
trans-unit.target: Un [mēs tos nejauks] viņu neticību un to pasakot pret Mariju liela neslava,

trans-unit.source: And [for] their saying, "Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the messenger of Allah." And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but [another] was made to resemble him to them. And indeed, those who differ over it are in doubt about it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption. And they did not kill him, for certain.
trans-unit.target: Un [] to sakot: "patiešām, mums ir nogalināti Mesija, Jēzus, Marija, messenger Allah dēls." Un viņi nemēdz nogalināt viņu, nedz arī viņi bija krustā viņu; taču viņam līdzināties tām [vēl] netika veikts. Un patiešām, atšķiras vairāk nekā to, kuri ir šaubas par to. Viņiem nav zināšanu par to, izņemot šādu pieņēmumu. Un tie nav nogalināt viņu, dažiem.

trans-unit.source: Rather, Allah raised him to Himself. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Pareizāk sakot, Allah izcēlām viņu pie sevis. Un kādreiz ir var un gudrs cildens Allah.

trans-unit.source: And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in Jesus before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection he will be against them a witness.
trans-unit.target: Un nav neviena no rakstos tautas, bet, ka viņš noteikti tic Jēzus pirms viņa nāves. Un augšāmcelšanās dienā viņš būs pret viņiem liecinieks.

trans-unit.source: For wrongdoing on the part of the Jews, We made unlawful for them [certain] good foods which had been lawful to them, and for their averting from the way of Allah many [people],
trans-unit.target: Lai noziegums no ebrejiem, mēs veicām nelikumīgu viņiem [konkrētu] laba pārtika, kas bijusi likumīga viņiem un par viņu aizgriezt no Allah veidā daudz [cilvēku],

trans-unit.source: And [for] their taking of usury while they had been forbidden from it, and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly. And we have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: [Kā] to augļošanu, kamēr viņi bija aizliegts no tā pieņemšanas un to patērē tautas bagātības netaisnīgi. Un mēs esam gatavi disbelievers starp tiem sāpīgi sods.

trans-unit.source: But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you. And the establishers of prayer [especially] and the givers of zakah and the believers in Allah and the Last Day - those We will give a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Bet šīs sabiedrības zināšanas tos un ticīgo uzskatu, ko atklāja jums [O Muhammad], un kas tika atklāts pirms jums. Un lūgšanu establishers [it] un zakah un ticīgie Allah un pēdējā diena - tiem, kas mums dos lielu balvu devēji.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, mums ir atklāts jums [O Muhammad], kā mums parādīja Noah un pravieši viņam pakaļ. Un mēs atklāja Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, pēcnācēji, Jēzus, darbs, Jonas, Āronu un Solomons, un David mums deva grāmatā [Psalmi].

trans-unit.source: And [We sent] messengers about whom We have related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allah spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.
trans-unit.target: Un [mēs nosūtījām] ziņnešus, par kuriem mums ir saistīti [stāsti] jums pirms un kurjeriem, par kuriem mums ir nav saistīts ar jums. Un Allah uzrunāja Moses ar [tiešā] runu.

trans-unit.source: [We sent] messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against Allah after the messengers. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: [Mēs nosūtījām] kurjeriem kā labas vēstis un warners nesēji, tā, ka cilvēce būs neviens arguments pret Allah pēc kurjeri. Un kādreiz ir var un gudrs cildens Allah.

trans-unit.source: But Allah bears witness to that which He has revealed to you. He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness [as well]. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.
trans-unit.target: Bet Allāha lāči liecību par to, ko viņš atklāja, ka jums. Viņš ir sūtījis uz leju ar viņa zināšanām un eņģeļi [arī] liecību. Un pietiekami Allah kā liecinieks.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah have certainly gone far astray.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kuri neticēt un novērst [cilvēku] no Allah veids noteikti gājis tālu apmaldīties.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong [or injustice] - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kuri neticēt un izdarīt nepareizi [vai netaisnība] - nekad Allah piedot tiem, nedz arī viņš palīdzēs viņiem ceļu.

trans-unit.source: Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever. And that, for Allah, is [always] easy.
trans-unit.target: Izņemot ceļu uz elli; viņi ievēro tur uz visiem laikiem. Un tas, par Allāhu, [vienmēr] viegli.

trans-unit.source: O Mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe; it is better for you. But if you disbelieve - then indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: O cilvēcei, kurjers ir nākt pie jums ar patiesību no jūsu kungs, tāpēc uzskatu, ka; tas ir labāks par jums. Bet ja jums neticēt - patiešām, tad lai Allāhs pieder, kāda ir debesis un zeme. Un kādreiz ir Allah zinot un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allah and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul [created at a command] from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist - it is better for you. Indeed, Allah is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
trans-unit.target: O cilvēku rakstos, ne izdarīt lieko savu reliģiju vai teikt par Allah, izņemot patiesību. Mesija, Jēzus, Marija, dēls bija tikai ziņnesis no Allah un viņa vārdu, ko viņš vadīja Mērija un dvēsele [komandu izveidoja] no viņa. Tātad tic Allah un viņa kurjeri. Un nav teikt, "Trīs"; atturēties,-tas ir labāks par jums. Patiešām, Allah ir tikai viens Dievs. Sajūsmināts viņš ir iepriekš kam dēls. Viņam pieder, kāds ir debesīs un kāds ir uz zemes. Un pietiekami Allah kā lietu aizvākšanu.

trans-unit.source: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of Allah, nor would the angels near [to Him]. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together.
trans-unit.target: Nekad nebūtu Mesija nicināšana ir kalps, Allah, nedz būtu eņģeļus pie [viņam]. Un kurš disdains viņa pielūgsmes un ir augstprātīgi - viņš būs savākt tos pie sevis visi kopā.

trans-unit.source: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards and grant them extra from His bounty. But as for those who disdained and were arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper.
trans-unit.target: Un attiecībā uz tiem, kas ticēja un nebija taisns darbiem, viņš dod viņiem pilnībā viņu atlīdzības un piešķirt papildus no savas veltes. Bet attiecībā uz tiem, kuri disdained un bija augstprātīgi, viņš būs sodīt tos ar sāpīgu sods, un tie būs atrast sev bez Allah nevienu aizsargs vai palīgs.

trans-unit.source: O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light.
trans-unit.target: O cilvēcei, tur ir pienācis jums neapgāžamu pierādījumu no savu kungu, un mēs esam nosūtījuši uz leju jums skaidra gaisma.

trans-unit.source: So those who believe in Allah and hold fast to Him - He will admit them to mercy from Himself and bounty and guide them to Himself on a straight path.
trans-unit.target: Tātad tiem, kuri tic Allah un turiet ātri viņam - viņš tos uzņemt žēlastību no sevis un veltes un viņiem palīdzētu sev taisnā ceļā.

trans-unit.source: They request from you a [legal] ruling. Say, "Allah gives you a ruling concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants [as heirs]." If a man dies, leaving no child but [only] a sister, she will have half of what he left. And he inherits from her if she [dies and] has no child. But if there are two sisters [or more], they will have two-thirds of what he left. If there are both brothers and sisters, the male will have the share of two females. Allah makes clear to you [His law], lest you go astray. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Tās pieprasa no jums [tiesību] nolēmumu. Teiksim, "Allah dod nolēmumu attiecībā uz vienu ņemot pēctečiem, nedz priekšteči [kā mantinieki]." Ja cilvēks nomirst, atstājot neviens bērns, bet [tikai] māsa, viņai būs puse no to, ko viņš atstājis. Un viņš manto no viņas, ja viņa [nomirst un] ir neviens bērns. Bet, ja ir divas māsas [vai vairāk], tās ir divas trešdaļas no to, ko viņš atstājis. Ja gan brāļi un māsas, vīriešu būs divas sieviešu īpatsvars. Allah skaidri jums [viņa tiesībām], nedrīkstam arī jums apmaldīties. Un Allah ir zinot visas lietas.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fulfill [all] contracts. Lawful for you are the animals of grazing livestock except for that which is recited to you [in this Qur'an] - hunting not being permitted while you are in the state of ihram. Indeed, Allah ordains what He intends.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, izpildīt [visas] līgumiem. Likumīga, jums ir dzīvnieku ganībām, izņemot mājlopu, kas skaitīja jums [Qur] - medības nav atļauta, kamēr atrodaties valstī, kurā ihram. Patiešām, Allah noteic arī to, ko viņš plāno.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not violate the rites of Allah or [the sanctity of] the sacred month or [neglect the marking of] the sacrificial animals and garlanding [them] or [violate the safety of] those coming to the Sacred House seeking bounty from their Lord and [His] approval. But when you come out of ihram, then [you may] hunt. And do not let the hatred of a people for having obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram lead you to transgress. And cooperate in righteousness and piety, but do not cooperate in sin and aggression. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, nepārkāpj Allāhu baudas vai [svētuma] svēts mēnesis vai [nolaidība marķēšanas] dzīvnieku upurēšanas un garlanding [tiem] vai [pārkāpt drošību] tiem, kas ierodas svēto mājā meklē devība no to kungu, un [viņa] apstiprināšanu. Bet kad tu nāc no ihram, tad [var] medīt. Un neļaujiet cilvēki naidu par ņemot traucēja jums no al-Masjid al-Haram novest jūs pārkāpt. Un sadarboties taisnības un pietāte, bet sadarboties nav grēks un agresiju. Un bailes Allah; patiešām, Allah ir smags sods.

trans-unit.source: Prohibited to you are dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah, and [those animals] killed by strangling or by a violent blow or by a head-long fall or by the goring of horns, and those from which a wild animal has eaten, except what you [are able to] slaughter [before its death], and those which are sacrificed on stone altars, and [prohibited is] that you seek decision through divining arrows. That is grave disobedience. This day those who disbelieve have despaired of [defeating] your religion; so fear them not, but fear Me. This day I have perfected for you your religion and completed My favor upon you and have approved for you Islam as religion. But whoever is forced by severe hunger with no inclination to sin - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Jums ir beigti dzīvnieki, asinis, miesa no cūku un to, kas ir veltīta nevis Allah, aizliegtas [šie dzīvnieki] nogalināti ar žņaudzamās vardarbīgu sitiens vai ar galvu ilgi kritumu vai goring ragus, un tie, no kuriem ir ēst savvaļas dzīvnieku, izņemot to, ko jūs [ir spējīgs] kaušanai [pirms savas nāves] , un tie, kas tiek ziedota uz akmens altāru un [ir aizliegta] meklēt lēmumu cauri brīnums bultas. Tas ir nopietns nepakļaušanās. Šajā dienā, kuri neticēt ir izmisis [defeating] jūsu reliģisko piederību; Tātad tās nav bailes, bet bailes me. Šī diena man ir pilnveidojams jums jūsu reliģija un pabeigt manā favor pār jums un jums kā reliģija islāms ir apstiprināts. Bet tas, kurš ir spiests ar smagu badu ar nav slīpuma uz grēku -, tad patiešām, Allah ir piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], what has been made lawful for them. Say, "Lawful for you are [all] good foods and [game caught by] what you have trained of hunting animals which you train as Allah has taught you. So eat of what they catch for you, and mention the name of Allah upon it, and fear Allah." Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
trans-unit.target: Viņi lūdz jūs [O Muhammad], kas panākts likumīgi tiem. Teikt, "likumīga, jums ir [visi] labu pārtiku un [spēle, ko nozvejojuši] kāda ir apmācīti medību dzīvnieku apmācīt kā Allah ir mācīts jums. Tātad ēst, noķer, minēt Allah vārdu un bailes Allah." Patiešām, Allah ir ātra kontu.

trans-unit.source: This day [all] good foods have been made lawful, and the food of those who were given the Scripture is lawful for you and your food is lawful for them. And [lawful in marriage are] chaste women from among the believers and chaste women from among those who were given the Scripture before you, when you have given them their due compensation, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse or taking [secret] lovers. And whoever denies the faith - his work has become worthless, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.
trans-unit.target: Šajā dienā [visi] laba pārtika ir veikti likumīgi un pārtiku, kuri tika dota svētie raksti ir likumīga, gan jums, gan jūsu pārtiku ir likumīga viņiem. Un [likumīgā laulībā ir] šķīsts sievietes no ticīgajiem un šķīsts sievietes no tiem, kas tika dota rakstos, pirms jums, kad esat devis viņiem to pienākas kompensācija, vēloties šķīstība, ne prettiesisku dzimumaktu vai ņemot [noslēpums] mīļotājiem. Un tas, kurš noliedz ticību - viņa darbs ir kļuvis nevērtīgs, un viņš turpmāk būs starp zaudētājiem.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you rise to [perform] prayer, wash your faces and your forearms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and wash your feet to the ankles. And if you are in a state of janabah, then purify yourselves. But if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and hands with it. Allah does not intend to make difficulty for you, but He intends to purify you and complete His favor upon you that you may be grateful.
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ir uzskats, ja pieauguma [izpildīt] lūgšanu, mazgā jūsu sejas un jūsu rokām atbalstījies uz elkoņiem un noslaukiet jūsu galvas un mazgā jūsu kājām līdz potītēm. Un, ja jums ir janabah stāvoklī, tad attīra savu sirdi. Bet, ja esat saslimis vai ceļojumā vai viens no jums nāk no vietas atbrīvojot sevi, vai jūs esat sazinājies ar sievietēm, nevis atrast ūdeni, tad meklēt tīru zemes un noslaukiet jūsu sejas un rokām, ar to. Allah neplāno veikt grūtības jums, bet viņš ir nolēmis jums attīrīt un pabeigtu viņa favor pār jums var būt pateicīga.

trans-unit.source: And remember the favor of Allah upon you and His covenant with which He bound you when you said, "We hear and we obey"; and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Un atcerieties, Allah labvēlība pret jums un viņa paktu, ar kuru viņš pienākums jums teica: "mēs dzirdam un mēs paklausīt"; un bailes Allah. Patiešām, Allah ir zinot, ka pēc krūtis.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice, and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, būt ilgstoši stāv firma Allah, taisnīgumu, liecinieku un neļaujiet cilvēki naida neļautu jums vienkārši. Būt tikai; tas ir tuvāk taisnību. Un bailes Allah; patiešām, Allah ir iepazinies ar to, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds [that] for them there is forgiveness and great reward.
trans-unit.target: Allah ir apsolījis, kuri domāt un darīt taisns darbus [ka] viņiem nav piedošanu un liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - those are the companions of Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Bet tie, kuri neticēt un noliegt mūsu zīmes - tie ir Hellfire biedrus.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when a people determined to extend their hands [in aggression] against you, but He withheld their hands from you; and fear Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, atceraties Allah labvēlība pret tevi, kad cilvēki, kas nolēmis paplašināt savas rokas [agresijas] pret jums, bet viņš ietur savas rokas no tevis; un bailes Allah. Paļaujoties uz ļaujiet Allah ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: And Allah had already taken a covenant from the Children of Israel, and We delegated from among them twelve leaders. And Allah said, "I am with you. If you establish prayer and give zakah and believe in My messengers and support them and loan Allah a goodly loan, I will surely remove from you your misdeeds and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever of you disbelieves after that has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way."
trans-unit.target: Allah bija uzņēmies derību no Izraēlas bērni un mēs deleģējusi kādu no tiem divpadsmit līderiem. Un Allah teica: "es esmu kopā ar jums. Ja jums izveidot lūgšanu un sniedz zakah un ticu mana kurjeriem un tos atbalstīt un aizdevumu Allah pamatīgs aizdevumu, es noteikti noņemt jūs no jūsu ļaundarībām un uzņemt dārzi, zem kura upes plūsmu. Bet tas, kurš no jums disbelieves pēc tam, kad tas noteikti ir noklīdis no ceļu stabilitāti."

trans-unit.source: So for their breaking of the covenant We cursed them and made their hearts hard. They distort words from their [proper] usages and have forgotten a portion of that of which they were reminded. And you will still observe deceit among them, except a few of them. But pardon them and overlook [their misdeeds]. Indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Tātad par to pārkāpj paktā mēs tos nolamājās un lika sirdīm grūti. Tie izkropļo vārdus no viņu [pareizu] paražas un aizmirsuši daļu, no kuriem tie tika atgādināts.
