trans-unit.target: Mēs būtu izdomājuši pret Allāhu meli ja atgriezāmies pie tava reliģija pēc Allah bija mūs izglābis no tā. Un tas nav mums atgriezties pie tā, izņemot to, ka Allāhs, mūsu kungs, vajadzētu būs. Mūsu Kungs ir ietvēra visas lietas zināšanas. Allah uz mums paļauties. Mūsu Kunga izšķirties starp mums un mūsu cilvēkiem patiesību, un jums ir labākais no tiem, kas dod lēmums."

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "If you should follow Shu'ayb, indeed, you would then be losers."
trans-unit.target: Teica slavenais tie, kuri disbelieved starp savējiem, "Ja jums vajadzētu sekot Shu'ayb, patiešām, jūs tad būtu zaudētāji."

trans-unit.source: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc zemestrīces saķēra tos, un viņi kļuva par viņu mājās [līķu] samazinājies nosliece.

trans-unit.source: Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was as though they had never resided there. Those who denied Shu'ayb - it was they who were the losers.
trans-unit.target: Tie, kuri noliedza Shu'ayb - tas bija tā, it kā tie bija tur nekad nav dzīvojis. Tie, kuri noliedza Shu'ayb - tas bija tie, kas bijuši zaudētāji.

trans-unit.source: And he turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you, so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?"
trans-unit.target: Viņš novērsās no viņiem un sacīja: "O mana tauta man noteikti bija aizvesti uz jūs mana kunga ziņojumu un informēja, ka, tā kā varētu man skumt par neticīgi cilvēki?"

trans-unit.source: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Un mēs nosūtījām nav pilsētas pravietis, [kas ir liegta] izņemot to, ka mēs konfiscēja tās iedzīvotājiem ar nabadzību un ka viņi varētu pazemīgs sevi, [Allah] lai grūtības.

trans-unit.source: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good, until they increased [and prospered] and said, "Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease." So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs apmainījāmies vietā bad [nosacījumi], labi, līdz brīdim, kad tās palielinājās [un uzplauka] un teica: "mūsu tēvi [arī] bija pieskārās ar grūtībām un vieglumu." Tāpēc mums izdevīgu viņiem pēkšņi, kamēr viņi nebija ne uztvert.

trans-unit.source: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allah, We would have opened upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning."
trans-unit.target: Un, ja vien pilsētās cilvēki bija ticēja un baidījās no Allah, mēs būtu uzšķērdis tiem svētību no debesīm un zemi; bet tās noliedza [kurjeriem], tāpēc mums izdevīgu viņiem par to, ko viņi pelna."

trans-unit.source: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep?
trans-unit.target: Tad pilsētas iedzīvotājiem justies pasargāta no mūsu sods nāk viņiem naktī, kamēr viņi guļ?

trans-unit.source: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?
trans-unit.target: Vai pilsētās cilvēki jūtas pasargāti no mūsu sods nāk viņiem no rīta, kamēr viņi spēlē?

trans-unit.source: Then did they feel secure from the plan of Allah? But no one feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people.
trans-unit.target: Tad viņi jūtas pasargāti no Allah plānu? Bet neviens jūtas pasargāti no Allah plānu izņemot zaudēt cilvēkus.

trans-unit.source: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] people that if We willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal over their hearts so they do not hear.
trans-unit.target: Tas nav kļuvis skaidrs tiem, kas ir mantojis zemi pēc tās [iepriekšējās] cilvēkiem, ka, ja mums gribas, mēs varētu afflict tām par saviem grēkiem? Bet mēs roņu pār viņu sirdis, lai viņi nevar dzirdēt.

trans-unit.source: Those cities - We relate to you, [O Muhammad], some of their news. And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus does Allah seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Šīm pilsētām - mēs attiecas uz jums, [O Muhammad] dažas savas ziņas. Un noteikti izdarīja savus ziņnešus atnāks pie viņiem ar skaidru apliecinājumu, bet tie nav ticam, ka tas, kas viņiem iepriekš nebija pieejams. Tādējādi Allah zīmogu gaitā disbelievers sirdis.

trans-unit.source: And We did not find for most of them any covenant; but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs neatradām lielākajai daļai no viņiem kādu derību; bet patiešām, mēs noskaidrojām, lielākā daļa no tām izaicinoši nepaklausīgs.

trans-unit.source: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs nosūtījām Moses viņiem pakaļ ar mūsu zīmes faraons un savā uzņēmumā, bet tie ir netaisnīgi pret viņiem. Tātad, redzēt, kā beidzās corrupters.

trans-unit.source: And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds
trans-unit.target: Un Moses teica: "O faraons, esmu ziņnesis no pasaules kungs

trans-unit.source: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allah except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel."
trans-unit.target: [Kas ir] nav pienākums teikt par Allah, izņemot patiesību. Es būtu varējusi iet pie jums ar skaidru pierādījumu no jūsu kungs, Tātad sūtīt man līdzi Izraēla bērniem."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "If you have come with a sign, then bring it forth, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: [Faraons] teica: "Ja ir ieradušies ar zīmi, tad tas nes sevī, ja jums ir jābūt patiesam."

trans-unit.source: So Moses threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc Moses iemeta savu nūju, un pēkšņi tas bija čūska, manifests.

trans-unit.source: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.
trans-unit.target: Un viņš izvilka roku; tad tas bija balts [ar spožums] par novērotājiem.

trans-unit.source: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh, "Indeed, this is a learned magician
trans-unit.target: Teica slavenais faraons vidū, "patiešām, šis ir iemācījušies burvis

trans-unit.source: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic], so what do you instruct?"
trans-unit.target: Kurš vēlas izraidīt jūs no jūsu zemes [caur burvju], tātad ko jūs uzdot? "

trans-unit.source: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "atlikt [lietu] viņam un viņa brālis un nosūtiet starp pilsētām ievācējiem

trans-unit.source: Who will bring you every learned magician."
trans-unit.target: Kas dos jums katru skolotie burvis."

trans-unit.source: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."
trans-unit.target: Un nāca faraona burvji. Viņi teica: "mums patiešām ir atlīdzība, ja mums ir valdošais."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Jā, un [bez] jums būs starp tiem, kas blakus [man]."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "O Moses, jums mest [darbiniekiem], vai mēs būsim tie mest uz [pirmā]."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Mest" un kad tie threw, tās burvju cilvēku acis un terors skāra tajās, un tie uzrāda lielu [feat] burvju.

trans-unit.source: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs iedvesmoja Moses, "Mest jūsu darbinieki" un vienlaikus tā aprija, ko tās viltošanu.

trans-unit.source: So the truth was established, and abolished was what they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Tātad patiesība tika izveidota un atcelti bija, ko viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: And Pharaoh and his people were overcome right there and became debased.
trans-unit.target: Un faraons un savai tautai bija jāpārvar turpat un kļuva par bāzēm.

trans-unit.source: And the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Un burvju nokrita prostrācija, [Allah].

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "mums ir uzskats pasaulēm, Lord

trans-unit.source: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
trans-unit.target: Moses un Aaron kungs."

trans-unit.source: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.
trans-unit.target: Teica, ka faraons, "jūs ticēja viņam, pirms es tev deva atļauju. Patiešām, tas ir sazvērestība, kas jums nostājušies pilsētas izraidīt no tiem saviem iedzīvotājiem. Bet jūs zināt.

trans-unit.source: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all."
trans-unit.target: Noteikti samazinās pie rokām un kājām uz pretējās pusēs; tad man būs noteikti sist krustā jums visiem."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "tiešām, mūsu kungu mēs atgriezīsim.

trans-unit.source: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."
trans-unit.target: Un mums, izņemot ne apvainoties, jo mums ticēja pazīmes mūsu kungs, kad viņi nonāca pie mums. Mūsu Kunga pour pār mums pacietību un ļaujiet mums iet bojā kā musulmaņi [iesniegšanas jums]."

trans-unit.source: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said," Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."
trans-unit.target: Un izcili vidū faraons teica,"jūs atstāt Moses un viņa cilvēki uz zemes izraisīt bojājumu un atteikties no jums un jūsu dievi?" [Faraons] teica: "mēs nogalināt savus bērnus un savas sievietes izaudzēt; un patiešām, mums ir subjugators pār viņiem."

trans-unit.source: Said Moses to his people, "Seek help through Allah and be patient. Indeed, the earth belongs to Allah. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Minētās Moses savai tautai, "meklēt palīdzību caur Allah un būt pacietīgam. Patiešām, zeme pieder Allah. Viņš rada tas, ko viņš vēlas no saviem kalpiem mantot. Un [labāko] iznākums ir taisns.

trans-unit.source: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "Mums ir nodarīts kaitējums iekams tu ieradies pie mums, un pēc tam, kad ir jānāk pie mums." Viņš teica: varbūt jūsu Kungs būs iznīcināt pretinieku un piešķirt zemi mantošanas un redzēt, kā jūs.

trans-unit.source: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti konfiscēti faraons invalīdu gadu badu un trūkumu augļus, ka varbūt tie būtu atgādināts.

trans-unit.source: But when good came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allah, but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Bet kad labu nāca viņiem, viņi teica: "tas ir mūsu [pa labi]." Un ja ir slikta [stāvokļa] skāra tos, viņi redzēja ļaunu vēstīt, Moses, un tiem līdzi. Neapšaubāmi, to liktenis ir ar Allah, bet vairums no viņiem nezina.

trans-unit.source: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not be believers in you."
trans-unit.target: Un viņi teica: "neatkarīgi no tā, kādu zīmi tu dot mums ar kuru nobur mūs, mums nebūs ticīgie jūsos."

trans-unit.source: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc mēs nosūtījām viņiem virsū plūdi un siseņi un utis un vardes un asinis kā atšķirīgas pazīmes, bet tie bija augstprātīgs un kriminālo ļaudis.

trans-unit.source: And when the punishment descended upon them, they said, "O Moses, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the punishment from us, we will surely believe you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel."
trans-unit.target: Un tad, kad sods nolaidās uz viņiem, viņi teica, "mums lietot O Moses, savu kungu, ko viņš ir apsolījis. Ja sods var izņemt no mums, mēs noteikti uzskatām, ka jums, un mēs nosūtīsim jums ar Izraēlas bērniem."

trans-unit.source: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.
trans-unit.target: Taču sods mums izņēma no tiem termins, ko viņi gribēja nokļūt līdz, tad uzreiz viņi lauza savu vārdu.

trans-unit.source: So We took retribution from them, and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc mēs pieņēmām, atmaksa no viņiem, un mēs tos noslīka jūrā, jo viņi noliedza mūsu zīmes un bija neuzmanīgs no tiem.

trans-unit.source: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.
trans-unit.target: Un mums lika cilvēkiem, kuri bija apspiesto mantot zemi un rietumu tiem, kas mums bija laimīgs austrumu reģioniem. Un labu vārdu par savu kungu tika izpildīts Izraēla bērniem sakarā ar to, ko viņi pacietīgi izturēja. Un mēs iznīcināt [visi] ka faraons, un viņa cilvēki ražoja un ko viņi bija ēkā.

trans-unit.source: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs. They said, "O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods." He said, "Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs pieņēmām Izraēla bērniem pāri jūrai; tad viņi uzgāja cilvēku nodoma nodošanās [kādu] elkiem savējo. Viņi teica: "O Moses, dot mums Dievs tāpat, kā tie ir dieviem." Viņš teica: "patiešām, tu esi uzvedība ignorantly cilvēki.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tiem [dievlūdzēju] - iznīcina, ir tas, ka, kurā tie [darbā], un bezvērtīgas ir tas, ko viņi dara. "

trans-unit.source: He said, "Is it other than Allah I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?"
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Tas nav Allah es būtu ilgojos, lai jūs kā Dievu, kaut viņš ir dod priekšroku pār pasaulēm?"

trans-unit.source: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, [who were] afflicting you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
trans-unit.target: Un [atsaukšana, O Izraēla bērniem], kad mēs saglabāt jūs no faraons, cilvēki, [kas ir] jūs cieš ar sliktāko mokas - nogalināt taviem dēliem un saglabājot savu sieviešu dzīvs. Un tas bija liels izmēģinājumu, izmantojot savu kungu.

trans-unit.source: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten; so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Take my place among my people, do right [by them], and do not follow the way of the corrupters."
trans-unit.target: Un mēs norunājuši ar Moses trīsdesmit naktis un pilnveidojams, tos pievienojot [] desmit; tāpēc viņa lords termins tika pabeigts kā četrdesmit naktis. Un Moses teica brālim Aaron, "mana jānotiek starp maniem ļaudīm, darīt tieši [tiem], un neseko corrupters veidā.

trans-unit.source: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allah] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first of the believers."
trans-unit.target: Un kad Moses ieradās mūsu nosacītajam laikam un viņa kungs runāja ar viņu, viņš teica: "Milord, parādies man [], ka es var apskatīt jums." [Allah] teica: "jūs mani neredzēs, bet skatīties uz kalnu; Ja tas būtu jāpaliek savā vietā, tad jūs redzēsiet mani." Bet, kad viņa kungs parādījās pie kalna, viņš padarīja to līmeni un Moses krita bezsamaņā. Un tad, kad viņš pamodās, viņš teica: "cildens jūs esat! Ir nožēlojuši jums, un es esmu pirmā no ticīgo.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you]. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] teica: "O Moses, es izvēlējos jums pār cilvēkiem ar maniem vēstījumiem un manu vārdu [tu]. Tātad ņemt to, ko esmu devis jums un būt starp pateicīgs."

trans-unit.source: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], "Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient."
trans-unit.target: Un rakstījām par viņu tabletes [kaut] visas lietas - instrukcija un skaidrojumu par visām lietām, [saka], "ņem tos ar lielu apņēmību un pasūtīt jūsu darbiniekiem veikt labāko no tā. Es jums parādīs, izaicinoši nepaklausīga mājās."

trans-unit.source: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant upon the earth without right; and if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. And if they see the way of consciousness, they will not adopt it as a way; but if they see the way of error, they will adopt it as a way. That is because they have denied Our signs and they were heedless of them.
trans-unit.target: Būs vērsties prom no manas zīmes tiem, kas ir augstprātīgi uz zemes bez tiesībām; un, ja viņi būtu jāredz katra zīme, tās nedrīkst domāt tajā. Un ja viņi redz apziņa kā, viņi nav pieņems to kā veidu; bet, ja viņi redz kļūdas veidu, viņi pieņems to kā veids, kā. Tas ir tāpēc, ka viņi nolieguši mūsu pazīmes, un tie bija neuzmanīgs no tiem.

trans-unit.source: Those who denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?
trans-unit.target: Tie, kuri noliedza mūsu zīmes un turpmāk - sapulces viņu darbiem ir kļuvis nevērtīgs. Ir tie recompensed, izņemot to, ko viņi mēdza to darīt agrāk?

trans-unit.source: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their ornaments a calf - an image having a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Un Moses cilvēki, pēc [aizbraukšanas] no savas rotas teļš - kam lowing skaņas attēlu. Viņi neredzēja, ka tā varētu runāt ar viņiem, nedz viņus virzām tā? Tie ņēma to [dievkalpojumiem], un tie bija pārkāpējus.

trans-unit.source: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had gone astray, they said, "If our Lord does not have mercy upon us and forgive us, we will surely be among the losers."
trans-unit.target: Un kad nožēlu pārvarēja viņiem un viņi redzēja, ka viņi devušies apmaldīties, viņi teica: "Ja mūsu Kunga nav žēlastība mūs un piedod mums, mēs noteikti būs starp zaudētāji."

trans-unit.source: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said, "How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the matter of your Lord?" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward him. [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, indeed the people oppressed me and were about to kill me, so let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Un, kad atgriezās Moses savai tautai, dusmīgs un ļoti apbēdināta, viņš teica: "Cik nožēlojama ir ka, kas ir nomainīta mani pēc [manas aizbraukšanas]. Jūs bijāt nepacietīgs pār jūsu kunga jautājumu?" Un viņš nosvieda tabletes un konfiscēja viņa brālis [apmatojums] galvu, virzīja viņu uz viņa pusi. [Aaron] teica: "O dēlu māte, patiesi cilvēki apspiesto mani un bija gatavs mani nogalināt, tāpēc ļaujiet nav ienaidnieki priecājos pār mani un nenovietojiet mani grēks cilvēku vidū."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: mans Lord piedot mani un manu brāli un uzņemt mūs savā varā, jums ir visvairāk žēlsirdīgs un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] will obtain anger from their Lord and humiliation in the life of this world, and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tiem, kas ņēma teļš [dievkalpojumiem] iegūs dusmas no kunga un pazemojuma garšu šīs pasaules dzīvē, un tādējādi mēs atlīdzība [nepatiesību] izgudrotājiem.

trans-unit.source: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed - indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Bet tiem, kas izdarījušas ļaundarības nožēlojuši viņiem pakaļ un ticēja - patiešām kungs, pēc tam piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets; and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who are fearful of their Lord.
trans-unit.target: Un kad dusmas norimuši Moses, viņš paņēma plāksnītes; un viņu uzraksts bija virzības un žēlsirdību tiem, kuri ir baidījušies no savu kungu.

trans-unit.source: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, "My Lord, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.
trans-unit.target: Un Moses izvēlējās savu tautu no septiņdesmit cilvēki mūsu tikšanās. Un kad zemestrīce saķēra tos, viņš teica: "mans kungs, ja jums gribas, jūs varētu ir iznīcinājuši pirms, man [arī]. Jūs iznīcinātu mūs, kas muļķīgi starp mums ir jādara? Tas nav taču pētījumā, kādā nosūtāt apmaldīties kam tiks un rokasgrāmatu, kurai jūs. Jūs esat mūsu aizsargs, tik mums piedot un apžēlojies pēc mums; un jums ir labākais forgivers.

trans-unit.source: And decree for us in this world [that which is] good and [also] in the Hereafter; indeed, we have turned back to You." [Allah] said, "My punishment - I afflict with it whom I will, but My mercy encompasses all things." So I will decree it [especially] for those who fear Me and give zakah and those who believe in Our verses -
trans-unit.target: Un dekrētu par mums, šajā pasaulē [thats kas] labs un [arī], turpmāk; patiešām, mums ir atkal pagriezās pret jums." [Allah] teica: "mans sods - es afflict ar to, ko es gribu, bet manās rokās aptver visas lietas." Tāpēc es būs dekrētu [it] tiem, kuri mani bailes un sniegt zakah un tiem, kuri tic mūsu vārsmas -

trans-unit.source: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered prophet, whom they find written in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and forbids them what is wrong and makes lawful for them the good things and prohibits for them the evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kuri seko Messenger, neizglītots pravietis, kam viņi atrod to, ko viņi ir Toras un evaņģēliju, kas enjoins pār viņiem, kas ir labi un aizliedz tiem, kas ir nepareizi un padara likumīgu viņiem labas lietas un aizliedz viņiem ļaunums un viņus neatbrīvo no to slogu un važas, kas bija viņiem virsū rakstīts. Tātad tie, kuri ir ticēja viņam, cienīji viņu, atbalstīja viņu un sekoja gaisma, kas tika nosūtīts uz leju ar viņu - tas ir tiem, kuri būs veiksmīga.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allah to you all, [from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death." So believe in Allah and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allah and His words, and follow him that you may be guided.
trans-unit.target: Teiksim, [O Muhammad] "O cilvēcei, patiešām es Messenger Allah jums galā, [viņam] kam pieder valdīšana debesis un zemi. Nav neviena dievība, izņemot viņu; Viņš dod dzīvību un izraisa nāvi." Tātad ticēt Allah un viņa Messenger neizglītots pravietis, kurš tic Allah un viņa vārdi, un sekos viņam, ka jūs var vadīties.

trans-unit.source: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.
trans-unit.target: Moses cilvēku vidū ir Kopiena, kuras gidi ar patiesību un to nosaka tieslietu.

trans-unit.source: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, "Strike with your staff the stone," and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs viņiem sadalīta divpadsmit pēcnācējs ciltis [kā atšķirīgas] tautas. Un mēs iedvesmoja Moses, kad savai tautai izlūdzās viņam ūdeni, "Ar savu darbinieku streiks akmens," un tur gushed tālāk no tā divpadsmit atsperes. Katru cilvēku zināja tās uzpildes vietu. Un mēs viņiem ieēnota ar mākoņiem un nosūtīts uz leju, uz tiem manna un paipalas, [saka], "ēst no labas lietas, ar kurām esam nodrošinājuši jums." Un viņi mums nav nodarījis, bet tie bija [tikai] wronging sevi.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city and eat from it wherever you will and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens,' and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."
trans-unit.target: Un [pieminēt, O Muhammad], kad tas tika teikts, "kavēties šajā pilsētā un ēst no tā, kur būs un teikt,"Atbrīvot mūs no mūsu apgrūtinājumu"un ievadiet vārtiem palocīdamies pazemīgi; Mēs [tad] piedot jums jūsu grēkus. Mēs pieaugs doers no labas [labestības un atalgot]."

trans-unit.source: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them. So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for the wrong that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Bet tiem, kam nodarīts kaitējums, starp tiem mainīt [vārdi] paziņojumu, nav, ko bija teicis, lai tos. Tāpēc mēs nosūtījām viņiem virsū sodu no debesīm par nepareizu, ka viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day, and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Un lūdziet viņus par pilsētu, kas bija pie jūras - kad tās pārkāptas [lietu] sabats - to zivju atnāca uz tiem atklāti par to sabata diena, un viņiem nebija nekādu sabata dienu viņi neatgriezās pie viņiem. Tādējādi nebija piedāvājam viņiem izmēģinājuma versiju, jo tie bija izaicinoši nepaklausīgs.

trans-unit.source: And when a community among them said, "Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom Allah is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?" they [the advisors] said, "To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him."
trans-unit.target: Un kad Kopienas vidū teica: "kāpēc jūs ieteikt [vai brīdināt] personām, ar kurām Allah ir [par], lai iznīcinātu vai sodīt ar bargu sodu?" viņi [konsultanti] teica: "lai būtu atbrīvots pirms savu kungu, un varbūt viņi var bailes viņu."

trans-unit.source: And when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched punishment, because they were defiantly disobeying.
trans-unit.target: Un kad viņi aizmirsa, ka pa kurām viņi bija atgādināts, mēs izglābām tiem, kuri bija aizliegts ļaunumu un konfiscēti tiem, kam nodarīts kaitējums, ar nabaga sods, jo viņi bija izaicinoši nepaklausot.

trans-unit.source: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, "Be apes, despised."
trans-unit.target: Tātad, kad viņi bija nekaunīgs par to, kas viņiem bija aizliegts, mēs teica, "pērtiķu, nicināja."

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un [min] kad jūsu kungs paziņoja, ka viņš noteikti [turpināt] nosūtīt viņiem virsū līdz augšāmcelšanās diena tiem, kas gribētu afflict tām ar sliktāko mokas. Patiešām, jūsu kungs ir ātra sodu; bet patiešām, viņš piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations. Of them some were righteous, and of them some were otherwise. And We tested them with good [times] and bad that perhaps they would return [to obedience].
trans-unit.target: Un mēs sadalīt tos visā zemes tautām. No tiem daži bija taisnīgs un no tiem daži bija citādi. Un mēs testē tos ar labu [laiks] un slikti, ka varbūt viņi atgriezīsies [paklausību].

trans-unit.source: And there followed them successors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying, "It will be forgiven for us." And if an offer like it comes to them, they will [again] take it. Was not the covenant of the Scripture taken from them that they would not say about Allah except the truth, and they studied what was in it? And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allah, so will you not use reason?
trans-unit.target: Un tad sekoja tiem mantiniekiem, kas ir mantojis svētie raksti, [bet] ņemot preces šajā zemāka dzīves un sakot, "Tas tiks piedots mums." Un ja patīk piedāvājums nāk viņiem, viņi [atkal] ņemt to. Nebija svētie raksti ņemti no viņiem, ka viņi nevar teikt par Allah, izņemot patiesības mēru, un viņi pētīja, kas tas bija? Un turpmāk mājas ir labāks par tiem, kuri baidās, Allah, Tātad jums neizmantos iemesls?

trans-unit.source: But those who hold fast to the Book and establish prayer - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.
trans-unit.target: Bet tiem, kuriem ātri grāmatu un izveidot lūgšanu - patiešām, mēs neļaus zust atlīdzība no riformeriem.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and Allah said], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might fear Allah."
trans-unit.target: Un kad mēs pacēlām kalna virs viņiem, it kā tas bija tumšs mākonis, un viņi bija pārliecināti, ka tas viņiem virsū, [un Allah teica], "ņemt to, ko mums ir devuši jums ar lielu apņēmību un atcerēties to, kas ir tas, ka jūs varētu bailes Allah." [min]

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."
trans-unit.target: Un [min] jūsu kungs paņēma no Adam - bērniem no ļaužu gurnu auglis - viņu pēctečiem un lika viņiem apliecināt sevi, [sakot viņiem], "man nav jūsu kungs?" Viņi teica: "Jā, mums ir apliecina." [Šo] - lest augšāmcelšanās dienā, jums vajadzētu teikt "Protams, mums bija šī nezina."

trans-unit.source: Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allah before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"
trans-unit.target: Vai [ka] jūs sakāt, "tas bija tikai to, ka mūsu tēvi saistīts [citi dievkalpojumu] ar Allah, pirms, un mēs taču pēcnācēji tiem pakaļ. Pēc tam jūs iznīcinātu mūs par to, ko ir darījuši falsifiers?"

trans-unit.source: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses, and perhaps they will return.
trans-unit.target: Un tādējādi mēs [izskaidrot] sīkāk vārsmas, un varbūt viņi vēl atgriezīsies.

trans-unit.source: And recite to them, [O Muhammad], the news of him to whom we gave [knowledge of] Our signs, but he detached himself from them; so Satan pursued him, and he became of the deviators.
trans-unit.target: Un deklamēt tiem [O Muhammad], ziņas par viņu, uz kuriem mēs likām [zināšanas] mūsu pazīmes, taču viņš atdalīt sevi no tiem; tik sātans dzinās viņam pakaļ, un viņš kļuva par deviators.

trans-unit.source: And if We had willed, we could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you chase him, he pants, or if you leave him, he [still] pants. That is the example of the people who denied Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja mums gribas, mēs varētu ir paaugstināts viņu tādējādi, bet viņš ievērojuši [vietā] zemes un pēc paša vēlēšanās. Tātad tāpat kā suns ir viņa piemērs: ja jums chase viņam, viņš bikses vai ja viņu atstāj, viņš [vēl] bikses. Tas ir cilvēkiem, kuri noliedza mūsu zīmes piemērs. Tātad saistīti stāsti, ka varbūt viņi dos doma.

trans-unit.source: How evil an example [is that of] the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong themselves.
trans-unit.target: Cik ļauns piemērs [ir] cilvēki, kuri noliedza mūsu zīmes un izmanto, lai sevi nepareizi.

trans-unit.source: Whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - it is those who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: Tas, kurš virza Allah - viņš ir [pamatoti] gida; un tas, kurš sūta apmaldīties - tas ir, tiem, kas ir zaudētāji.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. Those are like livestock; rather, they are more astray. It is they who are the heedless.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti izveidotas ellē daudzas džins un cilvēcei. Viņiem ir sirdis, ar kuru viņi nesaprot, viņi ir acis, ar kurām viņi neredz, un tie ir ausis, ar kuru viņi nedzirdēja. Tie ir kā lauksaimniecības dzīvniekiem; drīzāk, tie ir vairāk apmaldīties. Tas ir tie, kuri ir neuzmanīgs.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah pieder labākos vārdus, tāpēc viņu izsaukt tos. Un atstāt [uzņēmums] tie, kas praksē novirze attiecībā uz viņa vārdu. Tie būs recompensed par to, ko viņi ir darījuši.

trans-unit.source: And among those We created is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.
trans-unit.target: Un starp tiem, kas mēs esam izveidojuši Kopienas, kas vada ar patiesību, un tādējādi nosaka tieslietu.

trans-unit.source: But those who deny Our signs - We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.
trans-unit.target: Bet tie, kuri noliedz mūsu zīmes - mēs pakāpeniski radīs viņiem [iznīcināšanas] no kur viņi nezina.

trans-unit.source: And I will give them time. Indeed, my plan is firm.
trans-unit.target: Un es dos viņiem laiku. Protams, mans plāns ir stingrs.

trans-unit.source: Then do they not give thought? There is in their companion [Muhammad] no madness. He is not but a clear warner.
trans-unit.target: Tad viņi nedod doma? Savu biedru [Muhammad] nav nekādu trakums. Viņš nav, bet skaidra warner.

trans-unit.source: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth and everything that Allah has created and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near? So in what statement hereafter will they believe?
trans-unit.target: Viņi neskatās uz karaļvalsts par debesīm un zemi, un viss, kas Allah ir izveidojusi un [ka], ka varbūt viņu iecēla pienācis laiks pie? Tātad ko pārskatā turpmāk viņi ticēs?

trans-unit.source: Whoever Allah sends astray - there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
trans-unit.target: Tas, kurš sūta apmaldīties Allah - palīglīnijas, viņam nav. Un viņš atstāj tos to pārkāpšana, klīst akli.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah, but most of the people do not know."
trans-unit.target: Viņi lūdz jūs [O Muhammad], apmēram stundu: kad ir tās atnākšanu? Saka: "tās zināšanas ir tikai ar savu kungu. Neviens atklās savu laiku, izņemot viņu. Tas smagi uzliek uz debesīm un zemi. Tas nav nāks pār jums, izņemot negaidīti." Viņi lūdz jums, ja jūs esat iepazinušies ar to. Teiksim, "savas zināšanas ir tikai ar Allah, bet lielākā daļa cilvēku nezina."

trans-unit.source: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm, except what Allah has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."
trans-unit.target: Teikt: "es tur nav par sevi [varas] labumu vai kaitēt, izņemot Allāha gribas. Un ja es zināju, neredzēts, varētu būt ieguvis daudz bagātību, un nekas ļauns nebūtu aizskāra mani. Es neesmu izņemot warner un nesēja labas vēstis ir cilvēki, kas tic.

trans-unit.source: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he covers her, she carries a light burden and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke Allah, their Lord, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tas, kas radīja jūs no viena dvēsele un veidoti tā mate, ka viņš varētu atrasties drošības ar viņu. Un kad viņš aptver viņas, viņa nes vieglajai nastai un turpina tur. Un kad tā kļūst par smagu, viņi abi izsaukt Allah, savu kungu, "Ja tu dod mums labu [bērna], mums būs noteikti vidū pateicīgs."

trans-unit.source: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. Exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Bet, kad viņš dod viņiem labu [bērna], viņiem piedēvēt partneriem viņam par to, ko viņš ir devis tos. Cildens ir Allah, pārsniedz to, ko viņi saista ar viņu.

trans-unit.source: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?
trans-unit.target: Vai viņi saista ar viņu tie, kuri neko radīt un viņi [paši] izveidots?

trans-unit.source: And the false deities are unable to [give] them help, nor can they help themselves.
trans-unit.target: Un viltus dievības nespēj [dot] viņiem palīdzību, kā arī viņi var palīdzēt sevi.

trans-unit.source: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.
trans-unit.target: Un ja tu [ticīgie] uzaicināt tos norādījumus, tie nav sekot jums. Tas ir visu pats jums vai jūs aicināt viņus, vai jums ir klusums.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allah are servants like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be truthful.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tie [polytheists] jūs aicināt ne tikai Allāhs ir ierēdņi, tāpat kā jūs. Tāpēc aicinām tos un ļaut viņiem atbildēt uz jums, ja jums ir jābūt patiesam.

trans-unit.source: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muhammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir pēdas, ar kuru viņi staigā? Vai tie ir rokās, ar kuru viņi streiks? Vai tās ir acis, kas redz? Vai tie ir ausis, kas dzird? Teiksim, [O Muhammad] "zvanīt saviem partneriem sazvērestību pret mani un dod man nekādu atelpu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, my protector is Allah, who has sent down the Book; and He is an ally to the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Protams, mana aizsargs ir Allah, kas atsūtīja uz leju grāmatu; un viņš ir sabiedrotais uz taisns.

trans-unit.source: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves."
trans-unit.target: Un jūs aicināt bez viņu tie nespēj palīdzēt, ne viņi var palīdzēt sevi."

trans-unit.source: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja jūs aicināt viņus vadlīnijas, lai viņi nedzirdēja; un te tie ir redzami blenž uz tevi, bet viņi nesaskata.

trans-unit.source: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.
trans-unit.target: Jāņem tas, ko ir dota brīvi, liek, kas ir labs un novēršas no nezinošs.

trans-unit.source: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Un ja ļauns ierosinājums nāk pie jums no sātans, tad meklēt patvērumu Allah. Protams, viņš ir dzirdes un zinot.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who fear Allah - when an impulse touches them from Satan, they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tiem, kuri baidās Allah - kad impulsu skar tos no sātans, viņi atceras [viņam] un uzreiz viņiem ir izpratne.

trans-unit.source: But their brothers - the devils increase them in error; then they do not stop short.
trans-unit.target: Bet viņu brāļi - velni tos palielināt kļūdas dēļ; tad viņi neapstājas īss.

trans-unit.source: And when you, [O Muhammad], do not bring them a sign, they say, "Why have you not contrived it?" Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This [Qur'an] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe."
trans-unit.target: Un kad tu [O Muhammad], neizraisa tos zīmi, viņi saka: "kāpēc ir jums nav izdomāts tā?" Teikt: "es tikai sekot, ko atklāja pie manis no manam kungam. [Qur] ir apgaismības jūsu kungs un virzības un žēlastība cilvēkiem, kuri tic."

trans-unit.source: So when the Qur'an is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.
trans-unit.target: Tātad kad Korāns ir skaitīja, tad to noklausītos un pievērst uzmanību, ka varat saņemt žēlastības.

trans-unit.source: And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.
trans-unit.target: Un atcerēties savu kungu sevī pazemībā un bailes bez acīmredzama runas - rītos un vakaros. Un nevar viens neuzmanīgs.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who are near your Lord are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tie, kuri atrodas tuvu jūsu kungs nekavē augstprātību no viņa pielūgsmes, tie viņu cildināt un viņam tie nogurdināt.

trans-unit.source: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the bounties [of war]. Say, "The [decision concerning] bounties is for Allah and the Messenger." So fear Allah and amend that which is between you and obey Allah and His Messenger, if you should be believers.
trans-unit.target: Viņi lūdz jūs [O Muhammad] par pabalstiem [kara]. Teiksim, "[lēmums par] pabalstiem ir Allah un kurjers." Tāpēc bailes Allah un grozīt to, kas ir starp jums un paklausīt Allah un viņa Messenger, ja jūs būtu ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts become fearful, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith; and upon their Lord they rely -
trans-unit.target: Ticīgie ir tikai tie, kuri, kad ir minēts Allah, savās sirdīs kļūt baismīgs, un ja viņiem ir skaitīja savas vārsmas, tas palielina viņus ticībā; un viņi paļaujas uz savu kungu-

trans-unit.source: The ones who establish prayer, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
trans-unit.target: Tie kas izveido lūgšanu, un no to, ko esam nodrošinājuši viņus, viņi tērē.

trans-unit.source: Those are the believers, truly. For them are degrees [of high position] with their Lord and forgiveness and noble provision.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir ticīgie, patiesi. Viņiem ir pakāpes [augstas pozīcijas] ar to Kungu un piedošanu un cēlu nodrošināšanu.

trans-unit.source: [It is] just as when your Lord brought you out of your home [for the battle of Badr] in truth, while indeed, a party among the believers were unwilling,
trans-unit.target: [Ir] tāpat, kā kad jūsu kungs, ko jūs no jūsu mājām [kaujai Badr] patiesībā, bet patiešām, pušu starpā ticīgie bija negribīgi,

trans-unit.source: Arguing with you concerning the truth after it had become clear, as if they were being driven toward death while they were looking on.
trans-unit.target: Strīdēties ar jums par patiesību, kad tas bija kļuvis skaidrs, kā tad, ja tie veda pretī nāvei, kamēr viņi lūkojās.

trans-unit.source: [Remember, O believers], when Allah promised you one of the two groups - that it would be yours - and you wished that the unarmed one would be yours. But Allah intended to establish the truth by His words and to eliminate the disbelievers
trans-unit.target: [Atceries, O ticīgie], kad Allah solīja jums vienu no divām grupām,-tas ir jums - un jūs vēlētos neapbruņotiem viens varētu būt jūsu. Bet Allāha paredzēts izveidot patiesību, pēc viņa vārdiem un likvidēt disbelievers

trans-unit.source: That He should establish the truth and abolish falsehood, even if the criminals disliked it.
trans-unit.target: Ka viņš noteiktu patiesību un nepatiesību, atcelt, pat tad, ja noziedznieki nepatika tas.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you asked help of your Lord, and He answered you, "Indeed, I will reinforce you with a thousand from the angels, following one another."
trans-unit.target: [Atceros], kad jūs esat lūdzis palīdzību savu kungu, un viņš atbildēja, "patiešām, es pastiprinās jūs ar tūkstoš no eņģeļiem, seko viena otrai."

trans-unit.source: And Allah made it not but good tidings and so that your hearts would be assured thereby. And victory is not but from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah, kas to nevar, bet labas vēstis un tāpēc, ka tādējādi būtu nodrošināta jūsu sirdis. Un nav uzvara, bet no Allah. Patiešām, ir cildens Allah spēka un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when He overwhelmed you with drowsiness [giving] security from Him and sent down upon you from the sky, rain by which to purify you and remove from you the evil [suggestions] of Satan and to make steadfast your hearts and plant firmly thereby your feet.
trans-unit.target: [Atceros] kad viņš jums overwhelmed ar miegainību [dot] drošības no viņa un nosūtīts uz leju, uz tevi no debesīm, lietus, pēc kā jūs attīra un izņemt no jums ļaunuma [ierosinājumus] sātana un padarīt nelokāms savā sirdī un tādējādi stingri augu jūsu kājām.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when your Lord inspired to the angels, "I am with you, so strengthen those who have believed. I will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieved, so strike [them] upon the necks and strike from them every fingertip."
trans-unit.target: [Atceros] kad jūsu kungs iedvesmoja eņģeļu sabiedrībā, "es esmu ar jums, tātad stiprināt tiem, kuri ir uzskats. Es cast teroru, kuri disbelieved sirdis, tik streiku [tiem] pēc kakliem un streiks no tiem katru pirkstu."

trans-unit.source: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger - indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tāpēc, ka viņi iebilda pret Allāhu un viņa Messenger. Un tas, kurš iebilst pret Allāhu un viņa Messenger - patiešām, Allah ir smags sods.

trans-unit.source: "That [is yours], so taste it." And indeed for the disbelievers is the punishment of the Fire.
trans-unit.target: "Ka [ir jūsu], tātad nogaršot." Un patiešām disbelievers ir sods par uguns.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve advancing [for battle], do not turn to them your backs [in flight].
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ir uzskats, ja jūs atbilstat kuri neticēt, padziļinot [kaujai] nepagriezās uz tiem jūsu muguras [šajā lidojumā].

trans-unit.source: And whoever turns his back to them on such a day, unless swerving [as a strategy] for war or joining [another] company, has certainly returned with anger [upon him] from Allah, and his refuge is Hell - and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Un tas, kurš vēršas ar muguru pret viņiem šādā dienā, ja vien paraujot [stratēģijas] kā kara vai pievienojas [vēl] sabiedrība ir noteikti atgriezies dusmās [viņam] virsū no Allah un viņa patvērumu ir elle - un nožēlojams ir galamērķis.

trans-unit.source: And you did not kill them, but it was Allah who killed them. And you threw not, [O Muhammad], when you threw, but it was Allah who threw that He might test the believers with a good test. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Un viņas nenogalināju, bet tas bija Allah, kas viņus nogalināja. Un tu izmeti, [O Muhammad], kad jūs izmeta, bet tas bija Allah, kurš iemeta viņam varētu pārbaudīt ticīgie ar labs tests. Patiešām, Allah ir dzirdes un zinot.

trans-unit.source: That [is so], and [also] that Allah will weaken the plot of the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Ka [ir], un [arī] ka Allāham vājinās disbelievers laukumā.

trans-unit.source: If you [disbelievers] seek the victory - the defeat has come to you. And if you desist [from hostilities], it is best for you; but if you return [to war], We will return, and never will you be availed by your [large] company at all, even if it should increase; and [that is] because Allah is with the believers.
trans-unit.target: Ja tu [disbelievers] meklē uzvaru - sakāvi ir nonākusi pie jums. Un ja jūs atturēties [no karadarbības], tas ir labākais jums; bet, ja jūs atgrieztos [kara], mēs atgriezīsim un nekad būs jums izmantojusi [lielu] sabiedrība vispār, pat tad, ja tas būtu jāpalielina; un [ka] jo Allah ir ar ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, obey Allah and His Messenger and do not turn from him while you hear [his order].
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, paklausīt Allah un viņa Messenger un nevajag novērsties no viņa, kamēr jūs dzirdat [viņa pasūtījuma].

trans-unit.source: And do not be like those who say, "We have heard," while they do not hear.
trans-unit.target: Un nebūt kā tiem, kuri saka: "Mēs esam dzirdējuši,", bet viņi nevar dzirdēt.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are the deaf and dumb who do not use reason.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, sliktākajā dzīvas radības Allah aktuāli ir kurls un mēms, kas neizmanto iemesls.

trans-unit.source: Had Allah known any good in them, He would have made them hear. And if He had made them hear, they would [still] have turned away, while they were refusing.
trans-unit.target: Allah pazinusi kādu labu tiem, viņš būtu padarījuši to dzirdēt. Un ja viņš padarīja viņus uzklausīt, tie būtu [vēl] pagriezies projām, kamēr viņi bija atsakoties.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, respond to Allah and to the Messenger when he calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah intervenes between a man and his heart and that to Him you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, atbildēsit Allah Messenger un kad viņš aicina jūs uz to, kas jums dod dzīvību. Un zināt, Allah iejaucas, starp vīrieti un viņa sirdi un ka viņam jūs apkopos.

trans-unit.source: And fear a trial which will not strike those who have wronged among you exclusively, and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Un izmēģinājuma versiju, kas nav tie, kuri esat nodarījis jūsu vidū vienīgi, un zinām, ka Allāhs ir smagu sodu streiks bailes.

trans-unit.source: And remember when you were few and oppressed in the land, fearing that people might abduct you, but He sheltered you, supported you with His victory, and provided you with good things - that you might be grateful.
trans-unit.target: Un atcerieties, kad jums bija maz un apspiesto zemi, baidoties, ka jūs varētu nolaupīt cilvēkus, bet viņš tiek aizsargātas, nodrošina jūs ar savu uzvaru un nodrošina jūs ar labas lietas - varētu būt pateicīgi.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not betray Allah and the Messenger or betray your trusts while you know [the consequence].
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, nevar nodot Allah un Messenger vai nodot jūsu trastu, kamēr jūs ziniet [rezultāts].

trans-unit.source: And know that your properties and your children are but a trial and that Allah has with Him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Un zina, ka jūsu rekvizītus un jūsu bērni ir bet tiesu un Allah ir līdzi liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, if you fear Allah, He will grant you a criterion and will remove from you your misdeeds and forgive you. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ir uzskats, ja bailes Allah, viņš piešķirs kritērijs, un noņemot no jums jūsu ļaundarībām un piedot. Un Allah ir lielu devība valdītāju.

trans-unit.source: And [remember, O Muhammad], when those who disbelieved plotted against you to restrain you or kill you or evict you [from Makkah]. But they plan, and Allah plans. And Allah is the best of planners.
trans-unit.target: Un [atceries, O Muhammad], kad tiem, kuri disbelieved koordinātēs jūs ierobežot jums vai jūs nogalināt vai izlikt jūs [no Makkah]. Bet viņi plānu un Allah plāniem. Un Allah ir labākais no plānotājiem.

trans-unit.source: And when Our verses are recited to them, they say, "We have heard. If we willed, we could say [something] like this. This is not but legends of the former peoples."
trans-unit.target: Un kad mūsu vārsmas tiek citēja ar viņiem, viņi saka: "mēs esam dzirdējuši. Ja mums gribas, mēs varētu teikt [kaut] līdzīgs šim. Tas nav bet leģendas bijušais tautu."

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when they said, "O Allah, if this should be the truth from You, then rain down upon us stones from the sky or bring us a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: Un [atceros] kad viņi teica: "O Allāh, ja tas būtu patiesību no jums, tad akmeņi no debesīm pār mums lietus vai sniegs mums sāpīgi sods."

trans-unit.source: But Allah would not punish them while you, [O Muhammad], are among them, and Allah would not punish them while they seek forgiveness.
trans-unit.target: Bet Allāha varētu sodīt tos, kamēr jūs [O Muhammad], starp viņiem, un Allah varētu sodīt tos, kamēr viņi piedošanu.

trans-unit.source: But why should Allah not punish them while they obstruct [people] from al-Masjid al- Haram and they were not [fit to be] its guardians? Its [true] guardians are not but the righteous, but most of them do not know.
trans-unit.target: Bet kāpēc nevajadzētu Allah sodīt tos, kamēr viņi traucē [cilvēku] no al-Masjid al-Haram, un tie nebija [spēj būt] tās aizstāvji? Tās [tiesa] aizbildņiem nav bet taisns, bet vairums no viņiem nezina.

trans-unit.source: And their prayer at the House was not except whistling and handclapping. So taste the punishment for what you disbelieved.
trans-unit.target: Un viņu lūgšanu namā nebija, izņemot svilpoja un handclapping. Tātad sods par to, ko jūs disbelieved garša.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to avert [people] from the way of Allah. So they will spend it; then it will be for them a [source of] regret; then they will be overcome. And those who have disbelieved - unto Hell they will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kuri neticēt pavadīt savu bagātību no Allah veidā novērst [cilvēku]. Tātad viņi pavada tad tas būs viņiem [izcelsmes] žēl; tad viņi gūs virsroku. Un tiem, kam ir disbelieved - unto ellē viņi tiks savākta.

trans-unit.source: [This is] so that Allah may distinguish the wicked from the good and place the wicked some of them upon others and heap them all together and put them into Hell. It is those who are the losers.
trans-unit.target: [Tas] Allah var atšķirt ļauno no labas un novietojiet nelabs dažus no tiem pēc citiem kaudze viņus visus kopā un nodot tos uz elli. Tas ir tiem, kas ir zaudētāji.

trans-unit.source: Say to those who have disbelieved [that] if they cease, what has previously occurred will be forgiven for them. But if they return [to hostility] - then the precedent of the former [rebellious] peoples has already taken place.
trans-unit.target: Teikt tiem, kas ir disbelieved [ka] Ja viņi vairs nav, kas ir iepriekš noticis tiks piedots par viņiem. Bet, ja viņi atgriežas [naidīgums] - tad bijušais [dumpīgs] tautu precedents jau ir notikusi.

trans-unit.source: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion, all of it, is for Allah. And if they cease - then indeed, Allah is Seeing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Un viņiem cīnīties, kamēr nav fitnah un [līdz] Allah reliģija, visu to, ir. Un, ja viņi vairs nav - tad tiešām, Allah ir redzēt, ko viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away - then know that Allah is your protector. Excellent is the protector, and Excellent is the helper.
trans-unit.target: Bet ja viņi savukārt prom - tad zināt, ka Allāhs ir jūsu aizsargs. Lielisks aizsargs, un lieliski ir palīgs.

trans-unit.source: And know that anything you obtain of war booty - then indeed, for Allah is one fifth of it and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and the orphans, the needy, and the [stranded] traveler, if you have believed in Allah and in that which We sent down to Our Servant on the day of criterion - the day when the two armies met. And Allah, over all things, is competent.
trans-unit.target: Un zina, ka kaut ko iegādājaties kara laupījumu - tad tiešām par Allāhu ir vienu piekto daļu no tā un Messenger, un [viņa] tuvu radinieku un bāreņiem, trūcīgo un [balasta] ceļotājs, ja esat tic Allah un ka kas mēs nosūtīts mūsu kalps dienā kritērijs - dienā, kad tikās divas armijas. Un Allah, pār visām lietām, ir kompetenta.

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the farther side, and the caravan was lower [in position] than you. If you had made an appointment [to meet], you would have missed the appointment. But [it was] so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined - that those who perished [through disbelief] would perish upon evidence and those who lived [in faith] would live upon evidence; and indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: [Atceros] kad bijāt ielejā netālu no pusē, un viņi tālāk pusē un Treileru bija zemāks [pozīcija] nekā jūs. Ja esat izveidojis tikšanos [tikties], jums ir neatbildēti tikšanās. [Bija], bet tāpēc, ka Allāhs varētu paveikt jau paredzēti jautājums -, ka tiem, kuri gāja bojā [caur neticība] jāiet bojā uz pierādījumiem un tie, kuri dzīvoja [ticība] dzīvos uz pierādījumiem; un patiešām, Allah ir dzirdes un zinot.

trans-unit.source: [Remember, O Muhammad], when Allah showed them to you in your dream as few; and if He had shown them to you as many, you [believers] would have lost courage and would have disputed in the matter [of whether to fight], but Allah saved [you from that]. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: [Atceries, O Muhammad], kad Allah parādīja jums jūsu sapni par maz; un, ja viņš tiem bija parādījis viņiem jums tik daudz, jūs [ticīgie] būtu zaudējusi drosmi un ir apstrīdēts, jautājums [par to, vai cīnīties], bet Allāha saglabāti [jums no tā]. Protams, viņš ir zinot, ka pēc krūtis.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when He showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and He made you [appear] as few in their eyes so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined. And to Allah are [all] matters returned.
trans-unit.target: Un kad viņš parādīja viņiem jums, kad jūs tikāties, tik maz tavās acīs, un viņš lika tev [atceros] [parādās] tik maz viņu acīs tā, ka Allāhs varētu paveikt jau paredzēti jautājums. Un lai Allāhs [visi] jautājumiem es atdodu.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you encounter a company [from the enemy forces], stand firm and remember Allah much that you may be successful.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, sastopot sabiedrību [no ienaidnieka spēki] stāvēt stingri un atcerēties Allah daudz var būt veiksmīga.

trans-unit.source: And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute and [thus] lose courage and [then] your strength would depart; and be patient. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
trans-unit.target: Un ievērojiet Allah un viņa Messenger, nav strīdu, [tādējādi] zaudēt drosmi un [tad] varētu atkāpties savu spēku; un būt pacietīgam. Patiešām, Allah ir ar pacientu.

trans-unit.source: And do not be like those who came forth from their homes insolently and to be seen by people and avert [them] from the way of Allah. And Allah is encompassing of what they do.
trans-unit.target: Un nevar būt, piemēram, tiem, kuri nekaunīgi tālāk nāca no savām mājām, kā arī var redzēt personas, un novērst [tiem] no Allah veidā. Un Allah ir aptver, ko viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when Satan made their deeds pleasing to them and said, "No one can overcome you today from among the people, and indeed, I am your protector." But when the two armies sighted each other, he turned on his heels and said, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I see what you do not see; indeed I fear Allah. And Allah is severe in penalty."
trans-unit.target: Un kad sātans padarīja viņu darbiem patīkami uz tiem un teica: "neviens jūs šodien pārvarēt no cilvēkiem, un patiešām, es esmu jūsu aizsargs." [atceros] Bet, kad divām armijām novērots viens otram, viņš pagriezās uz papēžiem un teica: "Protams, es esmu piesaiste noņemta no jums. Patiešām, es redzu to, ko jūs neredzat; patiešām man bailes Allah. Un Allah ir smags sods."

trans-unit.source: [Remember] when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts was disease said, "Their religion has deluded those [Muslims]." But whoever relies upon Allah - then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: [Atceros] kad liekuļi un tiem, kuru sirdis bija slimības teica: "savu reliģiju ir maldināts tos [musulmaņi]." Bet tas, kurš ir atkarīga no Allah -, tad patiešām, Allah ir cildens spēka un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: And if you could but see when the angels take the souls of those who disbelieved... They are striking their faces and their backs and [saying], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja jūs varētu redzēt, bet kad eņģeļi veic dvēseles, kuri disbelieved... Tie ir pārsteidzošs sejām un viņu mugurām un [saka] "garšu Burning Fire sods.

trans-unit.source: That is for what your hands have put forth [of evil] and because Allah is not ever unjust to His servants."
trans-unit.target: Tas ir jūsu rokās ir izveidojuši tālāk [no ļaunuma] un jo Allah ir kādreiz netaisna saviem kalpiem nav. "

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They disbelieved in the signs of Allah, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: [Savējo ir], piemēram, pielāgotas cilvēku faraons, un tiem priekšā. Viņi disbelieved Allah, pazīmes, lai Allāhs konfiscēja tos par saviem grēkiem. Patiešām, Allah ir spēcīgs un smagu sodu.

trans-unit.source: That is because Allah would not change a favor which He had bestowed upon a people until they change what is within themselves. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tāpēc, ka Allāhs nemainīs labvēlība, kas viņam bija dāvājis cilvēkiem, līdz brīdim, kad tās maina to, kas ir sevī. Un patiešām, Allah ir dzirdes un zinot.

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and of those before them. They denied the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh. And all [of them] were wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: [Savējo ir], piemēram, pielāgotas cilvēku faraons, un tiem priekšā. Tās noliedza savu kungu, pazīmes, tāpēc mēs iznīcināt tos par saviem grēkiem, un mēs noslīka faraons cilvēki. Un tie visi [] bija pārkāpējus.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are those who have disbelieved, and they will not [ever] believe -
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, sliktākajā dzīvas radības Allah aktuāli ir tie, kuri ir disbelieved un tie netiks [vispār] uzskatu -

trans-unit.source: The ones with whom you made a treaty but then they break their pledge every time, and they do not fear Allah.
trans-unit.target: Tiem ar kuriem jums līgumu, bet tad viņi pauze savu solījumu katru reizi, un tās nav bailes Allah.

trans-unit.source: So if you, [O Muhammad], gain dominance over them in war, disperse by [means of] them those behind them that perhaps they will be reminded.
trans-unit.target: Tik ja jums [O Muhammad] iegūt dominējošo stāvokli pār tām karā, izklīst pa [līdzekļus] tos tiem aiz viņiem, ka varbūt viņi tiks atgādināts.

trans-unit.source: If you [have reason to] fear from a people betrayal, throw [their treaty] back to them, [putting you] on equal terms. Indeed, Allah does not like traitors.
trans-unit.target: Ja esat [iemesls] bailes no cilvēku nodevību, mest [to līgumu] atpakaļ uz tiem [liekot jums] uz vienlīdzīgiem noteikumiem. Patiešām, Allah nepatīk nodevēji.

trans-unit.source: And let not those who disbelieve think they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Un ļāva ne tādi, kuri neticēt, ka viņi nonāks. Patiešām, tie neradīs neveiksmes [lai Allāhs].

trans-unit.source: And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
trans-unit.target: Un sagatavot pret tām neatkarīgi no jums ir iespējams, varas un no kara, ar kuru var terrify ienaidnieks Allah un jūsu ienaidnieks, bet citi ne tikai tiem, kuriem jūs nezināt, [bet] kam rumaki Allah zina. Kāds jūs pavadījāt cēlonis Allah būs pilnībā jāatmaksā jums, un jūs nevar būt kaitējums.

trans-unit.source: And if they incline to peace, then incline to it [also] and rely upon Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja viņi liekties uz mieru, tad slīpums, lai tā [arī] un paļauties uz Allah. Patiešām, tas ir viņš, kurš ir dzirdes, zinot.

trans-unit.source: But if they intend to deceive you - then sufficient for you is Allah. It is He who supported you with His help and with the believers
trans-unit.target: Bet ja viņi plāno maldināt jums - tad pietiekami, ja jums ir Allah. Tas ir tas, kas nodrošina jūs ar viņa palīdzību un ticīgie

trans-unit.source: And brought together their hearts. If you had spent all that is in the earth, you could not have brought their hearts together; but Allah brought them together. Indeed, He is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Un pulcēja savās sirdīs. Ja jums bija pavadījis visu, kas ir zem zemes, jūs varētu nav nesušas savās sirdīs kopā; bet Allāha saveda viņus kopā. Patiešām, viņš ir cildens var un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, sufficient for you is Allah and for whoever follows you of the believers.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, pietiekami, ja jums ir Allah un kurš seko jums ticīgajiem.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, urge the believers to battle. If there are among you twenty [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome a thousand of those who have disbelieved because they are a people who do not understand.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet mudināt ticīgie kaujas. Ja jūsu vidū divdesmit, [kas ir] nelokāms, tās pārvarēt divus simtus. Un, ja starp jums simts, [kas ir] nelokāms, tās pārvarēt tūkstošiem, kuri ir disbelieved, jo tie ir cilvēki, kas nesaprot.

trans-unit.source: Now, Allah has lightened [the hardship] for you, and He knows that among you is weakness. So if there are from you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you a thousand, they will overcome two thousand by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the steadfast.
trans-unit.target: Tagad, Allah ir jau gaišs [grūtības] jums, un viņš zina, ka jūsu vidū ir vājums. Tātad, ja tur ir no jums simts, [kas ir] nelokāms, tās pārvarēt divus simtus. Un ja jūsu tūkstoš vidū, tos pārvarēt divus tūkstošus ar atļauju no Allah. Un Allah ir nelokāms.

trans-unit.source: It is not for a prophet to have captives [of war] until he inflicts a massacre [upon Allah 's enemies] in the land. Some Muslims desire the commodities of this world, but Allah desires [for you] the Hereafter. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Tas nav domāts pravietis ir gūstekņi [kara], līdz brīdim, kad viņš nodara slaktiņš [Allāhs ienaidniekiem] uz zemes. Dažiem musulmaņiem vēlme preces no šīs pasaules, bet Allah vēlas [tu] par turpmāk. Un spēka un gudri ir cildens Allah.

trans-unit.source: If not for a decree from Allah that preceded, you would have been touched for what you took by a great punishment.
trans-unit.target: Ja ne par dekrētu no Allah, kas kādam citam sola drīzu, jums būtu bijis aizkustināts par to, ko jūs paņēmāt, ko liels sods.

trans-unit.source: So consume what you have taken of war booty [as being] lawful and good, and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Tātad patērēt to, ko esat uzņēmis kā kara laupījums [atzīst], likumīgi un labā un bailes Allah. Patiešām, Allah ir piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, say to whoever is in your hands of the captives, "If Allah knows [any] good in your hearts, He will give you [something] better than what was taken from you, and He will forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, teiksim, lai tas, kurš ir jūsu rokās par gūstekņiem, "ja Allah zina [visas] labi savā sirdī, viņš jums [kaut] labāk nekā to, kas tika ņemts no jums, un viņš piedos jums; un Allah, piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs."

trans-unit.source: But if they intend to betray you - then they have already betrayed Allah before, and He empowered [you] over them. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: Bet, ja tās plāno nodot tevi - tad tie jau nodevis Allah pirms, un viņš [tu] pilnvaras pār viņiem. Un Allah ir zinot un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and emigrated and fought with their wealth and lives in the cause of Allah and those who gave shelter and aided - they are allies of one another. But those who believed and did not emigrate - for you there is no guardianship of them until they emigrate. And if they seek help of you for the religion, then you must help, except against a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kas ticēja un emigrēja un cīnījās ar viņu labklājību un dzīves cēlonis Allah un tiem, kas deva pajumti un atbalstītā - tie ir sabiedrotās valstis viena no otras. Bet tiem, kas ticēja un nevis emigrēt - jums ir bez aizbildnības, no tiem līdz brīdim, kad viņi emigrēt. Un, ja viņi meklē palīdzību no jums par reliģiju, tad ir jāpalīdz, izņemot pret cilvēkiem, starp sevi un kuriem ir līgums. Un Allah ir redzēt, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: And those who disbelieved are allies of one another. If you do not do so, there will be fitnah on earth and great corruption.
trans-unit.target: Un tie, kuri disbelieved sabiedrotās valstis viena no otras. Ja jūs to darāt, būs fitnah uz zemes un lielo korupciju.

trans-unit.source: But those who have believed and emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah and those who gave shelter and aided - it is they who are the believers, truly. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.
trans-unit.target: Bet tiem, kuri ticēja un emigrēja un cīnījās Allah un tiem, kas deva pajumti un atbalstītā - cēlonis ir tie, kuri ir patiesi ticīgie. Viņiem ir piedošanas un cēlu noteikums.

trans-unit.source: And those who believed after [the initial emigration] and emigrated and fought with you - they are of you. But those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Un tie, kuri uzskatīja, ka pēc [sākotnējā emigrācijas] un emigrēja un cīnījās ar jums - tie no jums. Bet tiem [asins] attiecības ir vairāk tiesības [mantojuma] Allah dekrēts. Patiešām, Allah ir zinot visas lietas.

trans-unit.source: [This is a declaration of] disassociation, from Allah and His Messenger, to those with whom you had made a treaty among the polytheists.
trans-unit.target: [Šī ir spēkā neesamības] norobežošanās no Allah un viņa Messenger tiem, ar kuriem bija veicis līgumā starp polytheists.

trans-unit.source: So travel freely, [O disbelievers], throughout the land [during] four months but know that you cannot cause failure to Allah and that Allah will disgrace the disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Tātad brīvi ceļot [O disbelievers] visā zemē [laikā] četrus mēnešus, bet zinu, ka jūs nevarētu izraisīt kļūmes Allahu un ka Allah būs kauns disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And [it is] an announcement from Allah and His Messenger to the people on the day of the greater pilgrimage that Allah is disassociated from the disbelievers, and [so is] His Messenger. So if you repent, that is best for you; but if you turn away - then know that you will not cause failure to Allah. And give tidings to those who disbelieve of a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Un [ir] sludinājumu no Allah un viņa Messenger cilvēki dienā lielāku svētceļojumā, kas Allah ir piesaiste noņemta no disbelievers, un [tā] viņa Messenger. Tātad, ja jūs nožēlot, ka jums vislabāk lietot; bet, ja jūs savukārt prom - tad zināt, ka jums nav radīt neveiksmes Allah. Un dot tiem, kuri neticēt sāpīgi sods vēstis.

trans-unit.source: Excepted are those with whom you made a treaty among the polytheists and then they have not been deficient toward you in anything or supported anyone against you; so complete for them their treaty until their term [has ended]. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
trans-unit.target: Izņēmums ir tie, ar kuriem veikti līgumā starp polytheists un pēc tam viņi nav deficīts pret jums kaut vai atbalstīja kāds pret tevi; lai pabeigtu viņiem to līgumu līdz pilnvaru [beigusies]. Patiešām, Allah mīl taisns, [kas bailes viņu].

trans-unit.source: And when the sacred months have passed, then kill the polytheists wherever you find them and capture them and besiege them and sit in wait for them at every place of ambush. But if they should repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, let them [go] on their way. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Un kad Svētās mēneši ir pagājuši, tad nogalini polytheists, kur tos atrast un sagūstīt tos un viņus ielenca un gaidīt tos katrs slazds vietā sēdēt. Bet, ja viņi būtu nožēlot, izveidot lūgšanu un dot zakah, ļaujiet viņiem [iet uz] ceļā. Patiešām, Allah ir piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then grant him protection so that he may hear the words of Allah. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.
trans-unit.target: Un ja kāds polytheists cenšas savu aizsardzību, piešķiram viņam aizsardzību tā, lai viņš dzird Allah vārdu. Pēc tam piegādāt viņam savu vietu drošību. Tas ir tāpēc, ka tie cilvēki, kas nezina.

trans-unit.source: How can there be for the polytheists a treaty in the sight of Allah and with His Messenger, except for those with whom you made a treaty at al-Masjid al-Haram? So as long as they are upright toward you, be upright toward them. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
trans-unit.target: Kā var pastāvēt, polytheists aktuāli Allah un ar viņa Messenger, izņemot tos, ar kuriem jūs veicāt līgumu al Masjid al-Haram līgums? Tātad, kamēr vien tie ir vertikālā virzienā uz sevi, būt stāvus uz viņu pusi. Patiešām, Allah mīl taisns, [kas bailes viņu].

trans-unit.source: How [can there be a treaty] while, if they gain dominance over you, they do not observe concerning you any pact of kinship or covenant of protection? They satisfy you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse [compliance], and most of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Kā [var būt līgums] kaut arī, ja viņi gūtu dominance pār jums, viņi neievēro jums attiecībā uz jebkuras paktā radniecības vai aizsardzības paktu? Viņi jūs neapmierinās ar mutēm, bet viņu sirdis atteikt [izpildes] un lielākā daļa no tām ir izaicinoši nepaklausīga.

trans-unit.source: They have exchanged the signs of Allah for a small price and averted [people] from His way. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir apmainīt Allah pazīmes par mazu cenu un novērstas [cilvēku] no savu ceļu. Patiešām, tas bija ļaunums, ko viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: They do not observe toward a believer any pact of kinship or covenant of protection. And it is they who are the transgressors.
trans-unit.target: Viņi neievēro ticīgais pret jebkuru pakta radniecības vai aizsardzības paktu. Un tas ir tie, kuri ir transgressors.

trans-unit.source: But if they repent, establish prayer, and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the verses for a people who know.
