And not absent from your Lord is any [part] of an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven or [anything] smaller than that or greater but that it is in a clear register.
trans-unit.target: Un [O Muhammad], tu neesi [darbā] jebkurā jautājumā vai deklamēt jebkuru no Korāns un jūs [cilvēku] darīt jebkurš akts, izņemot to, ka mēs esam liecinieki pār jums, kad jūs esat iesaistīts kādā tā. Un nav prom no jūsu kungs ir jebkuras [daļas] atoma svara zemes vai debesīs vai reģistrēt [kaut] mazāka vai lielāka, bet, ka tas ir skaidrs.

trans-unit.source: Unquestionably, [for] the allies of Allah there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve
trans-unit.target: Neapšaubāmi, [] Allāha sabiedrotajiem nebūs nekādu baiļu par to, kā arī būs tie sēro

trans-unit.source: Those who believed and were fearing Allah
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kas ticēja un bija baidoties no Allah

trans-unit.source: For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. No change is there in the words of Allah. That is what is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Viņiem ir labas vēstis pasaulīgās dzīves un turpmāk. Bez izmaiņām ir Allāha vārdiem. Lūk, kas ir liels sasniegšana.

trans-unit.source: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, honor [due to power] belongs to Allah entirely. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Un ļaujiet nav savu runu jūs sāpināt. Protams, godu [varas] dēļ pieder Allah pilnībā. Viņš ir dzirdes, zinot.

trans-unit.source: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth. And those who invoke other than Allah do not [actually] follow [His] "partners." They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying
trans-unit.target: Neapšaubāmi, Allah pieder tas, kurš ir debesīs un kurš ir uz zemes. Un atsaukties uz citiem mērķiem kā vien Allāhs, kuri nav sekot [faktiski] [viņa] "partneri". Viņi seko nav izņemot pieņēmums, un tie nav bet viltošanu

trans-unit.source: It is He who made for you the night to rest therein and the day, giving sight. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tas, kas lika jums atpūsties tajā un tajā dienā, naktī dot redzesloka. Patiešām, ka cilvēkiem, kas klausās, ir pazīmes.

trans-unit.source: They have said, "Allah has taken a son." Exalted is He; He is the [one] Free of need. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. You have no authority for this [claim]. Do you say about Allah that which you do not know?
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "Allah ir veikusi dēls." Cildenais; viņš ir Viņš ir nepieciešams [viena] bezmaksas. Viņam pieder kāds ir debesīs un kāds ir zeme. Tev nav [prasības] iestāde. Tu saki par Allah, ko jūs nezināt?

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed."
trans-unit.target: Teikt: "Patiesi, tie, kuri izgudrot meli par Allah neizdosies."

trans-unit.source: [For them is brief] enjoyment in this world; then to Us is their return; then We will make them taste the severe punishment because they used to disbelieve
trans-unit.target: [Par tiem ir īss] prieks šajā pasaulē; tad mums ir to atdevi; tad sāksim tos nobaudīt bargu sodu, jo viņi mēdzu neticēt

trans-unit.source: And recite to them the news of Noah, when he said to his people, "O my people, if my residence and my reminding of the signs of Allah has become burdensome upon you - then I have relied upon Allah. So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates. Then let not your plan be obscure to you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.
trans-unit.target: Un deklamēt tiem Noah, jaunumi, kad viņš teica savai tautai, "mana tauta, ja mana dzīvesvieta un mana atgādinot pazīmes Allah ir kļuvusi apgrūtinoša pār jums - tad ir balstījusies uz Allah O. Lai atrisinātu pēc sava plāna un [pieaicināt] jūsu asociētajos uzņēmumos. Tad ļaujiet nav jūsu plāns ir neskaidra, lai jums. Pēc tam veic to uz mani, un ne man atelpu.

trans-unit.source: And if you turn away [from my advice] then no payment have I asked of you. My reward is only from Allah, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims."
trans-unit.target: Un ja jūs novērsties [no manu padomu] tad neviens maksājums ir es jautāju jums. Mana alga ir tikai no Allah, un ir pavēlēts būt musulmaņu.

trans-unit.source: And they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship and made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.
trans-unit.target: Un tie liedza viņam, tāpēc mēs saglabāti viņu, un ar viņu kuģis, un padarīt tās tiesību pārņēmējiem, un mums tie, kuri noliedza mūsu zīmes noslīka. Tad redzētu, cik bija beigas, kuri tika brīdināti.

trans-unit.source: Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs nosūtījām viņam pakaļ ziņnešus uz savu tautu, un tie nāca ar viņiem ar skaidru apliecinājumu. Bet tie nav ticam, ka tas, kas viņiem iepriekš nebija pieejams. Tādējādi mēs zīmogu gaitā transgressors sirdis

trans-unit.source: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his establishment with Our signs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a criminal people
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs nosūtījām viņiem pakaļ Moses un Ārons faraons un savā uzņēmumā ar mūsu zīmes, bet viņi arrogantly izturējās un kriminālo ļaudis

trans-unit.source: So when there came to them the truth from Us, they said, "Indeed, this is obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Tad, kad tur ieradās viņiem patiesību no mums, viņi teica: "Protams, tas ir acīmredzami burvju."

trans-unit.source: Moses said, "Do you say [thus] about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? But magicians will not succeed."
trans-unit.target: Moses teica: "jūs sakāt, [tādējādi] par patiesību, kad tā ir nonākusi pie jums? Tas ir burvju Taču burvji neizdosies."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from that upon which we found our fathers and so that you two may have grandeur in the land? And we are not believers in you."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "jūs nākt pie mums savukārt mūs prom no, uz kuriem mēs noskaidrojām mūsu tēvi un tāpēc, ka jūs abi var būt varenību zemi? Un mēs neesam ticīgie jūsos."

trans-unit.source: And Pharaoh said, "Bring to me every learned magician."
trans-unit.target: Un faraons sacīja: "Dot man katru skolotie burvis."

trans-unit.source: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw down whatever you will throw."
trans-unit.target: Tātad kad magicians nāca, Moses teica viņiem, "mest uz leju, kāds būs mest."

trans-unit.source: And when they had thrown, Moses said, "What you have brought is [only] magic. Indeed, Allah will expose its worthlessness. Indeed, Allah does not amend the work of corrupters.
trans-unit.target: Un kad viņi bija izmet, Moses teica: "tas, ko jūs esat novedis [tikai] burvju. Patiešām, Allah pakļaut tās worthlessness. Patiešām, Allah negroza corrupters darbu.

trans-unit.source: And Allah will establish the truth by His words, even if the criminals dislike it."
trans-unit.target: Un Allah nodibinās patiesību, viņa vārdiem sakot, pat tad, ja noziedznieki nepatīk."

trans-unit.source: But no one believed Moses, except [some] youths among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors
trans-unit.target: Bet neviens ticēja Moses, izņemot [kādu] jauniešu vidū viņa cilvēki, baidoties no faraons, un savā uzņēmumā, ka viņi varētu vajāt tos. Patiešām, faraons bija augstprātīgs laikā zemi un tiešām viņš bija, transgressors

trans-unit.source: And Moses said, "O my people, if you have believed in Allah, then rely upon Him, if you should be Muslims."
trans-unit.target: Un Moses teica: "Mana tauta, ja jūs esat tic Allah, tad paļauties uz viņu, ja jums būtu musulmaņu O."

trans-unit.source: So they said, "Upon Allah do we rely. Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people
trans-unit.target: Tā viņi teica: "pēc Allah darīt mums paļauties. Mūsu Kungā, padara mūs ne [objekti] trial grēks cilvēku

trans-unit.source: And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people."
trans-unit.target: Un glābt mūs ar savu žēlastību no neticīgi cilvēki."

trans-unit.source: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, "Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses [facing the] qiblah and establish prayer and give good tidings to the believers."
trans-unit.target: Un mēs iedvesmoja Moses un viņa brālis, "nokārtot jūsu cilvēki Ēģiptē nami un padarīt jūsu mājas [saskaras] qiblah un izveidot lūgšanu un dot labas vēstis ticīgie."

trans-unit.source: And Moses said, "Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord, that they may lead [men] astray from Your way. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: Un Moses teica: "mūsu kungs, tik tiešām jums ir dota faraons un viņa uzņēmums krāšņums un bagātība pasaulīgās dzīves kungam, ka tie var izraisīt [vīriešiem] apmaldīties no savu ceļu. Mūsu Kungā, iznīcināt savu bagātību un nocietināt savas sirdis, tāpēc, ka viņiem negribas ticēt, ka līdz brīdim, kad viņi redz sāpīgi sods."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Your supplication has been answered." So remain on a right course and follow not the way of those who do not know."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] teica: "jūsu lūgšanas ir atbildēts." Tā joprojām ir uz pareizā ceļa un sekot nav veids, kā tie, kuri nezina."

trans-unit.source: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims."
trans-unit.target: Mēs ņēmām Izraēla bērniem pāri jūrai un faraons un kareivju tiecas pēc viņiem tirāniju un ienaids līdz, kad noslīkšana izveda viņu, viņš teica: "es uzskatu, izņemot to, ka, kam Israēla bērni ticēt, un es esmu no musulmaņiem nav neviena dievība."

trans-unit.source: Now? And you had disobeyed [Him] before and were of the corrupters?
trans-unit.target: Tagad? Un bija neklausīt [viņam] pirms un bija corrupters?

trans-unit.source: So today We will save you in body that you may be to those who succeed you a sign. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc šodien mums ietaupīs jūsu organismā, kas var būt tiem, kuriem izdodas jums zīmi. Un tik tiešām, daudzi starp cilvēkiem, mūsu pazīmes ir neuzmanīgs

trans-unit.source: And We had certainty settled the Children of Israel in an agreeable settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until [after] knowledge had come to them. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ
trans-unit.target: Un mums bija pārliecība norēķinās Izraēlas bērniem pieņemama norēķinu un nodrošinājusi tās ar labas lietas. Un tie neatšķīrās līdz [pēc] zināšanas bija atnāks pie viņiem. Patiešām, starp tiem augšāmcelšanās diena, pār kurām viņi mēdza atšķirties attiecībā uz vērtēs savu kungu

trans-unit.source: So if you are in doubt, [O Muhammad], about that which We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc, ja rodas neskaidrības, [O Muhammad], par to, ko mums parādīja, tad lūgt tiem, kuri ir lasījuši rakstus pirms. Patiesība ir noteikti nāk pie jums no jūsu kungs, tik un tā nebūs starp doubters.

trans-unit.source: And never be of those who deny the signs of Allah and [thus] be among the losers.
trans-unit.target: Un nekad nebūs, kuri noliedz Allah pazīmes un [tādējādi] starp zaudētājiem.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those upon whom the word of your Lord has come into effect will not believe,
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tie, pēc kuriem jūsu Kunga vārds ir stājies spēkā nevis uzskatu,

trans-unit.source: Even if every sign should come to them, until they see the painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Pat tad, ja katru zīmi jānāk tiem, līdz viņi redz sāpīgi sods.

trans-unit.source: Then has there not been a [single] city that believed so its faith benefited it except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in worldly life and gave them enjoyment for a time.
trans-unit.target: Tad tur nav bijis [vienu] pilsēta, kas uzskatīja, ka tā savu ticību guva labumu izņemot Jonas cilvēkus? Kad viņi ticēja, mēs izņemta no tiem sodu par negodu pasaulīgās dzīves un deva viņiem prieku uz laiku.

trans-unit.source: And had your Lord willed, those on earth would have believed - all of them entirely. Then, [O Muhammad], would you compel the people in order that they become believers?
trans-unit.target: Un jūsu Kunga gribas, tiem, kas uz zemes nebūtu ticējis - visas no tām pilnībā. Tad [O Muhammad], nebūtu jūs piespiest cilvēkus, lai tie kļūtu par ticīgo?

trans-unit.source: And it is not for a soul to believe except by permission of Allah, and He will place defilement upon those who will not use reason.
trans-unit.target: Tas nav dvēsele domāt, izņemot ar atļauju no Allah un viņš uzliks defilement pēc tiem, kas neizmantos iemesls.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Observe what is in the heavens and earth." But of no avail will be signs or warners to a people who do not believe
trans-unit.target: Teiksim, "Novērot to, kas ir debesu un zemes". Bet par velti būs pazīmes vai warners cilvēkiem, kas netic

trans-unit.source: So do they wait except for like [what occurred in] the days of those who passed on before them? Say, "Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
trans-unit.target: Tātad vai viņi gaida izņemot kā [kas noticis] dienas no tiem, kas nodots viņiem priekšā? Proti, "pēc tam gaidīt; patiešām, es esmu kopā ar jums, starp tiem, kuri gaida."

trans-unit.source: Then We will save our messengers and those who have believed. Thus, it is an obligation upon Us that We save the believers
trans-unit.target: Tad mums saglabāt mūsu kurjeriem un tiem, kam ir uzskats. Tātad, tas ir mums, ka mēs saglabājam ticīgie pienākumu

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "O people, if you are in doubt as to my religion - then I do not worship those which you worship besides Allah; but I worship Allah, who causes your death. And I have been commanded to be of the believers
trans-unit.target: Teiksim, [O Muhammad] "O cilvēku, ja jums ir šaubas par manu reliģiju - tad es nav dievkalpojumu, kuri pielūdz papildus Allah; bet es dievkalpojumu Allah, kas izraisa jūsu nāves. Un ir pavēlēts būt ticīgo

trans-unit.source: And [commanded], 'Direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth, and never be of those who associate others with Allah;
trans-unit.target: Un [komandēja] "virzīt savu seju pret reliģiju, piešķiebdama patiesību un nekad būt, kuri citi saista ar Allah;

trans-unit.source: And do not invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then indeed you would be of the wrongdoers.'"
trans-unit.target: Un neatsaucas ne tikai Allāhs, ka kas ne priekšrocības, jūs ne nodara kaitējumu jums, ja jūs jautāšot, tad patiešām jūs būtu no pārkāpējus. ""

trans-unit.source: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him; and if He intends for you good, then there is no repeller of His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful
trans-unit.target: Un, ja Allah jums vajadzētu pieskarties ar nedienās, nav noņēmēju, izņemot viņu; un ja viņš paredz jums labu, tad tur nav repeller savas veltes. Viņš rada to aizsniegt, ko viņš vēlas no saviem kalpiem. Un viņš ir, piedošanu, žēlsirdīgs

trans-unit.source: Say, "O mankind, the truth has come to you from your Lord, so whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray [in violation] against it. And I am not over you a manager."
trans-unit.target: Teiksim, "O cilvēcei, patiesība ir nākt pie jums no kungu, lai tikai tas, kurš vadās vadās [labu] viņa dvēsele, un tas, kurš iet apmaldīties tikai iet apmaldīties [pārkāpuma] pret to. Un es neesmu pār jums vadītājs."

trans-unit.source: And follow what is revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and be patient until Allah will judge. And He is the best of judges.
trans-unit.target: Un sekot, ko atklāja jums [O Muhammad], un esiet pacietīgi, kamēr Allah spriedīs. Un viņš ir labākais no tiesnešiem.

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book whose verses are perfected and then presented in detail from [one who is] Wise and Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Ra. [tas] grāmata, kura panti ir pilnveidojies un tad iepazīstināja sīkāk no [kas ir] gudrs un Acquainted.

trans-unit.source: [Through a messenger, saying], "Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of good tidings,"
trans-unit.target: [Caur messenger, sakot], "nav dievkalpojumu izņemot Allah. Patiešām, es esmu jums no viņa warner un nesēja labas vēstis"

trans-unit.source: And [saying], "Seek forgiveness of your Lord and repent to Him, [and] He will let you enjoy a good provision for a specified term and give every doer of favor his favor. But if you turn away, then indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.
trans-unit.target: Un [saka] "piedošanu par savu kungu un nožēlot viņu, [un] viņš ļaus jums baudīt labu norādīto termiņu paredz un dod katrs izpildītājs labvēlību viņa labvēlību. Bet ja jūs novērsties, tad patiešām, es baidos jums sods par liela diena.

trans-unit.source: To Allah is your return, and He is over all things competent."
trans-unit.target: Allahu savu peļņu, un viņš ir pār visām lietām, kas ir kompetenta."

trans-unit.source: Unquestionably, they the disbelievers turn away their breasts to hide themselves from Him. Unquestionably, [even] when they cover themselves in their clothing, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Neapšaubāmi, viņi disbelievers novērsties viņu krūtis un slēpt sevi no viņa. Neapšaubāmi, [pat] kad tie aptver sevi ar savu apģērbu, Allah zina, ko viņi slēpj un ko tās deklarē. Protams, viņš ir zinot, ka pēc krūtis.

trans-unit.source: And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allah is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. All is in a clear register.
trans-unit.target: Un nav neviena dzīva radība uz zemes, bet kas pēc Allah ir tās noteikumus, un viņš zina sava mājokļa vieta un uzglabāšanas vieta. Viss ir skaidrs reģistrā.

trans-unit.source: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and His Throne had been upon water - that He might test you as to which of you is best in deed. But if you say, "Indeed, you are resurrected after death," those who disbelieve will surely say, "This is not but obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Un tas ir tas, kas radīja debesis un zemi sešās dienās - un viņa tronis bija pēc ūdens - ka viņš varētu testu jums par to, kurš no jums ir labākais darbos. Bet ja jūs sakāt, "Protams, jums ir augšāmcēlies pēc nāves," kuri neticēt būs noteikti teikt, "Tas nav acīmredzams, bet maģija."

trans-unit.source: And if We hold back from them the punishment for a limited time, they will surely say, "What detains it?" Unquestionably, on the Day it comes to them, it will not be averted from them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Un ja mēs atturēties no viņiem sods uz ierobežotu laiku, viņi droši vien teiks, "ko detains to?" Neapšaubāmi, dienā, runa ir par tiem, nav tas izdosies, no tiem, un tie tiks tīts, ko viņi izmanto izsmiekls.

trans-unit.source: And if We give man a taste of mercy from Us and then We withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja mēs dodam cilvēkam garšu žēlastību no mums un tad mēs izņemtu to no viņa, protams, viņš ir skumīgs un nepateicīgs.

trans-unit.source: But if We give him a taste of favor after hardship has touched him, he will surely say, "Bad times have left me." Indeed, he is exultant and boastful -
trans-unit.target: Bet ja mēs dodam, viņam labu garšu grūtības ir pieskārusies viņam, viņš droši vien sacīs: "sliktos laikos ir atstājis man." Protams, viņš ir gavilējošs un lielīgs-

trans-unit.source: Except for those who are patient and do righteous deeds; those will have forgiveness and great reward.
trans-unit.target: Izņemot tos, kas pacientam un darīt taisns darbus; tie būs piedošana un liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: Then would you possibly leave [out] some of what is revealed to you, or is your breast constrained by it because they say, "Why has there not been sent down to him a treasure or come with him an angel?" But you are only a warner. And Allah is Disposer of all things.
trans-unit.target: Tad būtu iespējams atstājat [,], daži par to, ko atklāja pie jums vai jūsu krūts ierobežo to tāpēc, ka viņi saka: "Kāpēc tur nav nosūtīta uz leju viņam dārgumu vai aizbraukt viņam līdzi eņģeli?" Bet tu esi tikai warner. Un Allah aizvākšanu no visām lietām.

trans-unit.source: Or do they say, "He invented it"? Say, "Then bring ten surahs like it that have been invented and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allah, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Vai viņi saka, "Viņš izgudroja to"? Proti, "pēc tam dot desmit surahs tāpat kā tas, kas ir izgudrots un pieaicināt [palīdzību] whomever var papildus Allah, ja jums ir jābūt patiesam."

trans-unit.source: And if they do not respond to you - then know that the Qur'an was revealed with the knowledge of Allah and that there is no deity except Him. Then, would you [not] be Muslims?
trans-unit.target: Un ja tie nav atbildēt uz jūs - zināt, ka Korāns tika atklāts ar zināšanām par Allah un ka neviens, izņemot viņu dievība. Pēc tam jūs [] nebūtu musulmaņiem?

trans-unit.source: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments - We fully repay them for their deeds therein, and they therein will not be deprived.
trans-unit.target: Kurš vēlas dzīvi šajā pasaulē un tās rotas - mēs pilnībā tos atmaksāt par viņu darbiem tur, un viņi tajā būs nevar tikt liegta.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones for whom there is not in the Hereafter but the Fire. And lost is what they did therein, and worthless is what they used to do.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir tie, par kuriem nav tekstā, bet uguns. Un zaudēja to, ko viņi tur darīja, un bezvērtīgas ir to, ko viņi mēdza to darīt agrāk.

trans-unit.source: So is one who [stands] upon a clear evidence from his Lord [like the aforementioned]? And a witness from Him follows it, and before it was the Scripture of Moses to lead and as mercy. Those [believers in the former revelations] believe in the Qur'an. But whoever disbelieves in it from the [various] factions - the Fire is his promised destination. So be not in doubt about it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the people do not believe.
trans-unit.target: Tātad ir viens kurš [stāv] pēc skaidras liecības no viņa kungs [kā iepriekšminētā]? Un no viņa liecinieks tai seko, un pirms tam bija svētie raksti, Moses vadīt, kā žēlsirdība. Korāns tic tiem [bijušais atklājumiem ticīgie]. Bet tas, kurš disbelieves to no frakcijām [dažādi] - uguns viņa solītā mērķa. Tātad nevar būt šaubu par to. Patiešām, tas ir patiesību no savu kungu, bet lielākā daļa cilvēku netic.

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah? Those will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, "These are the ones who lied against their Lord." Unquestionably, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Un kurš ir netaisna vairāk nekā tas, kurš izdomā meli par Allah? Tiem, kas tiks iesniegts pirms to Kungu un lieciniekiem teiks, "Tie ir tie, kas meloja pret savu kungu." Neapšaubāmi, nolādēt no Allah būs vērsts pret pārkāpējus.

trans-unit.source: Who averted [people] from the way of Allah and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they, concerning the Hereafter, were disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Kas novērstas [cilvēku] no Allah veids un centās padarīt to [šķiet] deviant kamēr, attiecas uz turpmāk, tie disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: Those were not causing failure [to Allah] on earth, nor did they have besides Allah any protectors. For them the punishment will be multiplied. They were not able to hear, nor did they see.
trans-unit.target: Ne tiem, kas radīja nevēlēšanās [Allah] uz zemes, kā arī viņi ir ne tikai Allāhs jebkuru aizsargi. Viņiem tiks reizināti sods. Tie nav varējuši dzirdēt, ne arī izdarīja, viņi redz.

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones who will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir tie, kuri būs zaudējuši paši un zaudēja no tiem ir tas, ko viņi izmanto, izgudrot.

trans-unit.source: Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the greatest losers.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tas ir tās tekstā, kurš būs lielākais zaudētāji.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbled themselves to their Lord - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide eternally therein.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tie, kuri ticēja un izdarīts taisnīgs darbiem un humbled sevi viņu kungs - tie ir paradīze; biedrus tie būs mūžīgi tur ievērot.

trans-unit.source: The example of the two parties is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?
trans-unit.target: Piemēram, abas puses ir, piemēram, neredzīgo un nedzirdīgo un redzēt un dzirdes. Tie ir vienāds salīdzinājums? Tad jums nav atcerēties?

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti atsūtīja Noa savai tautai [saka] "patiešām, es esmu jums skaidru warner

trans-unit.source: That you not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day."
trans-unit.target: Ka jums nav dievkalpojumu, izņemot Allah. Patiešām, es baidos jums sāpīgās dienas sods."

trans-unit.source: So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we do not see in you over us any merit; rather, we think you are liars."
trans-unit.target: Tik izcili starp tiem, kas no viņa cilvēkiem disbelieved teica: "mēs jūs neredzat sevi, piemēram, bet kā cilvēks, un mēs neredzam, kurš jūs izsekoja izņemot tos, kas ir mazākais no mums [un] pēc pirmo ierosinājumu. Un mēs redzēt jūs pār mums visiem nopelniem; pareizāk sakot, mēs domājam, ka jums ir liars."

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord while He has given me mercy from Himself but it has been made unapparent to you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it?
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "O, mana tauta, ka jūs uzskatīja: ja vajadzētu būt pēc skaidri pierādījumi no manam kungam, kamēr viņš ir devis man žēlastība no sevis, bet tas padarīts unapparent jums, vajadzētu mums piespiest to pār jums, kamēr jūs esat negatīvās uz tā?

trans-unit.source: And O my people, I ask not of you for it any wealth. My reward is not but from Allah. And I am not one to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.
trans-unit.target: Un O mana tauta, es lūgtu ne no jums, tā visas bagātības. Mana alga ir ne, bet no Allah. Un es neesmu viena, lai patriektu tiem, kuri ir uzskats. Patiesi, viņi tiksies ar savu kungu, bet es redzu, ka jums ir cilvēki, kas uzvedība ignorantly.

trans-unit.source: And O my people, who would protect me from Allah if I drove them away? Then will you not be reminded?
trans-unit.target: Un O mana tauta, kas spēs pasargāt mani no Allah, ja man dzina viņus prom? Pēc tam tiks jums nav atgādināts, ka?

trans-unit.source: And I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel, nor do I say of those upon whom your eyes look down that Allah will never grant them any good. Allah is most knowing of what is within their souls. Indeed, I would then be among the wrongdoers."
trans-unit.target: Un es tev pateikt, ka man depozitārijos [saturošu nodrošināšana], Allah vai ka es zinu, neredzēts, ne man pateikt jums, ka es esmu eņģelis, ne es varu teikt no tiem, pēc kuriem jūsu acīm skatos ka Allah nekad piešķirs tiem kādas labas. Allah ir visvairāk zinot par to, kas ir viņu dvēseles. Patiešām, man tad būtu starp pārkāpējus.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "O Noa, jums ir apstrīdēts mums un bijis strīds mums bieži. Tātad dot mums to, kas jums draud mums, ja jums ir jābūt patiesam."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Allah will only bring it to you if He wills, and you will not cause [Him] failure.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Allah tikai nesīs to jums, ja viņš vēlas, un jums neradīs [viņam] kļūme.

trans-unit.source: And my advice will not benefit you - although I wished to advise you - If Allah should intend to put you in error. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned."
trans-unit.target: Un mans ieteikums negūs labumu jums - lai gan es gribētu ieteikt jums - ja Allah būtu plāno nodot jums kļūda. Viņš ir jūsu kungs, un viņam tiks atgriezts.

trans-unit.source: Or do they say [about Prophet Muhammad], "He invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime; but I am innocent of what [crimes] you commit."
trans-unit.target: Vai viņi saka [par pravieša Muhameda], "viņš izgudroja to"? Proti, "Ja ir izgudroja to, tad man virsū ir [sekas] mans noziegums; bet es esmu nevainīgs kāda [noziegumu] izdarīt. "

trans-unit.source: And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.
trans-unit.target: Un tā tika atklāti pret Nou, ka "neviens neticēs no cilvēkiem, izņemot tos, kuri ir jau uzskats, tāpēc nav apbēdināts par to, ko viņi ir darījuši.

trans-unit.source: And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned."
trans-unit.target: Un uzbūvēt kuģi zem mūsu novērojumiem un mūsu iedvesmas un neietekmē mani par tiem, kas ir nodarīts kaitējums; Protams, tie ir [] noslīka. "

trans-unit.source: And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Viņš būvē kuģa un kad asamblejas izcili viņa cilvēki viņam garām, tie viņu izsmēja. Viņš teica: "Ja jūs izsmiet mums, tad mums būs izsmiekls, tāpat kā jūs izsmiekls.

trans-unit.source: And you are going to know who will get a punishment that will disgrace him [on earth] and upon whom will descend an enduring punishment [in the Hereafter]."
trans-unit.target: Un jūs zināt, kurš saņems sodu, kas būs kauns viņu [zemes], un uz kuru tiks nolaisties ilgstošu sodu [turpmāk]."

trans-unit.source: [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon the ship of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed." But none had believed with him, except a few.
trans-unit.target: [Tā arī bija], līdz, kad mūsu komanda nāca un krāsns pārpildīts, mēs teicām: "Slodze uz kuģa katra [radījums] diviem biedriem un savu ģimeni, izņemot tos, par kuriem ir pirms vārdu, un [ir], kurš uzskatīja,." Bet neviens cerēja, ka kopā ar viņu, izņemot dažus.

trans-unit.source: And [Noah] said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Un [Noa] teica: "iekāpt tajā; tā kā nosaukums Allah ir savu gaitu un tās stiprinājums. Protams, mans Lord ir piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs."

trans-unit.source: And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disbelievers."
trans-unit.target: Un tas, kas kuģoja ar tiem cauri viļņiem kā kalni un Noah sauc savu dēlu, kurš bija izņemot [tiem], "O mans dēls, kāpjošos ar mums nedrīkst būt ar disbelievers."

trans-unit.source: [But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of Allah, except for whom He gives mercy." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.
trans-unit.target: [Bet] viņš teica: "Es veikšu patvērumu uz kalnu, lai pasargātu mani no ūdens." [Noa] teica: "Tur ir šodien no dekrēta Allah, izņemot to, kam viņš dod žēlsirdība nav aizsargs." Un viļņi bija starp tiem, un viņš bija starp noslīka.

trans-unit.source: And it was said, "O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain]." And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on the [mountain of] Judiyy. And it was said, "Away with the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Un tas bija teica: "O, zeme, norīt jūsu ūdens un debesis, ieturēt [jūsu lietus] O." Ūdens norimās, un jautājums tika paveikts un kuģis ieradās atpūsties uz [kalnu] Judiyy. Un tas bija teica: "Prom ar grēks cilvēku."

trans-unit.source: And Noah called to his Lord and said, "My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!"
trans-unit.target: Un Noa viņa kungs sauca un sacīja: "mans kungs, patiešām ir mans dēls un mana ģimene; un tik tiešām, savu solījumu ir taisnība; un jūs esat visvairāk tieši no tiesnešiem!"

trans-unit.source: He said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "O Noa, patiesībā viņš nav jūsu ģimenes locekļiem; patiešām, viņš ir [viena kuru] darbs bija, kas nav taisnīgs, tāpēc lūgt mani nav, par to, kas jums ir zināšanas. Patiešām, es ieteiktu jums, citādi jūs būtu viens neziņā."

trans-unit.source: [Noah] said, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me, I will be among the losers."
trans-unit.target: [Noa] teica: "mans kungs, es meklēt patvērumu jums vaicāt, kas man ir bez zināšanām. Un, ja vien man piedod un apžēlojies par mani, es būšu starp zaudētāji."

trans-unit.source: It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment."
trans-unit.target: Tas tika teikts, "Noa O izkāpt drošībā no mums un svētību pār jums un Nāciju [dilstošā secībā], no tiem ar jums. Bet citām nācijām [tiem] mēs piešķiram prieku; tad tur touch tiem no mums sāpīgi sods."

trans-unit.source: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir no neredzēts, kurā mēs atklāt jums [O Muhammad] jaunumi. Jūs zināja, ka tā nav, ne jūs, ne jūsu cilvēki, pirms šīs. Tāpēc esiet pacietīgs; patiešām, [labāko] iznākums ir taisns.

trans-unit.source: And to 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. You are not but inventors [of falsehood].
trans-unit.target: Un "[mēs nosūtījām] Aad viņu brālis Hud. Viņš teica: "O mana tauta, dievkalpojumu Allah; tev nav nekā viņu dievība. Jūs neesat bet izgudrotāji [par nepatiesību].

trans-unit.source: O my people, I do not ask you for it any reward. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?
trans-unit.target: O mana tauta, es nelūdzu jūs to jebkāda atlīdzība. Mana alga ir tikai no tā, kas radīja man. Pēc tam būs jums nav iemesls?

trans-unit.source: And O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. And do not turn away, [being] criminals."
trans-unit.target: Un O mana tauta, lūgt piedošanu par savu kungu un tad nožēlot viņu. Viņš nosūtīs [lietus no] debesis pār jums dušā un pieaugumu [pievienot] tavu spēku stiprums. Un nevis novērsties, [ir] noziedznieki."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Hud, you have not brought us clear evidence, and we are not ones to leave our gods on your say-so. Nor are we believers in you.
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: O Hud, jums nav nesušas mums skaidrus pierādījumus, un mēs neesam tie atstāj mūsu Dievu par savu say-so. Ne mēs esam ticīgie, kas jums.

trans-unit.source: We only say that some of our gods have possessed you with evil." He said, "Indeed, I call Allah to witness, and witness [yourselves] that I am free from whatever you associate with Allah
trans-unit.target: Mēs tikai teikt, ka daži no mūsu dievi ir tev bija prāts ar ļaunu." Viņš teica: patiesi, es zvanu Allah liecinieks, un liecinieks [sev], ka es esmu brīva no kāda jūs saista ar Allah

trans-unit.source: Other than Him. So plot against me all together; then do not give me respite.
trans-unit.target: Izņemot viņu. Tātad zemes gabalu pret mani visi kopā; pēc tam nedod man atelpu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I have relied upon Allah, my Lord and your Lord. There is no creature but that He holds its forelock. Indeed, my Lord is on a path [that is] straight."
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, ir paļauties Allah, milord un savu kungu. Nav neviena dzīva radība, bet, ka viņš tur tā cekula. Protams, mans Lord ir ceļā, [kas ir] taisni. "

trans-unit.source: But if they turn away, [say], "I have already conveyed that with which I was sent to you. My Lord will give succession to a people other than you, and you will not harm Him at all. Indeed my Lord is, over all things, Guardian."
trans-unit.target: Bet ja viņi savukārt prom, [saka], "man ir jau izteica, ka ar kuru es tika nosūtīts jums. Mans kungs dos kārtas cilvēkiem, izņemot jūs, un jums nebūs kaitēt viņu vispār. Patiešām manam kungam ir pār visām lietām, aizbildnis."

trans-unit.source: And when Our command came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us; and We saved them from a harsh punishment.
trans-unit.target: Un ienākot mūsu komandas, mēs izglābām Hud, un tiem, kas ticēja viņam līdzi, ar žēlastību no mums; un mēs viņus izglābis no bargs sods.

trans-unit.source: And that was 'Aad, who rejected the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.
trans-unit.target: Un tas bija "Aad, kuri noraidīja viņu kungs pazīmes un neklausīt savas kurjeriem un sekoju katru stūrgalvīgs tirāns pasūtījuma.

trans-unit.source: And they were [therefore] followed in this world with a curse and [as well] on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, 'Aad denied their Lord; then away with 'Aad, the people of Hud.
trans-unit.target: Un viņi sekoja [tādējādi] šajā pasaulē ar lāstu un [arī] uz augšāmcelšanās dienu. Neapšaubāmi, "Aad noliedza savu kungu; pēc tam aizraujas ar "Aad Hud cilvēki.

trans-unit.source: And to Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. He has produced you from the earth and settled you in it, so ask forgiveness of Him and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive."
trans-unit.target: Thamud [mēs nosūtījām] un viņu brālis Salih. Viņš teica: "O mana tauta, dievkalpojumu Allah; tev nav nekā viņu dievība. Viņš ir saražota zemes un apmetās jums, tāpēc lūgt piedošanu no viņa un viņam pēc tam nožēlot. Patiešām, mans Lord ir tuvumā un atsaucīgu."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Salih, you were among us a man of promise before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers worshipped? And indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "O Salih jūs būtu mūsu vidū cilvēks pirms šo solījumu. Darīt jums nedod mums dievkalpojumu mūsu tēvi pielūdz? Un patiešām mēs esam par to, kam jūs aicināt mūs, satraucošām apšaubāma."

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Himself, who would protect me from Allah if I disobeyed Him? So you would not increase me except in loss.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "O mana tauta, ka jūs uzskatīja: ja vajadzētu būt pēc skaidri pierādījumi no manam kungam un viņš ir devis man žēlastība no sevis, kas spēs pasargāt mani no Allah, ja es viņam neklausīt? Tātad jums nav palielinātos mani izņemot zaudējumus.

trans-unit.source: And O my people, this is the she-camel of Allah - [she is] to you a sign. So let her feed upon Allah 's earth and do not touch her with harm, or you will be taken by an impending punishment."
trans-unit.target: Un O mana tauta, tas ir viņa kamielis Allāha - [viņa] jums zīmi. Tātad ļaujiet viņai barības Allāhs zemes virsū un nevar pieskarties ar kaitējumu, vai jums būs jāveic ar gaidāmo sodīšanu."

trans-unit.source: But they hamstrung her, so he said, "Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied."
trans-unit.target: Bet viņi iecirta viņu, viņš teica, "baudīt paši savās mājās uz trim dienām. Tas ir solījums apturamas."

trans-unit.source: So when Our command came, We saved Salih and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us, and [saved them] from the disgrace of that day. Indeed, it is your Lord who is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.
trans-unit.target: Lai ienākot mūsu komandas, mēs ietaupīto Salih, un tiem, kas ticēja viņam līdzi, ar žēlastību no mums, un [taupīja] todien kauns. Patiešām, tas ir, savu kungu, kurš ir spēcīgs, izredzētais, iespējams.

trans-unit.source: And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
trans-unit.target: Kliedziens saķēra tos, kas bija kaitējums un tie kļuva laikā savās mājās [līķu] samazinājies tieksme

trans-unit.source: As if they had never prospered therein. Unquestionably, Thamud denied their Lord; then, away with Thamud.
trans-unit.target: Kā tad, ja tie nekad nebija izdevušies tajā. Neapšaubāmi, Thamud noliedza savu kungu; tad tālāk ar Thamud.

trans-unit.source: And certainly did Our messengers come to Abraham with good tidings; they said, "Peace." He said, "Peace," and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.
trans-unit.target: Un noteikti mūsu kurjeri komplektācijā Abraham labas vēstis; viņi teica: "Miers". Viņš teica: "Miers", un nebija kavēt celt [tiem] grauzdēti teļš.

trans-unit.source: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he distrusted them and felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not. We have been sent to the people of Lot."
trans-unit.target: Bet, ieraudzījis viņu rokās, kas nesasniedz to, viņš neuzticas viņiem un jutos no tām bažām. Viņi teica: "bailes nav. Mums ir nosūtīts ar daudz cilvēkiem."

trans-unit.source: And his Wife was standing, and she smiled. Then We gave her good tidings of Isaac and after Isaac, Jacob.
trans-unit.target: Un viņa sieva stāvēja, un viņa pasmaidīja. Tad mums deva viņas labas vēstis un Isaac Isaac Jacob.

trans-unit.source: She said, "Woe to me! Shall I give birth while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!"
trans-unit.target: Viņa teica: "bēdas man! Sniedz man dzemdēt bērnu, kamēr es esmu veca sieviete un tas, mans vīrs ir vecs cilvēks? Patiešām, tas ir pārsteidzoša lieta!"

trans-unit.source: They said, "Are you amazed at the decree of Allah? May the mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "ir jūs amazed Allah dekrēts? Allah un viņa svētības žēlastību var pār jums, tautas namā. Protams, viņš ir Praiseworthy un goda".

trans-unit.source: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.
trans-unit.target: Un bailes bija atstājis Abraham un labas vēstis sasniedza viņu, viņš sāka strīdēties ar mums par daudz cilvēku.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, Abraham bija pieļaujam, sēru un [bieži] atgriežas [Allah].

trans-unit.source: [The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, there will reach them a punishment that cannot be repelled."
trans-unit.target: [Eņģeļi teica:] "O Abraham, atteikties no šī [pamata]. Tik tiešām, savu kungu komanda ir pienācis, un patiešām, tur sasniegs to sodam, kas nevar derdzās."

trans-unit.source: And when Our messengers, [the angels], came to Lot, he was anguished for them and felt for them great discomfort and said, "This is a trying day."
trans-unit.target: Un kad mūsu kurjeri [angels], bija daudz, viņš bija anguished viņiem un jutos viņiem liels diskomforts un teica: "Tas ir mēģina dienu."

trans-unit.source: And his people came hastening to him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear Allah and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not among you a man of reason?"
trans-unit.target: Viņa ļaudis nāca steidzās pie viņa un pirms [šo] viņi bija dara ļauno darbiem. Viņš teica: "O mana tauta, tās ir manas meitas; tie visšķīstāko jums. Tāpēc bailes Allah un nav kauns, man par manu viesi. Ir tur, nevis starp jums iemesls cilvēks? "

trans-unit.source: They said, "You have already known that we have not concerning your daughters any claim, and indeed, you know what we want."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "Jums jau zināms, ka mums nebūšot ne attiecībā uz jūsu meitu, un patiešām, jūs zināt, ko mēs gribam."

trans-unit.source: He said, "If only I had against you some power or could take refuge in a strong support."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "ja vien"man pret jums ir kāda vara vai varētu veikt spēcīgu atbalstu patvērumu.

trans-unit.source: The angels said, "O Lot, indeed we are messengers of your Lord; [therefore], they will never reach you. So set out with your family during a portion of the night and let not any among you look back - except your wife; indeed, she will be struck by that which strikes them. Indeed, their appointment is [for] the morning. Is not the morning near?"
trans-unit.target: Eņģeļi teica: "O daudz patiešām mēs esam kurjeriem kunga; [līdz] viņi nekad sasniegt jums. Tātad noteikti ar savu ģimeni laikā daļa no nakts un ļaujiet, nevis kāds no jums skatīties atpakaļ - izņemot sieva; patiešām, viņa būs pārsteigts, to, kas viņiem streiki. Patiesi, viņu iecelšanu ir [par] rīta. Nav rītā netālu no?"

trans-unit.source: So when Our command came, We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of layered hard clay, [which were]
trans-unit.target: Lai ienākot mūsu komandas, mēs veicām lielāko daļu [pilsētā] zemāko un rained uz tiem slāņveida ciets Māls, akmeņi, [kas ir]

trans-unit.source: Marked from your Lord. And Allah 's punishment is not from the wrongdoers [very] far.
trans-unit.target: Atzīmēts no savu kungu. Un Allāhs sods nav no pārkāpējus [] tālu.

trans-unit.source: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. And do not decrease from the measure and the scale. Indeed, I see you in prosperity, but indeed, I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing Day.
trans-unit.target: Madyan [mēs nosūtījām] un viņu brālis Shu'ayb. Viņš teica: "O mana tauta, dievkalpojumu Allah; tev nav nekā viņu dievība. Un nevar samazināt no pasākuma un mērogu. Patiešām, es redzu, ka jūs labklājības pieaugumu, bet patiešām, es baidos jums visapņemoša dienas sods.

trans-unit.source: And O my people, give full measure and weight in justice and do not deprive the people of their due and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.
trans-unit.target: Un O mana tauta, dot pilnu pasākuma un svara tieslietu un nedrīkst atņemt to pienācīgu tautai nav izdarījis ļaunprātīgu izmantošanu uz zemes, korupcijas izplatīšanos.

trans-unit.source: What remains [lawful] from Allah is best for you, if you would be believers. But I am not a guardian over you."
trans-unit.target: Kas vēl [likumīga] no Allah ir labākais, lai jūs, ja jūs būtu ticīgie. Bet es neesmu sargs pār jums."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Shu'ayb, does your prayer command you that we should leave what our fathers worship or not do with our wealth what we please? Indeed, you are the forbearing, the discerning!"
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "O Shu'ayb jūsu lūgšana komandu jums, ka mēs atstājam mūsu tēvi dievkalpojumu vai nevar darīt ar mūsu bagātība, to, kas mums patīk? Protams, tu esi pieļaujam, zinošāki!"

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I am upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has provided me with a good provision from Him...? And I do not intend to differ from you in that which I have forbidden you; I only intend reform as much as I am able. And my success is not but through Allah. Upon him I have relied, and to Him I return.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "O mana tauta, ka jūs uzskatīja: ja es esmu pēc skaidri pierādījumi no manam kungam, un viņš ir nodrošinājusi man labs noteikums no viņa...? Un es negrasos jums atšķiras ar to, kas man ir aizliegta Es plānoju tikai reformu, tik daudz, cik es varu. Un mana veiksme nav, bet caur Allah. Pēc tam man ir balstījusies un viņam es atgriežos.

trans-unit.source: And O my people, let not [your] dissension from me cause you to be struck by that similar to what struck the people of Noah or the people of Hud or the people of Salih. And the people of Lot are not from you far away.
trans-unit.target: Un O mana tauta, ļaujiet nav [savu] domstarpības no manis dēļ jūs pārsteidza kas līdzīgs kas pārsteidza Noa cilvēki vai Hud cilvēki vai cilvēki Salih. Un daudzi cilvēki nav no jums tālu prom.

trans-unit.source: And ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is Merciful and Affectionate."
trans-unit.target: Un lūgt piedošanu par savu kungu un tad nožēlot viņu. Protams, mans kungs ir žēlsirdīgs un Affectionate."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Shu'ayb, we do not understand much of what you say, and indeed, we consider you among us as weak. And if not for your family, we would have stoned you [to death]; and you are not to us one respected."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "O Shu'ayb, mēs nesaprotam, ka liela daļa to, ko jūs sakāt, un patiešām, mēs uzskatām, jūs mūsu vidū kā vāja. Un ja ne par savu ģimeni, mēs varētu būt stoned tu [līdz nāvei]; un mums viens ievērošanu."

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my people, is my family more respected for power by you than Allah? But you put Him behind your backs [in neglect]. Indeed, my Lord is encompassing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "O mana tauta ir mana ģimene, kas vairāk ievēro varas jums nekā Allah? Bet jūs nodot viņam aiz jūsu muguras [šajā nolaidība]. Patiešām, ir aptver manam kungam par to, ko jūs darāt.

trans-unit.source: And O my people, work according to your position; indeed, I am working. You are going to know to whom will come a punishment that will disgrace him and who is a liar. So watch; indeed, I am with you a watcher, [awaiting the outcome]."
trans-unit.target: Un mana tauta, O darbu saskaņā ar savu pozīciju; patiešām, es esmu strādā. Jūs zināt, kam nāks sods, kas būs kauns viņu un kas ir melis. Lai noskatītos; patiešām, es esmu ar jums vērotājs, [gaida rezultātus]."

trans-unit.source: And when Our command came, We saved Shu'ayb and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us. And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
trans-unit.target: Un ienākot mūsu komandas, mēs izglābām Shu'ayb un tiem, kas ticēja viņam līdzi, ar žēlastību no mums. Kliedziens saķēra tos, kas bija kaitējums un tie kļuva laikā savās mājās [līķu] samazinājies tieksme

trans-unit.source: As if they had never prospered therein. Then, away with Madyan as Thamud was taken away.
trans-unit.target: Kā tad, ja tie nekad nebija izdevušies tajā. Pēc tam prom ar Madyan, kā Thamud tika aizvesti.

trans-unit.source: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti nosūtīt Moses ar mūsu zīmes un skaidras pilnvaras

trans-unit.source: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not [at all] discerning.
trans-unit.target: Faraons, un savā uzņēmumā, bet viņi sekoja komandu no faraons, un faraons komanda nebija [vispār] zinošāki.

trans-unit.source: He will precede his people on the Day of Resurrection and lead them into the Fire; and wretched is the place to which they are led.
trans-unit.target: Viņš pirms savai tautai par augšāmcelšanās dienu un liek tiem uguni; un nabaga ir vieta, kurā viņi veda.

trans-unit.source: And they were followed in this [world] with a curse and on the Day of Resurrection. And wretched is the gift which is given.
trans-unit.target: Un viņi sekoja šo [Pasaule] ar lāstu un augšāmcelšanās dienu. Un nožēlojams ir dāvana, kas dota.

trans-unit.source: That is from the news of the cities, which We relate to you; of them, some are [still] standing and some are [as] a harvest [mowed down].
trans-unit.target: Tas ir no ziņas par pilsētām, kuras mums saistās ar tevi; no tiem, dažas stāv [vēl] un daži ir [kā] ražu [pļaujai uz leju].

trans-unit.source: And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. And they were not availed at all by their gods which they invoked other than Allah when there came the command of your Lord. And they did not increase them in other than ruin.
trans-unit.target: Un mums bija nepareizi viņiem, bet viņi paši kaitējums. Un tie bija nav izmantojusi vispār ar saviem dieviem, kas tos izmantot citiem mērķiem kā vien Allāhs ienākot komandu savu kungu. Un viņi tos nepalielinājās nav pazudināt.

trans-unit.source: And thus is the seizure of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe.
trans-unit.target: Un tādējādi ir aresta savu kungu, kad viņš sažņaudzas pilsētās, kamēr viņi ir izdarījuši nepareizi. Protams, viņa arestu ir smaga un sāpīga.

trans-unit.source: Indeed in that is a sign for those who fear the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which the people will be collected, and that is a Day [which will be] witnessed.
trans-unit.target: Protams, ka ir zīme tiem, kuri baidās, ka turpmāk sodīt. Tas ir dienā, kas cilvēkiem tiks vākti, un tas ir dienā, [kas ir] liecinieks.

trans-unit.source: And We do not delay it except for a limited term.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs nedrīkst aizkavēt izņemot ierobežotā termiņā.

trans-unit.source: The Day it comes no soul will speak except by His permission. And among them will be the wretched and the prosperous.
trans-unit.target: Runa nav dvēsele dienā runās, izņemot ar viņa atļauju. Un starp viņiem būs nožēlojams un pārtikušu.

trans-unit.source: As for those who were [destined to be] wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kuri bija [paredzēts būt] nožēlojams, tie būs uguns. Viņiem tur ir [vardarbīgu] izelpoja un ieelpo.

trans-unit.source: [They will be] abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends.
trans-unit.target: [Tie ir] ievērojot tajā, kā debesis un zeme paciest, izņemot savu kungu vajadzētu būs. Patiešām, jūsu kungs ir effecter par to, ko viņš plāno.

trans-unit.source: And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted.
trans-unit.target: Un runājot par tiem, kuri bija [lemts būt] pārtikušu, tie būs paradīze, ievērojot tur tik ilgi, cik debesis un zeme paciest, izņemot to, kas jūsu kungs būtu būs - dāvana bez pārtraukuma.

trans-unit.source: So do not be in doubt, [O Muhammad], as to what these [polytheists] are worshipping. They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before. And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished.
trans-unit.target: Tātad nevar būt šaubu gadījumā [O Muhammad], par to, kādi šie [polytheists] pielūdzot. Viņi pielūdz nav, izņemot, kā pirms pielūdza viņu tēvi. Un patiešām, mums dos viņiem savu daļu zudusi.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti bija devis Moses svētie raksti, bet tas nokļuva domstarpības. Un ja ne par vārdu, kas sākas no savu kungu, tas būtu ir bijis vērtēt starp tām. Un tiešām viņi ir par Qur ', satraucošām šaubas.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, each [of the believers and disbelievers] - your Lord will fully compensate them for their deeds. Indeed, He is Acquainted with what they do.
trans-unit.target: Un patiešām, katrs [no ticīgajiem un disbelievers] - jūsu kungs pilnībā kompensēs tos par viņu darbiem. Protams, viņš ir iepazinies ar to, ko viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, [you] and those who have turned back with you [to Allah], and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.
trans-unit.target: Tātad paliek uz īstajām pēdām, kā jums ir pavēlējis, [tu] un tie, kas ir pagriezts atpakaļ ar jums [Allah] un nedrīkst pārkāpt. Patiešām, viņš redz, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire, and you would not have other than Allah any protectors; then you would not be helped.
trans-unit.target: Un nav slīpums pret tiem, kuri nepareizi, nedrīkstam būt pieskārās pie ugunskura un jums nebūtu citiem mērķiem kā vien Allāhs jebkuru aizsargi; tad jūs varētu līdzēt.

trans-unit.source: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember.
trans-unit.target: Un izveidot lūgšanu pie diviem galiem dienas un nakts pieeja. Patiešām, labus darbus darīt prom ar ļaundarībām. Tas ir atgādinājums tiem, kuri atceras.

trans-unit.source: And be patient, for indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.
trans-unit.target: Un esiet pacietīgi, jo patiešām, Allah neļauj zaudēt atlīdzību par tiem, kuri to dara labi.

trans-unit.source: So why were there not among the generations before you those of enduring discrimination forbidding corruption on earth - except a few of those We saved from among them? But those who wronged pursued what luxury they were given therein, and they were criminals.
trans-unit.target: Tad kāpēc bija tur nav starp paaudzēm pirms tiem ilgstošu diskrimināciju aizliedz korupciju uz zemes - izņemot dažas no tām mēs izglābām kādu no viņiem? Bet tiem, kam nodarīts kaitējums veikusi kāda greznība, tajā tika iedots, un tie bija noziedznieki.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord would not have destroyed the cities unjustly while their people were reformers.
trans-unit.target: Un jūsu kungs būtu nav iznīcinājuši pilsētām netaisnīgi, kamēr viņu ļaudis reformatoru.

trans-unit.source: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.
trans-unit.target: Un ja gribas savu kungu, viņš varētu kļūt cilvēcei vienu Kopienā; bet viņi nevar vairs nav atšķiras.

trans-unit.source: Except whom your Lord has given mercy, and for that He created them. But the word of your Lord is to be fulfilled that, "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and men all together."
trans-unit.target: Izņemot kam jūsu kungs ir devis žēlastību, un ka viņš tos radījusi. Bet jūsu Kunga vārds ir izpildīts, ka "Es noteikti aizpildīs ellē ar džins un visi kopā vīrieši."

trans-unit.source: And each [story] We relate to you from the news of the messengers is that by which We make firm your heart. And there has come to you, in this, the truth and an instruction and a reminder for the believers.
trans-unit.target: Un katra [stāsts] mēs attiecas uz jums no ziņas par kurjeriem ir ka, kādā mēs firma savā sirdī. Un tur ir pienācis jums, tas, patiesību un instrukciju un atgādinājums par ticīgo.

trans-unit.source: And say to those who do not believe, "Work according to your position; indeed, we are working.
trans-unit.target: Un pateikt tiem, kuri netic, "strādā saskaņā ar savu pozīciju; Protams, mēs strādājam.

trans-unit.source: And wait, indeed, we are waiting."
trans-unit.target: Un gaidīt, protams, mēs gaidām.

trans-unit.source: And to Allah belong the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth and to Him will be returned the matter, all of it, so worship Him and rely upon Him. And your Lord is not unaware of that which you do.
trans-unit.target: Un Allah pieder neredzēts [aspektiem] heavens un zemes un viņam būs atpakaļ šo jautājumu, visu to, tik pielūgt viņu un paļauties uz viņu. Un nav informēti par to, ko jūs darīt savu kungu.

trans-unit.source: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the clear Book.
trans-unit.target: Alif, Lam, Ra. Tie ir panti skaidri grāmatu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, mēs esam nosūtījuši to kā arābu Korāns, kas jūs varētu saprast.

trans-unit.source: We relate to you, [O Muhammad], the best of stories in what We have revealed to you of this Qur'an although you were, before it, among the unaware.
trans-unit.target: Mēs attiecas uz jums, [O Muhammad] labāko no stāstiem, ko mums parādīja jums šo Qur, lai gan jums bija pirms tam, starp neapzinās.

trans-unit.source: [Of these stories mention] when Joseph said to his father, "O my father, indeed I have seen [in a dream] eleven stars and the sun and the moon; I saw them prostrating to me."
trans-unit.target: [Šo stāstu pieminēt] kad Joseph teica viņa tēvs, "O mans tēvs patiešām esmu redzējis [sapnī] vienpadsmit zvaigznes, saules un mēness; Es redzēju viņus vājināja man. "

trans-unit.source: He said, "O my son, do not relate your vision to your brothers or they will contrive against you a plan. Indeed Satan, to man, is a manifest enemy.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "O mans dēls nav saistīti savu redzējumu savus brāļus, vai viņi pamanīties pret jums plānu. Patiešām sātans, lai cilvēks, ir acīmredzama ienaidnieks.

trans-unit.source: And thus will your Lord choose you and teach you the interpretation of narratives and complete His favor upon you and upon the family of Jacob, as He completed it upon your fathers before, Abraham and Isaac. Indeed, your Lord is Knowing and Wise."
trans-unit.target: Un tādējādi būs savu kungu izvēlēties jums un iemācīt jums stāstos interpretāciju un pabeigtu viņa favor pār jums un ģimenes Jacob, kā viņš pabeidza pēc jūsu tēviem pirms Ābrahāms un Isaac. Patiešām, jūsu kungs ir zinot un gudrs."

trans-unit.source: Certainly were there in Joseph and his brothers signs for those who ask,
trans-unit.target: Protams, tur bija Jāzeps un viņa brāļi zīmes tiem, kas lūgt,

trans-unit.source: When they said, "Joseph and his brother are more beloved to our father than we, while we are a clan. Indeed, our father is in clear error.
trans-unit.target: Kad viņi teica, "Jāzeps un viņa brālis ir mīļots mūsu tēvs nekā mums, kamēr mēs klana. Patiešām, mūsu tēvs ir skaidra kļūda.

trans-unit.source: Kill Joseph or cast him out to [another] land; the countenance of your father will [then] be only for you, and you will be after that a righteous people."
trans-unit.target: Joseph nogalināt vai viņu izdzīt uz [vēl] zemes; tavs tēvs ārienē [tad] būs tikai jums, un jums būs pēc tam paštaisns cilvēkiem."

trans-unit.source: Said a speaker among them, "Do not kill Joseph but throw him into the bottom of the well; some travelers will pick him up - if you would do [something]."
trans-unit.target: Teica runātājs, starp tiem "neaiztikt Joseph bet mest viņam vērā apakšā akas; daži ceļotāji uzņemt viņu - ja jūs to darītu [kaut]."

trans-unit.source: They said, "O our father, why do you not entrust us with Joseph while indeed, we are to him sincere counselors?
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "O mūsu tēvs, kāpēc jūs nevar uzticēt mums Joseph, bet patiešām, mēs viņam patiesi padomniekiem?

trans-unit.source: Send him with us tomorrow that he may eat well and play. And indeed, we will be his guardians.
trans-unit.target: Atsūtīt mums rīt viņš var ēst labi un spēlēt. Un patiešām, mums būs viņa sargi.

trans-unit.source: [Jacob] said, "Indeed, it saddens me that you should take him, and I fear that a wolf would eat him while you are of him unaware."
trans-unit.target: [Jacob] teica: tik tiešām, tas saddens mani, ka jums vajadzētu ņemt viņu, un baidās, ka vilks apēdīs viņu, kamēr jūs esat par viņu nezināja.

trans-unit.source: They said, "If a wolf should eat him while we are a [strong] clan, indeed, we would then be losers."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "Ja vilks būtu viņu ēst, kamēr mēs tiešām [spēcīgu] klana, tad būsim zaudētāji."

trans-unit.source: So when they took him [out] and agreed to put him into the bottom of the well... But We inspired to him, "You will surely inform them [someday] about this affair of theirs while they do not perceive [your identity]."
trans-unit.target: Tad, kad viņi ņēma viņu [kas] un likt viņam šahtas dibena piekrita... Bet mēs iedvesmoja viņu, "Jums noteikti informēs tos [kādreiz] par šo lietu no savējās, kamēr viņi neuztver [savu identitāti]."

trans-unit.source: And they came to their father at night, weeping.
trans-unit.target: Un naktī, viņi nonāca viņu tēvs raudādams.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O our father, indeed we went racing each other and left Joseph with our possessions, and a wolf ate him. But you would not believe us, even if we were truthful."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: O mūsu tēvs patiešām mēs devāmies sacīkšu viens otru un Joseph palicis mūsu īpašumiem, un vilks apēda viņu. Bet jūs neticētu mums, pat ja mēs būtu patiesas.

trans-unit.source: And they brought upon his shirt false blood. [Jacob] said, "Rather, your souls have enticed you to something, so patience is most fitting. And Allah is the one sought for help against that which you describe."
trans-unit.target: Un viņi sanesuši viņa krekls viltus asinis. [Jacob] teica: "drīzāk savas dvēseles ir enticed jums kaut ko, tāpēc pacietību ir visvairāk aprīkošana. Un Allah ir viens lūdza palīdzību pret to, ko jūs raksturotu.

trans-unit.source: And there came a company of travelers; then they sent their water drawer, and he let down his bucket. He said, "Good news! Here is a boy." And they concealed him, [taking him] as merchandise; and Allah was knowing of what they did.
trans-unit.target: Un atnāca kompānija ceļotājiem; tad viņi atsūtīja savas ūdens atvilktni un viņš pievīlis savu kausu. Viņš teica: "labā ziņa! Šeit ir puisis." Un viņi slēpa viņu [ņemot viņu] kā preces; un Allah bija apziņa par to, ko viņi darīja.

trans-unit.source: And they sold him for a reduced price - a few dirhams - and they were, concerning him, of those content with little.
trans-unit.target: Un tie viņu pārdod par pazeminātu cenu - pāris dirhams - un tie bija saistībā ar viņu šo saturu ar maz.

trans-unit.source: And the one from Egypt who bought him said to his wife, "Make his residence comfortable. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a son." And thus, We established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah is predominant over His affair, but most of the people do not know.
trans-unit.target: Un viens no Ēģiptes, kas viņam pateica viņa sievai nopircis "padarīt savu dzīvesvietu ērti. Varbūt viņš iegūs mums, vai mēs viņu pieņems kā dēlu." Un tādējādi mēs izveidojām Joseph zemes, ka mēs viņu varētu pamācīt notikumu interpretāciju. Un Allah ir pārsvarā pār viņa darīšana, bet lielākā daļa cilvēku nezina.

trans-unit.source: And when Joseph reached maturity, We gave him judgment and knowledge. And thus We reward the doers of good.
trans-unit.target: Un Jāzeps, sasniedzot briedumu, mēs iedevām viņam saprātu un zināšanas. Un tādējādi mēs atalgot labi darītāji.

trans-unit.source: And she, in whose house he was, sought to seduce him. She closed the doors and said, "Come, you." He said, "[I seek] the refuge of Allah. Indeed, he is my master, who has made good my residence. Indeed, wrongdoers will not succeed."
trans-unit.target: Un viņa, kura mājā bija apjautājies pavest viņu. Viņa aizvēra durvis un teica: "Nāciet, jūs." Viņš teica: "[I meklēt] Allah patvērumu. Protams, viņš ir saimnieks, kurš veicis labs mana dzīvesvieta. Patiešām, pārkāpējus neizdosies."

trans-unit.source: And she certainly determined [to seduce] him, and he would have inclined to her had he not seen the proof of his Lord. And thus [it was] that We should avert from him evil and immorality. Indeed, he was of Our chosen servants.
trans-unit.target: Un viņa noteikti apņēmies [pavest], un viņš būtu ir noskaņoti viņu nav redzējis pierādījums viņa kungs. Un tādējādi [bija], ka mums vajadzētu novērst no viņa ļauno un amorālums. Protams, viņš bija mūsu izvēlēto darbinieku.

trans-unit.source: And they both raced to the door, and she tore his shirt from the back, and they found her husband at the door. She said, "What is the recompense of one who intended evil for your wife but that he be imprisoned or a painful punishment?"
trans-unit.target: Un viņi abi metās uz durvīm, un viņa izrāva kreklu no muguras un viņi atrada vīru pie durvīm. Viņa teica, "kas ir kompensēt, kurš paredzēts ļaunumu savai sievai, bet, ka viņš ir ieslodzīts vai sāpīga sods?"

trans-unit.source: [Joseph] said, "It was she who sought to seduce me." And a witness from her family testified. "If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth, and he is of the liars.
trans-unit.target: [Joseph] teica: "Tā bija viņa, kas mēģināja kārdināt mani." Un no savas ģimenes, liecināja liecinieks. "Ja viņa krekls saplēsts no priekšas, tad viņa ir teicis patiesību, un viņš ir liars.

trans-unit.source: But if his shirt is torn from the back, then she has lied, and he is of the truthful."
trans-unit.target: Bet, ja viņa krekls saplēsts no muguras, tad viņa ir melojis, un viņš ir patiess."

trans-unit.source: So when her husband saw his shirt torn from the back, he said, "Indeed, it is of the women's plan. Indeed, your plan is great.
trans-unit.target: Tad, kad viņas vīrs ieraudzīja viņa krekls saplēsts no muguras, viņš teica: "Protams, tas ir sieviešu plāna. Patiešām, jūsu plāns ir liels.

trans-unit.source: Joseph, ignore this. And, [my wife], ask forgiveness for your sin. Indeed, you were of the sinful."
trans-unit.target: Joseph, neņemu. Un [sievu], lūgt piedošanu par savu grēku. Patiešām, jums bija no grēcīgs."

trans-unit.source: And women in the city said, "The wife of al-'Azeez is seeking to seduce her slave boy; he has impassioned her with love. Indeed, we see her [to be] in clear error."
trans-unit.target: Un sieviešu pilsētā, teica: "sieva al-'Azeez mēģina pavest savu vergu zēns; viņš ir jūs moka kaislības viņai ar mīlestību. Protams, mēs redzam viņas [ir] skaidri kļūda."

trans-unit.source: So when she heard of their scheming, she sent for them and prepared for them a banquet and gave each one of them a knife and said [to Joseph], "Come out before them." And when they saw him, they greatly admired him and cut their hands and said, "Perfect is Allah! This is not a man; this is none but a noble angel."
trans-unit.target: Tad, kad viņa dzirdējis to scheming, viņa nosūtīja tiem un sagatavotas tos banketu un katrs no viņiem deva nazi un uzrunāja [Joseph] "Nāk viņiem priekšā." Un ieraudzījuši viņu, tie lielā mērā viņu dievināja un Izgriezt rokas un teica: "Perfect Allah! Tas nav cilvēks, tas nav, bet cēla eņģelis."

trans-unit.source: She said, "That is the one about whom you blamed me. And I certainly sought to seduce him, but he firmly refused; and if he will not do what I order him, he will surely be imprisoned and will be of those debased."
trans-unit.target: Viņa teica: "tas ir viens, par kuru jūs vainojat mani par to. Un noteikti centās pavest viņu, bet viņš stingri noraidīja; un ja viņš darīs, ko es varu pasūtīt viņu, viņš noteikti atrodas ieslodzījumā un būs no šīm bāzēm.

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me. And if You do not avert from me their plan, I might incline toward them and [thus] be of the ignorant."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "mans kungs, cietuma manam patika vairāk nekā, uz ko tie uzaicināt mani. Un ja jūs nevar novērst no manis viņu plāns, iespējams slīpums viņiem pretī un [tā] ir nezinošs."

trans-unit.source: So his Lord responded to him and averted from him their plan. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Tātad viņa kungs atbildēja uz viņu un novērstas no viņa savu rīcības plānu. Protams, viņš ir dzirdes, zinot.

trans-unit.source: Then it appeared to them after they had seen the signs that al-'Azeez should surely imprison him for a time.
trans-unit.target: Tad parādījās viņiem pēc tam, kad viņi bija redzējuši pazīmes, ka al-'Azeez būtu noteikti ieslodzīt viņu laiku.

trans-unit.source: And there entered the prison with him two young men. One of them said, "Indeed, I have seen myself [in a dream] pressing wine." The other said, "Indeed, I have seen myself carrying upon my head [some] bread, from which the birds were eating. Inform us of its interpretation; indeed, we see you to be of those who do good."
trans-unit.target: Un ievadītas ar viņu cietumā, divi jauni vīrieši. Viens no tiem teica: "Protams, es esmu redzējis sevi [sapnī] nospiežot vīna." Svešais sacīja: "Protams, es esmu redzējis sevi pārvadā uz manu galvu, [kādu] maizi, no_kurienes putni ēda. Informējiet par savu interpretāciju; patiešām, mēs redzam iespēju būt par tiem, kuri to dara labi."

trans-unit.source: He said, "You will not receive food that is provided to you except that I will inform you of its interpretation before it comes to you. That is from what my Lord has taught me. Indeed, I have left the religion of a people who do not believe in Allah, and they, in the Hereafter, are disbelievers.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "jūs nesaņemsiet pārtiku, kas tiek piegādāta klientam, izņemot to, ka es jūs informēs par tās interpretāciju pirms runa ir par jums. Tas ir, no to, kas man ir iemācījusi manam kungam. Patiešām, ir atstājuši cilvēki, kas netic Allah reliģija, un tie, kas turpmāk, ir disbelievers.

trans-unit.source: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. And it was not for us to associate anything with Allah. That is from the favor of Allah upon us and upon the people, but most of the people are not grateful.
trans-unit.target: Un ir jāievēro manu tēvu, Abraham Isaac un Džeikobs reliģiju. Un ne jau mums kaut ko saistīt ar Allah. Tas ir no Allah favor pār mums un cilvēkiem, bet lielākā daļa cilvēku nav pateicīgs.

trans-unit.source: O [my] two companions of prison, are separate lords better or Allah, the One, the Prevailing?
trans-unit.target: O [] divi kolēģi no cietuma, ir labāk atsevišķi kungiem vai Allah, viens Prevailing?

trans-unit.source: You worship not besides Him except [mere] names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which Allah has sent down no authority. Legislation is not but for Allah. He has commanded that you worship not except Him. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.
trans-unit.target: Jūs pielūdz ne bez viņa, izņemot [tikai] nosaukumi ir nosauktas tās, jūs un jūsu tēviem, kuriem Allah ir nosūtījusi uz leju ne ar vienu iestādi. Tiesību nav, bet par Allah. Viņš ir komandējis, ka tu pielūdz ne, izņemot viņu. Kas ir pareizā reliģija, bet lielākā daļa cilvēku nezina.

trans-unit.source: O two companions of prison, as for one of you, he will give drink to his master of wine; but as for the other, he will be crucified, and the birds will eat from his head. The matter has been decreed about which you both inquire."
trans-unit.target: O abiem kompanjoniem, cietums, tāpat kā viens no jums, viņš dos dzert savu kungu no vīna; bet attiecībā uz otras puses, viņš būs krustā, un putni būs ēst no savas galvas. Jautājums ir bijis pasludinot par kas jums abiem ievākt ziņas."

trans-unit.source: And he said to the one whom he knew would go free, "Mention me before your master." But Satan made him forget the mention [to] his master, and Joseph remained in prison several years.
trans-unit.target: Un viņš teica, viens, kuru viņš pazina iet bez maksas, "Min man pirms jūsu pamata." Bet sātans lika viņam aizmirst pieminēt [līdz] saimnieku un Joseph palika cietumā vairākus gadus.

trans-unit.source: And [subsequently] the king said, "Indeed, I have seen [in a dream] seven fat cows being eaten by seven [that were] lean, and seven green spikes [of grain] and others [that were] dry. O eminent ones, explain to me my vision, if you should interpret visions."
trans-unit.target: Un [vēlāk] karalis teica: "patiešām, es esmu redzējis [sapnī] septiņi tauku govis, ka mani apēdīs septiņi, [kas ir] liesa, un septiņi zaļā tapas [no graudu] un citiem [bija] sausa. O autoritātes tiem, paskaidrojiet man, mana vīzija, ja vajadzētu interpretēt vīzijas."

trans-unit.source: They said, "[It is but] a mixture of false dreams, and we are not learned in the interpretation of dreams."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "[tas ir, bet] a maisījuma viltus sapņi, un mums nav iemācījušies interpretācijā, sapņi."

trans-unit.source: But the one who was freed and remembered after a time said, "I will inform you of its interpretation, so send me forth."
trans-unit.target: Bet tas, kurš bija atbrīvots un atceras pēc brītiņa jau teica, "es jūs informēs par tās interpretāciju, Tātad sūtīt man tālāk."

trans-unit.source: [He said], "Joseph, O man of truth, explain to us about seven fat cows eaten by seven [that were] lean, and seven green spikes [of grain] and others [that were] dry - that I may return to the people; perhaps they will know [about you]."
trans-unit.target: [Teica], "Joseph O cilvēks patiesību, izskaidrot mums par septiņiem tauku govis, ēst ar septiņiem, [kas ir] liesa, un septiņi zaļā tapas [no graudu] un citiem [bija] sausas - ka var atgriezties cilvēkiem; Varbūt viņi zinās [par tevi]."
