trans-unit.target: Viņi neuzskatu, ka Allāhs, kurš radīja debesis un zemi, [tā] var radīt viņiem patīk? Un viņš ir noteicis tās termiņā, par kuru nav šaubu. Bet izdarītājs atsakās [kaut] izņemot neticība.

trans-unit.source: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.
trans-unit.target: Saki [tiem], "Ja tev pieder mana Kunga žēlastību arhīvus, tad varētu ieturēt no bailēm no izdevumu." Un kādreiz ir cilvēks bijis skops.

trans-unit.source: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti bija devis Moses deviņas acīmredzamas pazīmes, tātad uzdot Izraēla bērniem [par], kad viņš nāca pie viņiem un faraons sacīja viņam: "patiešām, es domāju, ka, O Moses, ka tiek ietekmētas ar burvestībām.

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: "Jums ir jau zināms, ka neviens ir nosūtījusi pa šiem [pazīmes] izņemot kungs no heavens un zemes kā pierādījumu, un patiešām es domāju, O faraons, ka tiek iznīcināti."

trans-unit.source: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.
trans-unit.target: Tātad viņš paredzēts vadīt tos no zemes, bet mēs noslīka viņu, un ar viņu kopā.

trans-unit.source: And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."
trans-unit.target: Un mums teica pēc tam, kad faraons Izraēla bērniem, "mājot zemi, un kad pienāk solījumu turpmāk, mēs dos jums [viena] izklāstīti vākšana.

trans-unit.source: And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
trans-unit.target: Ar patiesību mēs esam nosūtījuši Korāns un ar patiesību, tas ir izcēlies. Un mums vēl nav nosūtīts jums [O Muhammad], izņemot kā bringer labas vēstis un warner.

trans-unit.source: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.
trans-unit.target: Un [ir] Korāns, kas mums ir atdalīti [ar intervāliem], kuru iespējams pārstāstīt to cilvēkiem ilgstošā laika posmā. Un mēs esam nosūtījuši uz leju pakāpeniski.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,
trans-unit.target: Teiksim, "ticēt vai neticēt. Protams, tiem, kas tika dotas zināšanas pirms tā - ja tas skaitīja tiem, tie krist uz viņu sejas prostrācija,

trans-unit.source: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."
trans-unit.target: Un viņi saka: "cildens ir mūsu kungs! Patiešām, mūsu Kunga solījums ir izpildīts."

trans-unit.source: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.
trans-unit.target: Tie attiecas uz viņu sejām, raudādams un Korāns palielinās tās pazemīgs iesniegšanas.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.
trans-unit.target: Proti, "pēc Allah vai zvanu uz visvairāk žēlsirdīgs. Atkarībā no tā [nosaukums] jūs zvanīt - viņam pieder labākos vārdus. " Un nav deklamēt [arī] skaļi savu lūgšanu vai [arī] klusi, bet meklēt starp šo [starpposma] veidā.

trans-unit.source: And say, "Praise to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."
trans-unit.target: Un jāsaka: "Allah, kas nav veikusi dēls un ir bijusi bez partnera [viņa] valdīšana nav slavēt [nepieciešams] aizsargs no vājums; un viņu cildināt ar [liels] cildināšana."

trans-unit.source: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who has sent down upon His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.
trans-unit.target: [Visi] slavēt ir [izpildes] Allah, kas sūtīja pēc viņa kalps grāmatu un tajā jebkurā deviance nav veikusi.

trans-unit.source: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward
trans-unit.target: [Viņš ir darījis] taisni, lai brīdinātu par bargu sodu no viņa un dot labas vēstis ticīgie, kas darīt taisns darbus viņiem būs labi atalgotu

trans-unit.source: In which they will remain forever
trans-unit.target: Kur viņi paliks uz visiem laikiem

trans-unit.source: And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son."
trans-unit.target: Un brīdināt tos, kuri saka, "Allah ir veikusi dēls."

trans-unit.source: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.
trans-unit.target: Viņiem nav zināšanu par to, kā arī bija viņu tēvi. Kaps ir vārds, kas nāk no viņu mutēm; viņi runā, nevis izņemot meli.

trans-unit.source: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.
trans-unit.target: Tad varbūt tu nogalinātu sevi caur bēdām pār tām [O Muhammad], ja viņi netic šajā ziņojumā, [un] no bēdām.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, mēs esam panākuši to, kas ir uz zemes rota par to, kas mums var testēt tos [par to], kura no tām ir vislabāk darbos.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.
trans-unit.target: Un tik tiešām, mēs veiksim to, kas tai [ievada] neauglīgs zemē.

trans-unit.source: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?
trans-unit.target: Vai tu esi domājis, ka biedri no alas un uzraksts bija starp mūsu zīmes brīnums?

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."
trans-unit.target: [Min], kad jaunieši devās uz alu un teica: mūsu kungs, piešķirt mums žēlastību no sevis un sagatavotu mūs no mūsu lieta labo virzības.

trans-unit.source: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.
trans-unit.target: Tātad mēs cast [vāka miega] pār ausis atrodas alā jau vairākus gadus.

trans-unit.source: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs pamodās viņiem, ka mēs varētu parādīt, kas divas frakcijas bija visvairāk precīzi aprēķinot [cik] viņi uzturējās laikā.

trans-unit.source: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
trans-unit.target: Mēs, kas attiecas uz jums, [O Muhammad], viņu stāsts patiesībā ir. Patiešām, tie jaunieši, kuri ticēja savu kungu, un mēs tos palielināja vadlīnijās.

trans-unit.source: And We made firm their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs esam padarījuši firma savās sirdīs, kad viņi piecēlās un teica: "mūsu Kungs ir debesu un zemes kungs. Nekad mēs atsauksies ne tikai viņam jebkuru dievība. Mēs būtu noteikti runājis, tad pārmērīga pārkāpšana.

trans-unit.source: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie?"
trans-unit.target: Šie mūsu cilvēkiem ir veikušas bez viņu Dievības. Kāpēc tie neizraisa dievkalpojumiem [no] tos skaidri iestāde? Un kurš ir netaisna vairāk nekā tas, kurš izdomā par Allah meli?"

trans-unit.source: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allah, retreat to the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility."
trans-unit.target: [Jaunieši teica viens otru], "un kad ir atteikušies no viņiem un to, ko viņi pielūdz izņemot Allah, patvērums pie alas. Savu kungu tiks sadalīts jums viņa žēlsirdību un sagatavos jūs no jūsu lieta iekārtas."

trans-unit.source: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.
trans-unit.target: Un [jums bijis klāt], jūs varētu redzēt sauli, kad tā piecēlās, piešķiebdama prom no savas alas labajā pusē, un, kad tas noteikts, aizritējusī prom no viņiem pa kreisi, kamēr viņi bija [ko] ietvaros atklātā kosmosā. Tas bija no Allah pazīmes. Viņš, kam Allāhs ceļveži ir [pamatoti] vadīties, bet viņam, ko viņš atstāj apmaldīties - nekad jūs atradīsiet viņu aizsargā rokasgrāmata.

trans-unit.source: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.
trans-unit.target: Un tu domā, ka viņiem nomodā, kamēr viņi guļ. Un mēs pagriezās pa labi un pa kreisi, kamēr viņu suns izstiepj viņa priekškājām, pie ieejas. Ja jums skatījās uz viņiem, tu būtu novērsās no tiem lidojuma laikā un bijis tās šausmināja.

trans-unit.source: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.
trans-unit.target: Un tāpat mēs pamodās viņiem, ka viņi varētu jautājums viens otru. Teica runātājs no sava vidus tos, "cik ilgi jūs atradušies [šeit]?" Viņi teica: "Mums ir saglabājies, dienu vai dienas daļa." Viņi teica: "jūsu kungs, lielākā daļa zinot, cik ilgi jums palika. Tātad viens no jums ar šo sudraba monētas nosūta pilsētas un ļaut viņam skatīties uz to, kas ir pārtikas labākais un dot nodrošināšanu no tā un ļaut viņam jābūt piesardzīgiem. Un neviens jums jāapzinās.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, ja tie nāk no jums zināt, viņi akmens jums vai atgriezties viņu reliģijas. Un nekad nebūtu panākumus, tad - jebkad."

trans-unit.source: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."
trans-unit.target: Un tāpat mēs tos var atrast, ka viņi, [kas atzina] zina Allah solījums ir patiesība, un ka stundas nav nekādu šaubu. [Kas ir] kad viņi apstrīd savā starpā par to lietu un [tad] teica: "Construct pār tām struktūru. Savu kungu ir visvairāk zinot par viņiem." Teica, ka tie, kuri dominēja šajā jautājumā, "Mēs noteikti pārņems [priekš sevis] tos masjid."

trans-unit.source: They will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."
trans-unit.target: Viņi saka, tur bija trīs, ceturtā daļa no tiem ir viņu suns; un viņi teiks, ka tur bija pieci, sesto daļu no viņiem ir savu suni - minēt pie neredzamā; un viņi teiks, tur bija septiņi, un astotā no tiem bija viņu suns. Teikt, [O Muhammad] "mans kungs ir visvairāk zinot, no sava vidus. Neviens viņus zina, izņemot dažas. Tātad nav diskutēt par tiem, izņemot ar skaidrs arguments un nevar ievākt ziņas par tiem vidū [spekulanti] no jebkuras personas."

trans-unit.source: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"
trans-unit.target: Un nekad nesaki neko, "patiešām, es darīšu, ka rīt"

trans-unit.source: Except [when adding], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."
trans-unit.target: Izņemot [pievienojot], "Ja testamentu Allah." Un atcerēties savu kungu, kad aizmirst [tā] un teikt: "Varbūt mans kungs palīdzēs man to, kas ir tuvāk par šo labo uzvedību."

trans-unit.source: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.
trans-unit.target: Un viņi trīssimt gadus palika viņu alu un pārsniegts par deviņiem.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."
trans-unit.target: Teiksim, "Allah ir visvairāk zinot, cik ilgi viņi palika. Viņš pārzina [] neredzēts [aspektiem] heavens un zemes. Viņš ir kā redzēt un kā dzirdes! Tie ir ne bez viņu kāds aizsargs, un viņš piekrīt nevis savu tiesību nevienam. "

trans-unit.source: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.
trans-unit.target: Un deklamēt [O Muhammad], kas tika atklāts jums grāmatu par savu kungu. Nav neviena mainītājs, viņa vārdiem, un nekad jūs atradīsiet nevis viņam patvērumu.

trans-unit.source: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.
trans-unit.target: Un uzturēt sevi pacienta [par to] ar tiem, kas aicina savu kungu no rīta un vakarā, meklējot vaibstus. Un ļaujiet nav tavas acis iet ārpus tām, vēloties rotas pasaulīgās dzīves un nepakļaujas viens kuras sirdi mēs esam panākuši neuzmanīgs mūsu piemiņas un kas izriet viņa vēlēšanos un kuru lieta ir jebkad [] nolaidība.

trans-unit.source: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: Un saka: "patiesība ir no Kunga, tātad tam, kurš vēlas - ļaut viņam ticēt; un kurš testamentu - ļaut viņam neticēt. Patiešām, mēs esam gatavi pārkāpējus uguns, kura sienas būs surround tos. Un, ja viņi sauc pēc palīdzības, viņi būs atvieglota ar ūdeni kā duļķaina nafta, kas applaucē [viņu] sejas. Nožēlojama ir dzēriens, un ļauno ir atdusas vietu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kas ir ticēja un izdarīts taisnīgs darbiem - patiešām, mēs neļaus zust atlīdzību par kādu, kas izdarīja arī ar darbiem.

trans-unit.source: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.
trans-unit.target: Tie būs dārzi pastāvīgās dzīvesvietas; zem tiem upju plūsma. Tie būs tajā rotāja zelta aproces un valkās zaļā apģērbi un smalkas zīda brokāta, tajā guļus rotāja kušetes. Lielisks ir atlīdzība, un labs ir atdusas vietu.

trans-unit.source: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.
trans-unit.target: Un iesniegt tos divus vīriešus piemērs: mēs piešķirts viens no tiem diviem dārziem vīnstīgas, un mēs tās robežojas ar palmām un ielika starp tām [jomās] kultūrām.

trans-unit.source: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.
trans-unit.target: Katrs no diviem dārziem ražoti tās augļi un nekrita īsi to neko. Un mums nodarījis tālāk tiem izplūst upes.

trans-unit.source: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."
trans-unit.target: Un viņš bija augļu, tāpēc viņš teica savam biedram, kamēr viņš bija sarunāties ar viņu, "es esmu tiek nodrošināts lielāks un spēcīgāks [skaits] vīrieši."

trans-unit.source: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.
trans-unit.target: Un viņš iegāja dārzā, kamēr viņš bija netaisns pats ar sevi. Viņš teica: "es nedomāju, ka tas aizies bojā - jebkad.

trans-unit.source: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return."
trans-unit.target: Un nedomāju, ka notiks stunda. Un pat ja man vajadzētu ievest atpakaļ, mans kungs, es noteikti atradīsiet labāka par šo, kā atgriezties."

trans-unit.source: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?
trans-unit.target: Viņa biedrs teica viņam, kamēr viņš bija sarunāties ar viņu, "ir jums disbelieved viņš, kas radīja jūs no putekļiem un pēc tam no spermas kritums un tad proporciju jūs [kā] cilvēks?

trans-unit.source: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.
trans-unit.target: Bet kas attiecas uz mani, viņš ir Allah, milord, un es nevar saistīt ar manu Lord ikvienam.

trans-unit.source: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,
trans-unit.target: Un kāpēc tad, kad esat ievadījis savu dārzu, nav teikt, "ko Allāha gribas [noticis]; nav pilnvaras izņemot Allāhu '? Kaut gan jūs mani redzat mazāk, nekā jūs, bagātības un bērniem,

trans-unit.source: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,
trans-unit.target: Tā var būt, ka mans kungs dos man [kaut] labāk nekā jūsu dārzs un nosūtīs to postu no debesīm, un tā kļūst gluda, putekļaino zemi,

trans-unit.source: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it."
trans-unit.target: Vai tās ūdens kļūs iegrimis [zemes], dziļumos, lai jūs nekad varētu meklēt to."

trans-unit.source: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."
trans-unit.target: Un viņa augļi bija aptverto [bojāeju], tāpēc viņš sāka pagriezt plaukstas ap [ievaimanājos] pār to, ko viņš bija pavadījis, kamēr tas bija sabrukusi uz tās trellises un teica: "Ak, es vēlos man bija nav saistīts ar manu Lord ikvienam."

trans-unit.source: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.
trans-unit.target: Un tur bija viņam neviens uzņēmums atbalsta viņu nevis Allah, ne viņš varētu sevi aizstāvēt.

trans-unit.source: There the authority is [completely] for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.
trans-unit.target: Iestāde nav [pilnīgi] par Allāhu, patiesību. Viņš ir labākais atlīdzību un labāko rezultātu.

trans-unit.source: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.
trans-unit.target: Un iesniegt tos šajā pasaulē, [tā esamību] piemēram, lietus, ko nosūtām uz leju no debesīm, dzīves piemēru un zemes veģetācija mingles ar to un [tad] tā kļūst sauss paliekas, izkaisīti ar vējiem. Un Allah ir kādreiz, pār visām lietām, lieliska spēja.

trans-unit.source: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.
trans-unit.target: [Bet] rota pasaulīgās dzīves ir bagātības un bērniem. Bet ilgstoša labie darbi ir labāk savu kungu atalgojumu un labāk [viena] cerību.

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.
trans-unit.target: Un [brīdina] diena, kad mēs noņemsim kalnos un jūs redzēsiet ievērojamu zemes, un mēs apkopot tos un atstāt no viņiem kāds.

trans-unit.source: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."
trans-unit.target: Tie tiks iesniegts pirms jūsu rindās kungs [un viņš teiks], "jums ir noteikti nāk pie mums tāpat kā mēs izveidojām jums pirmo reizi. Bet jūs apgalvoja, ka nekad pagatavosim jūsu tikšanos."

trans-unit.source: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.
trans-unit.target: Jautājuma apspriešanu [darbiem] nodos [atvērts], un jūs redzēsiet baismīgs, ka tajā noziedznieki un viņi teiks, "Ak, bēdas uz mums! Kāda ir šī grāmata, kas atstāj nekas maza vai liela, izņemot to, ka tas ir uzskaitīta?" Un viņi atradīs to, ko viņi bija klāt [tiem] pirms. Un jūsu kungs dara netaisnību, lai neviens.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.
trans-unit.target: Un [min] tad, kad mēs teicām "Nogurdināt ar Adam," eņģeļu sabiedrībā, un tie Džo-Ans, izņemot Iblees. Viņš bija džins un aizgāja no viņa kunga komandu. Tad aiznes viņu un viņa pēcteču kā sabiedrotajiem, izņemot mani, kamēr viņi ir ienaidnieki, lai jūs Nožēlojama ir likumpārkāpēji kā apmaiņas.

trans-unit.source: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.
trans-unit.target: Man nav pieļāvusi tos liecinieks heavens un zemes rašanos vai veidot paši, un man nav veikusi misguiders kā asistenti.

trans-unit.source: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.
trans-unit.target: Un [brīdina] tajā dienā, kad viņš saka, "Call"Mana partneri", kuru jūs apgalvoja," un viņi atsauksies viņiem, bet viņi būs ne atbildēt uz tiem. Un mēs nodot starp tām [ielejā] iznīcināšanu.

trans-unit.source: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.
trans-unit.target: Un noziedznieki redzēs uguns un būs pārliecināti, ka tie ir tajā rudenī. Un viņi nekad negūsi no to veidu, kā citur.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.
trans-unit.target: Un mums noteikti ir diversificēts šo Qur cilvēkiem no katra [veida] piemērs; bet cilvēks kādreiz ir bijis, lielākā daļa neko [tieksme] strīds.

trans-unit.source: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.
trans-unit.target: Un nekas neļāva cilvēkiem ticēt ienākot virzības un lūgt piedošanu par savu kungu, izņemot to, ka viņiem ir atgadīties [pieraduši] precedents bijušās tautu vai sodam vajadzētu nākt [tieši] pirms tām.

trans-unit.source: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs nosūtīsim ne kurjeriem, izņemot kā labas vēstis un warners nesēji. Un tiem, kam neticēt strīdu, izmantojot [] nepatiesību mēģinājums [] tādējādi liegt tiesības uz patiesību un ir veikušas manu pantus, un, no kuriem viņi brīdināja, ar izsmieklu.

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.
trans-unit.target: Un kurš ir netaisna vairāk nekā tas, kurš atgādināja viņa lords vārsmas, bet griežas prom no tām un aizmirst to, ko viņa rokās ir nodot tālāk? Patiešām, mēs laiduši pār viņu sirdis segumi, nedrīkstam to sapratīs un viņu ausis kurlums. Un ja jūs aicināt viņus uz ieteikumu - viņi nekad vadīties, tad - jebkad.

trans-unit.source: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.
trans-unit.target: Un jūsu kungam piedošanu, pilnu žēlastības. Ja viņš būtu uzspiest vainu viņiem virsū par to, ko viņi nopelnījuši, viņš būtu būt steidzās viņiem sods. Pareizāk sakot, viņiem ir tikšanās, no kurām viņi nemūžam neizdibināsi aizbēgt.

trans-unit.source: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.
trans-unit.target: Un šīm pilsētām - mēs iznīcina tos, ja tie pāri, un mēs veicām iznīcināšanai norunāto laiku.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."
trans-unit.target: Un [min] kad Moses teica savam kalpam: "es turpināsies [ceļojumā] līdz sasniedz krustojums divām jūrām, vai turpināt uz ilgu laiku."

trans-unit.source: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.
trans-unit.target: Bet tad, kad viņi sasniedza krustojums starp viņiem, viņi aizmirsa savas zivis, un tas aizņēma savu gaitu jūrā, aizslīd garām....

trans-unit.source: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."
trans-unit.target: Kad viņi bija pagājis tālāk par to, [Moses] teica viņa zēns "Bring mums mūsu rīta maltīti. Mēs noteikti cietuši šajā, mūsu brauciena [daudz] nogurumu."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "vai jūs redzējāt, kad mēs pensionāriem līdz rokam? Patiešām, es aizmirsu [ir] zivis. Un neviens mani aizmirsīsi, izņemot sātans - ka vajadzētu pieminēt to. Un tas notika tā protams jūrā apbrīnojami".

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: "Tas, ko mēs vēlas." Tāpēc viņi atgriezās mājās, pēc viņu pēdas.

trans-unit.source: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Un viņi atrada kalpu no mūsu ierēdņi, kam mums bija dota žēlastība no mums un iemācījis viņam no mums [konkrētu] zināšanas.

trans-unit.source: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"
trans-unit.target: Moses, sacīja viņam: "var man sekot jums [stāvokļa] ka jums mācīt mani no kāda jums mācīts skaņas spriedums?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Protams, ar mani nekad varēsit pacietības.

trans-unit.source: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"
trans-unit.target: Un kā jums ir pacietība, par ko jums nav aptvert zināšanas?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: "Jūs atradīsiet mani, ja Allah testamentu, pacientam, un man nav nepaklausīs jūs [visas] secībā."

trans-unit.source: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica, "tad, ja jūs sekot man, neprasi man par kaut ko līdz man jums par to minēt."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."
trans-unit.target: Tātad viņi devušies ceļā, līdz, kad viņi bija iekāpuši uz kuģa, al-Khidh r pārplēsdams to. [Moses] teica: "jūs saplosīt tas atvērts noslīcināt savos darbiniekos? Jums ir noteikti jādara kapu lieta."

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] teica: "Es neteicu, ka ar mani jūs nekad varētu pacietības?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: "nav vainot mani, kā to, ko es aizmirsu, un neattiecas uz mani par manu jautājumu ar grūtībām."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."
trans-unit.target: Tātad viņi devušies ceļā, līdz, kad viņi satikās zēns, al-Khidh r viņu nogalināja. [Moses] teica: "jūs nogalinājāt tīra dvēsele, izņemot [nogalinājis] dvēsele? Jums ir noteikti jādara nožēlojamajiem lieta."

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] teica: "Es nepateicu, ka ar mani jūs nekad varētu pacietības?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: "ja man jālūdz jūs par kaut ko pēc šī, tad turēt mani kā sabiedrotais. Jūs iegūstat no manis attaisnojums."

trans-unit.source: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."
trans-unit.target: Tātad viņi devušies ceļā, līdz, kad viņi ieradās pilsētā cilvēki, viņi lūdza tās iedzīvotājiem pārtiku, bet viņi atteicās piedāvāt viņiem viesmīlību. Un viņi atrada tajā sienā grasījās sabrukt, lai to atjaunojusi al-Khidh r. [Moses] teica: "Ja jūs vēlētos, varētu uzņemtos to maksājumu."

trans-unit.source: [Al-Khidh r] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.
trans-unit.target: [Al-Khidh r] teica: "tas ir atvadīšanās starp mani un tevi. Es jūs informēs par interpretāciju, par kurām jums nav varējis pacietību.

trans-unit.source: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.
trans-unit.target: Attiecībā uz kuģi, tā piederēja nabadzīgajiem cilvēkiem, kas strādā pie jūras. Tāpēc biju nodomājis radīt defekts it kā radās pēc tam, kad tos karalis, kurš ik [labu] kuģa konfiscēja spēku.

trans-unit.source: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.
trans-unit.target: Kā zēns, viņa vecāki bija ticīgie, un mēs baidījās, ka viņš būtu pārslogot pārkāpšana un neticība.

trans-unit.source: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc mums paredzēts, ka viņiem vajadzētu aizvietot savu kungu vienu labāk nekā viņam tīrības un tuvāk žēlastību.

trans-unit.source: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."
trans-unit.target: Attiecībā uz sienas, tas piederēja divi sastopamu puikas pilsētā, un zem tā bija dārgumu viņiem un viņu tēvs bijis taisns. Tātad savu kungu paredzēts, ka tie sasniedz noteiktu vecumu, un izgūt savus dārgumus, kā žēlsirdība no savu kungu. Un es to ne pēc savas iniciatīvas izdarīja. Tā ir interpretācija, par kurām jums nav varējis pacietību."

trans-unit.source: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."
trans-unit.target: Un tu [O Muhammad] jautāt Dhul Qarnayn. Teiksim, "Man būs deklamēt jums par viņu ziņojumu."

trans-unit.source: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, mēs konstatēja, viņam uz zemes, un mēs iedevām viņam viss veidā.

trans-unit.source: So he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc viņš aiz tā

trans-unit.source: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."
trans-unit.target: Līdz viņš sasniedza saule iestatījumu, viņš konstatēja, ka [, ja] nosakot pavasarī tumši dubļu un viņš atrada netālu no to cilvēku. Allah teica: "O Dhul-Qarnayn, vai nu jūs sodīt [tiem] vai arī starp tām, [tā kā] pieņem Dievs."

trans-unit.source: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Runājot par vienu, kurš netaisnības, mums būs viņu sodīt. Tad viņš atgriezās viņa kungu, un viņš būs sodīt viņu ar briesmīgs sods.

trans-unit.source: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."
trans-unit.target: Bet tāpat kā tas, kurš tic un dara taisnību, viņam būs paradīze atlīdzība, un mēs ar viņu aprunāšos no mūsu komanda ar vieglumu.

trans-unit.source: Then he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Tad sekoja veids

trans-unit.source: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.
trans-unit.target: Līdz, kad viņš nonāca saulē rising, viņš konstatēja, ka pieaug par cilvēkiem, kuriem mēs nebūtu padarījis pret to kāds vairogs.

trans-unit.source: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Tādējādi. Un mums bija ietvēra [visas] kas Jondalaram ir zināšanas.

trans-unit.source: Then he followed a way
trans-unit.target: Tad sekoja veids

trans-unit.source: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.
trans-unit.target: Līdz, kad viņš sasniedza [caurlaides] starp diviem kalniem, atrada viņiem līdzās cilvēkiem, kuri diez vai varētu saprast [viņa] runas.

trans-unit.source: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "O. Dhul-Qarnayn, patiešām Gog un Magog ir [liels] corrupters zemi. Tātad var mums piešķirt jums izdevumi, kas varētu padarīt starp mums un viņiem barjera? "

trans-unit.source: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "mans kungs ir reģistrēts man ir labāks [par to, ko jūs piedāvājat], bet man palīdzēsiet ar stiprumu; Būs padarīt starp jums un tiem dambis.

trans-unit.source: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."
trans-unit.target: Atnesiet man dzelzs lapas"- līdz, kad viņš bija izlīdzinātas [tiem] starp divām kalnu sienām, viņš teica,"Trieciens [ar plēšām]"līdz, kad viņš bija to taisījis [kā] uguns, viņš teica:" atnes man, ka var ieliet pār to kausēta vara. "

trans-unit.source: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.
trans-unit.target: Tātad Gog un Magog nevarējām iet pār to, nedz varēja tās [efektu] tajā jebkurā izplatība.

trans-unit.source: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."
trans-unit.target: [Dhul Qarnayn] teica: "Šis ir žēlastības no mana Lord; bet, kad pienāks mans kungs sola, viņš dos līmenī, un kādreiz ir solījums par manu kungam taisnība."

trans-unit.source: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs atstāsim viņiem šajā dienā gāzās pāri viens otram, [tad] tiks izpūstas ragu un mēs organizēsim tos [viena] asambleja.

trans-unit.source: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -
trans-unit.target: Un mēs klāt pie velna, kas dienā Disbelievers displejs -

trans-unit.source: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.
trans-unit.target: Tie, kam acis bija atradies vāka [izņemta] no mana atceri, un viņi nav spējuši dzirdēt.

trans-unit.source: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.
trans-unit.target: Tad tiem, kuri neticēt domā, ka viņi var veikt manu darbinieku vietā, lai mani kā sabiedrotie Patiešām, mēs esam gatavi ellē disbelievers kā patvērumu.

trans-unit.source: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?
trans-unit.target: Teikt, [O Muhammad], "mēs [ticīgie] informē par lielākajiem zaudētājiem kā ar [to] darbiem?

trans-unit.source: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."
trans-unit.target: [Tie] tie, kuru pūles tiek zaudēts pasaulīgās dzīves, kamēr viņi domā, ka viņi dara labi, darba. "

trans-unit.source: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.
trans-unit.target: Tie ir tie, kuri neticēt vārsmas par savu kungu un [to] Īdenu, tāpēc viņu darbiem ir kļuvis nevērtīgs; un mums būs nedrīkst piešķirt viņiem par augšāmcelšanās dienu jebkādu nozīmi.

trans-unit.source: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir viņu atlīdzība - elle - par to, ko tie noliedza un [jo] viņi paņēma manu pazīmes un mana kurjeriem izsmiekls.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kas ir ticēja un izdarīts taisnīgs darbiem - tie būs kā patvērumu, Gardens Paradise

trans-unit.source: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.
trans-unit.target: Kur viņi ievēro mūžīgi. Tie būs nevēlas no tā kādu pārskaitījumu.

trans-unit.source: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."
trans-unit.target: Teikt: "ja jūra bija tintes [rakstīšanai] vārdus, manu pavēlniek, jūras būtu izsmelta pirms mana Kunga vārdi bija izsmelti, pat tad, ja mēs celta līdzīgi kā papildinājumu."

trans-unit.source: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."
trans-unit.target: Saku, "es esmu tikai cilvēks, tāpat kā jūs, uz kuriem ir atklājies, ka tavs Dievs, ir viens Dievs. Tātad tam, kurš izsaka cerību par tikšanos ar viņa lords - let viņam darīt taisns strādāt un nesaista savu kungu dievkalpojumu nevienam."

trans-unit.source: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.
trans-unit.target: Kaf, Ha, Ya, ' Ayn, skumji.

trans-unit.source: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah
trans-unit.target: [Tas] pieminēt jūsu kungs savam kalpam Zaharijs žēlsirdības

trans-unit.source: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.
trans-unit.target: Kad viņš piezvanīja viņa kungs privātās lūgšanas.

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: mans kungs, patiešām mani kauli ir novājināta, un mana galva ir piepildīta ar baltu, un nekad nav bijis, mans sirsnīgs lūgums jums, mans Lord, nelaimīgs.

trans-unit.source: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir
trans-unit.target: Un patiešām, es baidos, ka mantiniekiem pēc manis un mana sieva ir neauglīgs, tāpēc arī mani no sevis mantinieks

trans-unit.source: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."
trans-unit.target: Kas pārmanto mani un pārmantoti no Jēkaba ģimene. Un piespiest viņu, milord, patīkami [tu]."

trans-unit.source: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."
trans-unit.target: [Viņš teica], "O Zaharijs, patiešām mēs jums dot labu zēnam, kura nosaukums būs John vēstis. Mums nav piešķirts jebkuram pirms [Šis] nosaukums."

trans-unit.source: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Mans kungs, kā man būs zēns tad, kad mana sieva bija neauglīgs un ir panākta galējā vecuma?"

trans-unit.source: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "
trans-unit.target: [Angel] teica: "tādējādi [būtu]; jūsu kungs saka: "Ir viegli man, es radīju jūs agrāk, kamēr jūs bijāt nekas." "

trans-unit.source: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."
trans-unit.target: [Zaharijs] teica: "Mans kungs, dot man zīmi." Viņš teica: "tava zīme ir, ka jūs negrib runāt ar cilvēkiem trīs naktis [ir] skaņas".

trans-unit.source: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.
trans-unit.target: Tātad viņš savai tautai iznāca no lūgšanu telpas un signalizēja, ka tos var pacilāt [Allah] no rīta un pēcpusdienā.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy
trans-unit.target: [Allah] teica: "O John veikt rakstiem ar lielu apņēmību." Un mēs iedevām viņam sprieduma [kamēr vēl] boy

trans-unit.source: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah
trans-unit.target: Un simpātijas no mums un tīrība, un viņš bija baidoties no Allah

trans-unit.source: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
trans-unit.target: Un pakļaudamies saviem vecākiem, un viņš bija nevis nepaklausīga tirāns.

trans-unit.source: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.
trans-unit.target: Un miera be upon him dienā ir dzimis un nākamajā dienā viņš nomirst un diena ir pacēlis dzīvs.

trans-unit.source: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.
trans-unit.target: Un pieminēt [O Muhammad] grāmata [stāsts] Mērija, kad viņa atteicās no savas ģimenes vietā uz austrumiem.

trans-unit.source: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.
trans-unit.target: Un viņa aizveda noslēgtībā no tām ekrāna. Tad mēs nosūtījām mūsu savu eņģeli, un viņš pārstāv pats viņu kā labi proporcionāli cilvēks.

trans-unit.source: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."
trans-unit.target: Viņa teica: "patiešām, man meklēt patvērumu visvairāk žēlsirdīgs no tevis, [tā atstāj man], ja jūs būtu baidoties no Allah."

trans-unit.source: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "es esmu tikai kurjers ar savu kungu, lai dotu jums [Jaunumi] tīra zēns."

trans-unit.source: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"
trans-unit.target: Viņa teica: "Kā es varu būt zēnu, kamēr neviens cilvēks ir saskāries mani un nav bijis nešķīsts?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.' "
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "tādējādi [būtu]; jūsu kungs saka: "tas ir viegli mani, un mēs veiksim viņu parakstīt cilvēku un žēlastību no mums. Un tas ir jautājums, ko izsludinājusi [jau]. " "

trans-unit.source: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.
trans-unit.target: Tātad viņa iecerēts viņam un viņa atsauca viņam līdzi uz attālu vietu.

trans-unit.source: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."
trans-unit.target: Un dzemdību sāpes viņas brauca uz palmu koku stumbru. Viņa teica: "Ak, es vēlos man bija miris pirms šīs un biju aizmiršana, aizmirsuši."

trans-unit.source: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.
trans-unit.target: Bet viņš tai piezvanīja no zem viņas "nebēdājies; savu kungu zem jums ir sniedzis strauts.

trans-unit.source: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.
trans-unit.target: Un krata pret tevi; palmu koka stumbra tas būs nokrītam uz jums pienācis, svaigi datumus.

trans-unit.source: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "
trans-unit.target: Tātad, ēst un dzert un būtu apmierināts. Un ja jūs redzat kādu no cilvēces kāds, teiksim, "Patiešām, es ir apsolīja vairums žēlsirdīgs atturēšanos, tāpēc es runāšu nevis šodien kādam [] cilvēks." "

trans-unit.source: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.
trans-unit.target: Tad viņa atveda viņas ļaudis, viņu ved. Viņi teica: "O Marija, noteikti jums kaut ko nebijušu.

trans-unit.source: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."
trans-unit.target: Aaron O māsa, tavs tēvs nebija ļauns cilvēks, ne jau arī ir tava māte nešķīsts."

trans-unit.source: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc viņa norādīja. Viņi teica: "Kā var atvēlēt kādam, kurš ir šūpulis bērnu?"

trans-unit.source: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.
trans-unit.target: [Jēzus] teica: "Protams, es esmu Allah kalps. Viņš ir devis man Bībele un lika man pravietis.

trans-unit.source: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive
trans-unit.target: Un viņš lika man laimīgs tur, kur esmu, un ir pieprasījusi man virsū, lūgšanu un zakah tik ilgi, kamēr es joprojām esmu dzīvs

trans-unit.source: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.
trans-unit.target: Un [mani] pakļaudamies mana māte, un viņš nav veikusi mani nožēlojamā tirāns.

trans-unit.source: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."
trans-unit.target: Un miers ir mani dienā ir dzimis un dienā būs mirst un nākamajā dienā es esmu izvirzīts dzīvs."

trans-unit.source: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir Jēzus dēls Mariju - vārdu patiesību par to, kas viņi ir strīds.

trans-unit.source: It is not [befitting] for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.
trans-unit.target: Tas nav [befitting] Allah veikt dēls; sajūsmināts viņš ir! Kad viņš paziņo dēka, viņš tikai saka, "Būt", un tas ir.

trans-unit.source: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."
trans-unit.target: [Jēzus sacīja:] "un patiešām, Allah ir mans kungs un jūsu kungs, tātad pielūgt viņu. Kas ir taisns ceļš."

trans-unit.source: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.
trans-unit.target: Tad frakcijām atšķīrās [Jēzus] par kādu no tiem, tātad bēdas tiem, kuri disbelieved - no skatuves milzīgs diena.

trans-unit.source: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.
trans-unit.target: Kā [skaidri] viņi būs dzirdēt un redzēt dienā, viņi brauc uz mums, bet pārkāpējus šodien ir skaidri kļūda.

trans-unit.source: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.
trans-unit.target: Un brīdināt, [O Muhammad] par dienu par nožēlu, kad lieta tiks noslēgts; un [vēl], viņi ir [valsts] heedlessness, un viņi netic.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tas ir, mēs kas mantos zemi un kurš ir par to, un mums tie tiks atgriezti.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Un pieminēt Ābrahama grāmata [stāsts]. Protams, viņš bija cilvēks, patiesības un pravietis.

trans-unit.source: [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?
trans-unit.target: [Min], kad viņš teica, viņa tēvs, "mans tēvs, kāpēc jūs pielūgt to, ko neredz, nedzird un negūs labumu jums vispār O?

trans-unit.source: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.
trans-unit.target: O mans tēvs patiešām tur ir pienācis mani zināšanas, kas nav pienācis, lai sekotu mani; Es jums palīdzēs pat ceļā.

trans-unit.source: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.
trans-unit.target: O mans tēvs nav dievkalpojumu sātans. Patiešām sātans ir kādreiz bijis, vairums žēlsirdīgs, nepaklausīgs.

trans-unit.source: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."
trans-unit.target: O mans tēvs, patiešām es baidos, ka tur būs pieskarties jums sods no vairums žēlsirdīgs tāpēc jums būtu sātans biedrs [Hellfire]."

trans-unit.source: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."
trans-unit.target: [Tēva] teica: "vai jums nav vēlēšanās, augstie dievi, O Abraham? Ja jums nav atturēties, es noteikti akmens jums, lai izvairītos no manis ilgāku laiku."

trans-unit.source: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.
trans-unit.target: [Abraham] teica: "miers ir pār jums. Būs lūgt piedošanu, jūs mana Kunga. Protams, viņš ir kādreiz laipns pret mani.

trans-unit.source: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy."
trans-unit.target: Un es atstās Jums un tiem, kas jums atsaukties uz citiem mērķiem kā vien Allāhs, un atsauksies manam kungam. Es ceru, ka man nebūs piesaukšana mani nelaimīgs kungam."

trans-unit.source: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc, kad viņš atstāja tajās un viņi pielūdz citiem mērķiem kā vien Allāhs, mēs iedevām Isaac un Džeikobam, un katra [tiem] mēs veicām pravietis.

trans-unit.source: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs iedevām viņiem mūsu varā, un mēs viņiem reputāciju augsto godu.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Un pieminēt grāmatu, Moses. Patiešām, viņš tika izvēlēts, un viņš bija kurjers un pravietis.

trans-unit.source: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].
trans-unit.target: Un mēs viņu sauca no sāna mount [viņa] tiesības un atveda pie, uzticēt [viņam] lai.

trans-unit.source: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs iedevām no mūsu žēlastība viņa brālis Ārons kā pravietis.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Un pieminēt grāmatu, Ishmael. Protams, viņam bija taisnība, viņa solījumu, un viņš bija kurjers un pravietis.

trans-unit.source: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.
trans-unit.target: Viņš mēdza liek cilvēkiem lūgšanu pēc zakah un bija patīkami viņa kungs.

trans-unit.source: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.
trans-unit.target: Un pieminēt Idrees grāmatā. Protams, viņš bija cilvēks, patiesības un pravietis.

trans-unit.source: And We raised him to a high station.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs izcēlām viņu augstu stacijai.

trans-unit.source: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.
trans-unit.target: Tie bija tie, pēc kuriem Allah apveltīts labvēlība no praviešiem pēcteči Ādama un no tiem mēs pārvadāt [kuģa] ar Noah un pēcteči Abraham un Izraēlu, kā arī tās valstis, kuras mums vadīties un izvēlējās. Kad viņiem tika citēja pantus no vairums žēlsirdīgs, tie samazinājās prostrācija un asaru.

trans-unit.source: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -
trans-unit.target: Bet tur ieradās pēc tiem mantiniekiem, kuri novārtā lūgšanu un sasniedzamo vēlmes; Tātad viņi gatavojas tikties ar ļauno-

trans-unit.source: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.
trans-unit.target: Izņemot tos, kuri nožēlot, domāt un darīt taisnību; tiem, kas stāsies Paradise un būs kaitējums nav vispār.

trans-unit.source: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.
trans-unit.target: [Tajā ir] dārzi pastāvīgas dzīvesvietas, kurā vairums žēlsirdīgs ir apsolījis saviem kalpiem neredzēts. Protams, viņa sola arvien nāk.

trans-unit.source: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.
trans-unit.target: Tie netiek atskaņots tajā jebkuru sliktu runu - tikai mieru [sveicieniem] - un tie būs to sniegšanu, no rīta un pēcpusdienā.

trans-unit.source: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir paradīze, kas mums dod kā mantojuma tiem mūsu ierēdņi, kuri bija baidoties no Allah.

trans-unit.source: [Gabriel said], "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -
trans-unit.target: [Gabriel teica], "un mēs [eņģeļi] nolaisties ne izņemot by the order of savu kungu. Viņam pieder, kas pirms mums un ka aiz mums un kas ir pa vidu. Un nekad nav savu kungu aizmāršīgs-

trans-unit.source: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"
trans-unit.target: Lord no debesīm un zemi un kāds ir starp tām - tik pielūgt viņu un pacietības viņa dievkalpojumiem. Vai jūs zināt jebkura līdzība ar viņu?"

trans-unit.source: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"
trans-unit.target: Un disbeliever saka: "Kad ir miris, es esmu gatavojas celt tālāk dzīvs?"

trans-unit.source: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?
trans-unit.target: Cilvēks neatceras, ka mēs izveidojām viņam agrāk, kamēr viņš bija nekas?

trans-unit.source: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.
trans-unit.target: Tātad ar savu kungu, mēs noteikti pulcēsies tos un velni, tad mums dos viņiem jābūt klāt ap elle uz viņu ceļiem.

trans-unit.source: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs noteikti ekstrakts no katra sekta tiem no viņiem, kas bija vissliktākais pret vairums žēlsirdīgs, nekaunību.

trans-unit.source: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.
trans-unit.target: Tad, protams, tas ir mums, kas ir lielākā daļa zinot, no tiem visvairāk cienīgs degšanas tajā.

trans-unit.source: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.
trans-unit.target: Un nav neviena, izņemot viņš nāks ar to. Tas ir pēc jūsu kungs neizbēgams izsludinājusi.

trans-unit.source: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs saglabāt tiem, kas baidījās no Allah un atstāt pārkāpējus, uz ceļiem.

trans-unit.source: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"
trans-unit.target: Un kad mūsu vārsmas tiek citēja viņiem kā skaidrus pierādījumus, kuri neticēt teikt tiem, kas tic, "Kas [mūsu] abas puses ir labākā stāvoklī un labāko asociācija?"

trans-unit.source: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?
trans-unit.target: Un cik paaudze mums ir iznīcinājuši pirms tiem, kuri bija labāk mantu un [izvešana] izskatā?

trans-unit.source: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."
trans-unit.target: Teikt: "kurš ir kļūda - ļāva visvairāk žēlsirdīgs paplašināt viņam pagarināt [bagātību un laika] līdz, kad viņi redz to, kas viņiem bija solīts - sods [šajā pasaulē] vai [augšāmcelšanās] stundu - viņi nāks zināt, kurš ir sliktākā stāvoklī un vājāka karavīri."

trans-unit.source: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.
trans-unit.target: Allāhs tiem, kuri tika vadīta vadlīnijās, palielina un ilgstošu labie darbi ir labāk savu Kungu par atlīdzību un labāka izmantošana.

trans-unit.source: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]?"
trans-unit.target: Tad tu esi redzējis viņam, kurš disbelieved mūsu vārsmas un teica: "Man būs noteikti jādod bagātību un bērniem [nākamajā dzīvē]?"

trans-unit.source: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?
trans-unit.target: Viņš ir pētījusi neredzamā vai ir aizgājis no vairums žēlsirdīgs solījumu?

trans-unit.source: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.
trans-unit.target: nē! Mēs reģistrēs to, ko viņš saka, un paplašinās viņu no soda plaši.

trans-unit.source: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs mantot viņu [in] ko viņš piemin, un viņš nāks mūs mierā.

trans-unit.source: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.
trans-unit.target: Un tās ir veikušas ne tikai Allāhs [viltus] dievības, kas tie būtu par tiem [avots] godu.

trans-unit.source: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].
trans-unit.target: nē! Šie "Dievu" noliegs viņu pielūgšanu un būs pret tiem pretiniekiem [par sprieduma dienā].

trans-unit.source: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?
trans-unit.target: Jūs neredzēsiet, ka mēs esam nosūtījuši velni pēc disbelievers, kūdot tos [ļauno] [pastāvīgi] ar naida kurināšanu?

trans-unit.source: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.
trans-unit.target: Tātad nevar būt nepacietīgs pār viņiem. Mēs tikai skaitīt tos [ierobežotā].

trans-unit.source: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation
trans-unit.target: Dienu mēs pulcēsies taisns, lai vairums žēlsirdīgs kā delegācijas

trans-unit.source: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst
trans-unit.target: Un būs vadīt noziedznieku Hell no slāpēm

trans-unit.source: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.
trans-unit.target: Neviens būs [spēku] aizrunāšana, izņemot tas, kas bija ņemti no vairums žēlsirdīgs derību.

trans-unit.source: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."
trans-unit.target: Un viņi saka: "visvairāk žēlsirdīgs veikusi [viņš] dēlu."

trans-unit.source: You have done an atrocious thing.
trans-unit.target: Tu esi izdarījis zvērīgās lieta.

trans-unit.source: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation
trans-unit.target: Debesīs gandrīz pārrāvums izdarīšanu un zemes sašķeļ atvērta un kalnos sabrukumu postījumiem

trans-unit.source: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.
trans-unit.target: Ka tie piedēvēt visvairāk žēlīgs dēls.

trans-unit.source: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.
trans-unit.target: Un tas nav piemērots vairums žēlsirdīgs, kas viņam jāveic dēls.

trans-unit.source: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.
trans-unit.target: Nav viena debess un zeme, bet, ka viņš nāk ļoti žēlsirdīgi kā kalps.

trans-unit.source: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.
trans-unit.target: Viņš ir uzskaitītas tās un skaitot tos [pilns] skaitīšana.

trans-unit.source: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.
trans-unit.target: Un visi no tiem nāk viņam vien augšāmcelšanās dienu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kas ticēja un izdarīts taisnīgs darbiem - vairums žēlsirdīgs gribas iecelt viņiem simpātijas.

trans-unit.source: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.
trans-unit.target: Tātad, [O Muhammad], mēs esam tikai veikuši Qur viegli arābu valodā, jums var dot labas vēstis tādējādi taisns un brīdināt tādējādi naidīgi cilvēki.

trans-unit.source: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?
trans-unit.target: Un cik daudz mēs iznīcinājuši pirms tām paaudzēm? Vai jūs uztver ikviens no viņiem vai dzirdēt no tiem skaņas

trans-unit.source: Ta, Ha.
trans-unit.target: Ta, Ha.

trans-unit.source: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed
trans-unit.target: Mums nav nosūtīti uz leju jums Korāns, ka jums nebūs apbēdināts

trans-unit.source: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah] -
trans-unit.target: Bet tikai kā atgādinājums tiem, kuri baidās, [Allah]-

trans-unit.source: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,
trans-unit.target: Atklāsme no viņam, kas radīja zemes un augstāko debesīs,

trans-unit.source: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.
trans-unit.target: Vairums žēlsirdīgs [kas ir] iepriekš izveidota tronī.

trans-unit.source: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.
trans-unit.target: Viņam pieder, kāda ir debesīs un kas ir uz zemes un kas ir starp tām un kas ir zem zemes.

trans-unit.source: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja jūs runāt skaļi - patiešām, tad viņš zina noslēpums un kas ir paslēpts [vēl].

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.
trans-unit.target: Allah - nav neviens, izņemot viņu dievība. Viņam pieder labākos vārdus.

trans-unit.source: And has the story of Moses reached you? -
trans-unit.target: Un stāsts par Moses sasniegusi jums? -

trans-unit.source: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."
trans-unit.target: Kad viņš ieraudzīja ugunskuru un teica, viņa ģimenei, "palikt šeit; patiešām, man ir uztvert uguni; Varbūt es varu nest lāpu vai atrast pie ugunskura daži norādījumi."

trans-unit.source: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,
trans-unit.target: Un kad viņš nonāca pie tā, viņš sauca, "O Moses,

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, es esmu jūsu kungs, tātad noņemt jūsu sandales. Protams, jūs esat Tuwa Svētā ieleja.

trans-unit.source: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].
trans-unit.target: Un es tevi izvēlējies, tāpēc klausies ko ir atklāts [tu].

trans-unit.source: Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, es esmu Allah. Nav neviena dievība, izņemot mani, tā pielūdz mani un izveidot lūgšanu par manu piemiņu.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.
trans-unit.target: Protams, nāk stunda - es gandrīz to - noslēpt, tāpēc, ka katru dvēseli var recompensed pēc, par kuru tā cenšas.

trans-unit.source: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc nedrīkst pieļaut, ka kāds novērst jūs no tā kurš netic to un seko viņa vēlmes, [tad] jums jāiet bojā.

trans-unit.source: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"
trans-unit.target: Un kas tas ir labajā rokā, Moses O?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "tas ir mans personāls; Es liesās uz to, un es pazemināt lapas manas avis un man tajā citādai izmantošanai."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."
trans-unit.target: [Allah] teica: "Metiet zemē, O Moses."

trans-unit.source: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc viņš threw to uz leju, un tad tas bija čūska, žigli atkāpdamies.

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] teica: "sagrābt važiņu un bailes nav; Tās iepriekšējā stāvoklī mēs atgriezīsim.

trans-unit.source: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,
trans-unit.target: Un vērš savu roku uz sāniem; tas nāks, balta, bez slimības - cita apzīmējuma,

trans-unit.source: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.
trans-unit.target: Ka mēs parādīsim jums [kādu] mūsu lielāks pazīmes.

trans-unit.source: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."
trans-unit.target: Dodieties uz faraons. Protams, viņš ir pārkāpts."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: "mans kungs, paplašināt man manu krūšu [ar Software assurance]

trans-unit.source: And ease for me my task
trans-unit.target: Un vieglumu man mans uzdevums

trans-unit.source: And untie the knot from my tongue
trans-unit.target: Un atsiet mezglu no mana mēle

trans-unit.source: That they may understand my speech.
trans-unit.target: Ka viņi var saprast manu runu.

trans-unit.source: And appoint for me a minister from my family -
trans-unit.target: Un iecelt par mani no mana ģimene - ministrs

trans-unit.source: Aaron, my brother.
trans-unit.target: Aaron, mans brālis.

trans-unit.source: Increase through him my strength
trans-unit.target: Palielinātu viņu mans spēks

trans-unit.source: And let him share my task
trans-unit.target: Un ļaut viņam dalīties ar manu uzdevumu

trans-unit.source: That we may exalt You much
trans-unit.target: Ka mēs var pacilāt jums daudz

trans-unit.source: And remember You much.
trans-unit.target: Un atcerieties, jums daudz.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, jūs no mums kādreiz redzēt."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] teica: "vai jums ir piešķirta jūsu pieprasījumu, O Moses.

trans-unit.source: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,
trans-unit.target: Un mēs jau bija piešķirtas labvēlība pār jums vēl vienu reizi,

trans-unit.source: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,
trans-unit.target: Kad mēs iedvesmoja ar savu māti tas, ko mēs iedvesmoja,

trans-unit.source: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye.
trans-unit.target: [Saka] "nodot viņam uz krūtīm un cast to upju un upju būs mest uz banku; tur būtu ar mieru mani ienaidnieki un ienaidnieks viņam. " Un es dāvājis mīlestību no manis, kas tiktu audzināti saskaņā ar manu aci.

trans-unit.source: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.
trans-unit.target: [Un mēs jums privileģēts] kad tava māsa devās un sacīja: "Es vada jūs kādam, kurš būs atbildīgs par viņu?" Tāpēc mēs jums atjaunot savu māti, ka viņa varētu būt saturu un nebēdājies. Un tevi nogalināt kādu, bet mēs ietaupīto atriebības un mēģināja jums ar [smagas] trial. Un palika [kādu] gadiem Madyan cilvēku vidū. Tad jūs atbraucāt [] O Moses izsludinājusi brīdī.

trans-unit.source: And I produced you for Myself.
trans-unit.target: Un es jums par sevi.

trans-unit.source: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.
trans-unit.target: Iet, jūs un jūsu brālis ar manu pazīmes un nav palēnināja manu piemiņai.

trans-unit.source: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
trans-unit.target: Ej, gan no jums, lai faraons. Patiešām, ir pārkāpts.

trans-unit.source: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allah]."
trans-unit.target: Un runāt ar viņu ar maigu runas, ka varbūt viņš var atgādināja vai bailes [Allah]."

trans-unit.source: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."
trans-unit.target: Viņi teica: "mūsu kungs, tik tiešām mēs baidās, ka viņš būs paātrināt [sods] pret mums vai ka viņš pārkāpt."

trans-unit.source: [Allah] said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.
trans-unit.target: [Allah] teica: "bailes nav. Patiešām, es esmu ar jums abiem; Es dzirdu un redzu.

trans-unit.source: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.
trans-unit.target: Lai iet pie viņa un saka: "patiešām, mēs esam savu kungu kurjeriem, tik nosūtīt mums ar Izraēlas bērniem un nevis mocīt tos. Mēs esam nonākuši pie jums ar zīmi no savu kungu. Un miers būs pēc viņš, kurš šādi norādījumi.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.' "
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tas tika atklāts mums sods būs tas, kurš noliedz un pagriežas prom. " "

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"
trans-unit.target: [Faraons] teica: "Kas ir kungs, no jums abiem, Moses O?"

trans-unit.source: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "Mūsu kungs, viņš, kas deva katru lieta tā forma un tad aizveda [tā]."

trans-unit.source: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"
trans-unit.target: [Faraons] teica: "Tad kāda ir iepriekšējo paaudžu lieta?"

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."
trans-unit.target: [Moses] teica: "tās zināšanas, kas ir ar manu Lord ierakstā. Mans kungs kļūdās, nedz aizmirst."

trans-unit.source: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.
trans-unit.target: [Tas ir, viņš], kas ir radīts jums zemes kā gultas [izklāja] un ievieto tajā braucamie ceļi un nosūtīts uz leju no debesīm, lietus un tādējādi ražo dažādus augus kategorijām.

trans-unit.source: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.
trans-unit.target: Ēst [tiem], un jūsu mājlopu ganībām. Patiešām, ka tiem izlūkošanas ir pazīmes.

trans-unit.source: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.
trans-unit.target: No zemes, mēs izveidojām, un to mēs jums atgriezīsim un no tā mēs ekstrakts jums citā laikā.

trans-unit.source: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti negrasījās faraons mūsu - visi no viņiem - bet viņš noliedza un atteicās.

trans-unit.source: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?
trans-unit.target: Viņš teica: "jūs esat nākuši pie mums, lai vestu mūs no mūsu zemes ar savu maģiju, Moses O?

trans-unit.source: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs noteikti dos jums nepatīk maģija, tāpēc pārliecinieties, starp mums un jums tikšanos, kas nav mums neizdosies saglabāt un ne jūs, vietā piešķirta."

trans-unit.source: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."
