trans-unit.target: Tad kāpēc, kad dvēsele pēc nāves nonāk rīkles

trans-unit.source: And you are at that time looking on -
trans-unit.target: Un jums ir pēc šī laika, skatoties no -

trans-unit.source: And Our angels are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -
trans-unit.target: Un mūsu eņģeļi ir tuvāk viņa nekā jūs, bet jūs neredzat-

trans-unit.source: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,
trans-unit.target: Tad kāpēc jūs, ja jums nav recompensed,

trans-unit.source: Bring it back, if you should be truthful?
trans-unit.target: Dot to atpakaļ, ja jums ir jābūt patiesam?

trans-unit.source: And if the deceased was of those brought near to Allah,
trans-unit.target: Un, ja mirušais bija no tiem, kas cēla pie Allah,

trans-unit.source: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.
trans-unit.target: Tad [viņam ir] atpūtas un devība un baudu dārzs.

trans-unit.source: And if he was of the companions of the right,
trans-unit.target: Un, ja viņš bija labi biedrus

trans-unit.source: Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."
trans-unit.target: Tad [eņģeļi saka], "Miers jums; [esi] no tiesības pavadoņiem. "

trans-unit.source: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,
trans-unit.target: Bet, ja viņš bija noliedzēju, [kas ir] apmaldīties,

trans-unit.source: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water
trans-unit.target: Tad [viņam ir] izmitināšanu no applaucēšanās ūdens

trans-unit.source: And burning in Hellfire
trans-unit.target: Un ierakstīšana Hellfire

trans-unit.source: Indeed, this is the true certainty,
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tas ir patiess noteiktību,

trans-unit.source: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
trans-unit.target: Tātad cildināt savu kungu, ļoti liels nosaukums.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Kāda ir debesu un zemes exalts Allah, un viņš ir izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Viņš ir debesu un zemes valdījums. Viņš dod dzīvību un izraisa nāvi, un viņš ir pār visām lietām, kas ir kompetentas.

trans-unit.source: He is the First and the Last, the Ascendant and the Intimate, and He is, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Viņš ir pirmais un pēdējais, pieaugošā un intīmo un viņam ir visas lietas, zinot.

trans-unit.source: It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tas, kas radīja debesis un zemi sešās dienās un pēc tam iemitinājies virs troņa. Viņš zina, kas iesūcas zemē un kas izriet no tā un kas nolaižas no debesīm un kas paceļas tajā; un viņš ir kopā ar jums, lai kur jūs atrastos. Un Allah, par to, ko jūs darīt, ir redzēt.

trans-unit.source: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.
trans-unit.target: Viņš ir debesu un zemes valdījums. Un lai Allāhs ir atgriezušies [visas] jautājumiem.

trans-unit.source: He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and he is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Viņš liek ievadīt dienas nakts un diena, lai ievadītu nakti liek, un viņš zinot, ka pēc krūtis.

trans-unit.source: Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successors. For those who have believed among you and spent, there will be a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Tic Allah un viņa Messenger un pavadīt no tā, kurā viņš ir padarījusi tevi mantiniekiem. Tiem, kuri uzskatīja, ka starp jums un pavadīja tur būs liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: And why do you not believe in Allah while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should [truly] be believers?
trans-unit.target: Un kāpēc jums neticu Allah kaut Messenger aicina jūs domāt ar savu kungu, un viņš ir veicis savu karagājienu, ja esiet [patiesi] ticīgie?

trans-unit.source: It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Muhammad] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, Allah is to you Kind and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir viņš, kurš sūta uz leju pēc viņa kalps [Muhammad] pantus par skaidru pierādījumu, ka viņš var nest no darknesses uz gaismu. Un patiešām, Allah ir jums veida un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: And why do you not spend in the cause of Allah while to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all Allah has promised the best [reward]. And Allah, with what you do, is Acquainted.
trans-unit.target: Un kāpēc jums nav tērēt Allah, bet lai Allāhs rada pieder mantojums, kas debesis un zemi? Nav vienāds jūsu vidū ir tie, kuri pavadīja pirms uzvara [Makkah] un cīnījās [un tiem, kas to darīja pēc tam, kad]. Tie ir lielāka mērā nekā tie, kas pēc tam pavadīja un cīnījās. Bet uz visiem Allah ir apsolījis labāko [atlīdzība]. Un Allah, ar to, ko jūs darīt, ir iepazinies.

trans-unit.source: Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?
trans-unit.target: Kas ir tas, ka būtu aizdevuma Allah pamatīgs aizdevums Tātad viņš būs vairoties to viņam un viņam būs cēlu atlīdzība?

trans-unit.source: On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Dienā jūs redzat, uzskatot, ka vīrieši un uzskatot, ka sievietes, viņu gaismas tiesvedībā pirms viņiem un par viņu tiesībām, [tas tiks teikts], "labas vēstis šodien ir [par] dārzos zem kuras upju plūsma, kur jums ievērot mūžīgi." Lūk, kas ir liels sasniegšana.

trans-unit.source: On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing mercy, but on the outside of it is torment.
trans-unit.target: [Paša] dienā liekulis vīriešiem un sievietēm, liekulis teiks tiem, kuri uzskatīja, ka, "Gaidīt mums mums var iegūt dažus no jūsu gaisma." Tas būs teica: "Iet atpakaļ aiz jums un meklēt gaismu." Un sienas tiks novietoti starp tām ar durvīm, tās interjers, kurā žēlsirdība, bet ārpusē tas ir mocība.

trans-unit.source: The hypocrites will call to the believers, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves and awaited [misfortune for us] and doubted, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you concerning Allah.
trans-unit.target: Liekuļi sauks pie ticīgajiem, "Nebija mums līdzi?" Viņi saka, "Jā, bet sev nomocīts un gaidītā [nelaime mums] un šaubījās un karojošs domāšana tiek maldināts, līdz brīdim, kad tur ieradās Allah komandu. Un blēdis maldināts, jums par Allah.

trans-unit.source: So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Tātad šodien bez izpirkuma naudu ņems no jums vai kuri disbelieved. Savu patvērumu ir uguns. Tas ir visvairāk cienīgs, un nožēlojams ir galamērķis.

trans-unit.source: Has the time not come for those who have believed that their hearts should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of Allah and what has come down of the truth? And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their hearts hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Laiks nav pienācis, kuri uzskatīja, ka viņu sirdis jākļūst pazemīgi pakļāvīgi par piemiņu no Allah un kādi ir nokritusies par patiesību? Ļaujiet viņiem būt tāpat kā tiem, kas tika dota pirms raksti un ilgu laiku tika pārvilkts pāri, tāpēc savās sirdīs rūdīts; un daudzi no viņiem ir izaicinoši nepaklausību.

trans-unit.source: Know that Allah gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. We have made clear to you the signs; perhaps you will understand.
trans-unit.target: Zinu, ka Allah dod dzīvību uz zemes, pēc tās lifelessness. Mums ir skaidri jums pazīmes; Varbūt jūs sapratīsiet.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the men who practice charity and the women who practice charity and [they who] have loaned Allah a goodly loan - it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble reward.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, tie vīri, kas praksē labdarības un sievietes, kas praksē labdarības un [tie kas] ir aizdots Allah pamatīgs aizdevumu - tas tiks reizināti viņiem, un viņiem būs cēls atlīdzības.

trans-unit.source: And those who have believed in Allah and His messengers - those are [in the ranks of] the supporters of truth and the martyrs, with their Lord. For them is their reward and their light. But those who have disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of Hellfire.
trans-unit.target: Un tiem, kam ir tic Allah un viņa kurjeri - tie ir [rindās] atbalstītāju patiesības un mocekļi, ar savu kungu. Viņiem ir viņu atlīdzība un to gaismu. Bet tiem, kuri disbelieved un noliedza mūsu vārsmas - tie ir Hellfire biedrus.

trans-unit.source: Know that the life of this world is but amusement and diversion and adornment and boasting to one another and competition in increase of wealth and children - like the example of a rain whose [resulting] plant growth pleases the tillers; then it dries and you see it turned yellow; then it becomes [scattered] debris. And in the Hereafter is severe punishment and forgiveness from Allah and approval. And what is the worldly life except the enjoyment of delusion.
trans-unit.target: Zinu, ka šīs pasaules dzīve ir bet atrakciju un novirzīšanu un rota un lepojas viena otru un konkurences pieaugumu bagātības un bērniem - kā piemēram, lietus, kuru [ko] augu augšanas pleases īpašām; tad tas izžūst un redzat to kļuva dzeltens; tad tā kļūst [izkaisīti] atlūzām. Un turpmāk bargu sodu un piedošanu no Allah un apstiprināšanai. Un kāda ir pasaulīgās dzīves izņemot maldi baudījumu.

trans-unit.source: Race toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: Skrējiens pretī piedošanu no savu kungu un dārzs, kura platums ir kā debesis un zeme, sagatavoti tiem, kuri tic Allah un viņa kurjeriem platumu. Tas ir devība Allah, ko viņš dod, uz kuriem viņš vēlas, un Allah ir lielu devība valdītāju.

trans-unit.source: No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register before We bring it into being - indeed that, for Allah, is easy -
trans-unit.target: Nr katastrofa uz zemes vai starp sev izņemot to, ka tas ir reģistrā, pirms mēs panāktu to veidoties - patiešām, ka Allāhs, ir viegli-

trans-unit.source: In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful -
trans-unit.target: Lai jums nav izmisums, pār ko ir izvairīšanās no un nav gavilēt [ar lepnumu] pār to, ko viņš ir devis jums. Un Allah nepatīk visi self-maldināts un lielīgs-

trans-unit.source: [Those] who are stingy and enjoin upon people stinginess. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: [Tiem], kas ir skops un liek uz cilvēku skopumu. Un kurš aizgriežas -, tad patiešām, Allah ir vajadzība Praiseworthy bezmaksas.

trans-unit.source: We have already sent Our messengers with clear evidences and sent down with them the Scripture and the balance that the people may maintain [their affairs] in justice. And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that Allah may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
trans-unit.target: Mēs jau nosūtīts mūsu kurjeriem ar skaidras liecības un nosūtīts uz leju ar tiem rakstiem un līdzsvars, ka cilvēki var saglabāt [dēkām] Tieslietu departamentā. Mēs aizsūtījām pa dzelzs, kur ir liels militāro varētu un dod labumu cilvēkiem, un tāpēc ka Allāham var padarīt skaidrs tiem, kas atbalsta viņu un viņa kurjeriem neredzēts. Patiešām, Allah ir visspēcīgākais un izredzētais iespējams.

trans-unit.source: And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs jau nosūtījis Noah un Ābrahāms un ievieto viņu pēcteči prophethood un rakstos; un starp tām ir tas, kas tiek vadīta, bet daudzas no tām ir izaicinoši nepaklausību.

trans-unit.source: Then We sent following their footsteps Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of Allah. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Tad mēs mūsu kurjeriem nosūtīta pēc viņu pēdās sekoja [tiem] Jēzus, Marija, dēls un deva viņam evaņģēlija. Un mēs novieto sirdīs tiem, kuri sekoja viņam, līdzjūtība un žēlsirdība un monasticism, ko viņi innovated; Mums nebija ne noteikt par tiem, izņemot [, ka viņi to darīja] meklē apstiprinājumu par Allah. Bet viņi darīja nevar novērot, pienācīgi ievērojot. Tātad mums deva tiem, kuri uzskatīja, ka viņu vidū to atlīdzība, bet daudzas no tām ir izaicinoši nepaklausību.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, bailes Allah un tic viņa Messenger; Viņš dos [tad] jums dubultā daļu viņa žēlastību un ļauj jums gaismu, kas būs staigāt un piedot; un Allah, piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: [This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of Allah and that [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah; He gives it to whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: [Tas] tāpēc, ka Bībele cilvēki var zināt, ka tie nespēj [iegūt] neko no devība no Allah un ka [visi] devība ir rokas no Allah; Viņš dod tam, kam viņš vēlas. Un Allah ir lielu devība valdītāju.

trans-unit.source: Certainly has Allah heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allah. And Allah hears your dialogue; indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Noteikti ir Allah dzirdējis runas, kurš argumentē ar jums [O Muhammad], attiecībā uz savu vīru un vada viņas sūdzība Allahu. Un Allah dzird savu dialogu; patiešām, Allah ir dzirdēt un redzēt.

trans-unit.source: Those who pronounce thihar among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kuri izrunāt thihar starp jums [atsevišķu] no savas sievas - tie nav [līdz] mātēm. Mātēm ir neviens, bet tiem, kas tos dzemdēja. Un patiesi, tie ir sakot, priekšraksta nosodāms un meli. Bet patiešām, Allah ir Pardoning un piedošanu.

trans-unit.source: And those who pronounce thihar from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Un tie, kuri izrunāt thihar no savas sievas un tad [vēlas] iet atpakaļ uz to, ko viņi teica - tad [tiks] vergu atbrīvošanu, pirms tie skar vienu citu. Lūk, kas tu esi admonished tādējādi; un Allah ir iepazinies ar to, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in Allah and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] Allah. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Un tas, kurš nevar atrast [vergu] - tad ātri divus mēnešus pēc kārtas, pirms tie pieskarties viens otru; un tas, kurš nevar - tad sešdesmit nabadzīgo cilvēku ēdināšana. Tas ir jums ticēt [pilnīgi] Allah un viņa Messenger; un tiem ir ierobežojumi [noteiktajam] Allah. Un disbelievers ir sāpīgi sods.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kuri iebilst pret Allāhu un viņa Messenger ir abased, kas pirms tam bija abased. Un mēs noteikti esam nosūtījuši pa pantiem skaidri pierādījumi. Un disbelievers ir pazemojoša sodīšana.

trans-unit.source: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and Allah is, over all things, Witness.
trans-unit.target: Dienā, kad Allah atdzīvināt tos visus un informēt viņus par to, ko viņi darīja. Allah bija uzskaitīts, kamēr viņi aizmirsa to; un Allah pār visām lietām, ir liecinieks.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? There is in no private conversation three but that He is the fourth of them, nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did, on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.
trans-unit.target: Vai jums nav uzskatīt, ka Allah zina, kas ir debesīs un kas uz zemes Nav neviena privāta saruna trīs, bet, ka viņš ir ceturtā daļa no tiem, nedz arī, piecus, bet kas viņš ir sestais no tiem - un nav mazāka par to un ne vairāk izņemot to, ka viņš ir ar tiem [zināšanu] atrastos. Pēc tam viņš informē viņus par to, ko viņi darīja, par augšāmcelšanās dienu. Patiešām Allah ir visas lietas, zinot.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who were forbidden from private conversation, then they return to that which they were forbidden and converse among themselves about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that [word] by which Allah does not greet you and say among themselves, "Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?" Sufficient for them is Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Vai jums nevar uzskatīt, ka tie, kuri bija aizliegts no privātā sarunā, tad viņi to, ko viņi bija aizliegts atgriezties un sarunāties savā starpā par grēku un agresiju un nepakļaušanās Messenger Un, kad viņi nāk pie jums, viņi sveicu jūs ar [vārdu] kas Allah ne sveicu jūs un teikt savā starpā, "Kāpēc Allah nav sodīt mūs, par ko mēs runājam?" Pietiekami, ja viņiem ir ellē, kurai tie tiks [enter lai] ierakstīšanas un nožēlojams ir galamērķis.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you converse privately, do not converse about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger but converse about righteousness and piety. And fear Allah, to whom you will be gathered.
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ticējusi, kad jūs sazināties privāti, nedrīkst sarunāties par grēku un agresiju un nepakļaušanās Messenger, bet sarunāties par taisnību un pietāte. Un bailes Allah, kam tiks savākta.

trans-unit.source: Private conversation is only from Satan that he may grieve those who have believed, but he will not harm them at all except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: Privāta saruna ir tikai no sātans, ka viņš var apbēdināt tos, kuri ir uzskats, bet viņš nebūs kaitēt viņiem vispār izņemot ar atļauju no Allah. Paļaujoties uz ļaujiet Allah ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you are told, "Space yourselves" in assemblies, then make space; Allah will make space for you. And when you are told, "Arise," then arise; Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: O kas ir uzskats, ja jums ir teikts, "Telpu sev" asamblejās, tad veicat telpa; Allah veikt telpu jums. Un, ja jums ir teikts, "Rodas", tad rodas; Allah paaugstinās tiem, kas ticējusi, starp jums un tiem, kas tika dota zināšanas, grādiem. Un Allah ir iepazinies ar to, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, kad jūs [vēlēšanos] privāti konsultēties kurjers, klāt pirms jūsu konsultācijas labdarības. Tas ir labāk, lai jūs un visšķīstāko. Bet, ja jums nav atrast [līdzekļus] - tad tiešām, Allah ir piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: Have you feared to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and Allah has forgiven you, then [at least] establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Ir bažas, iesniegt pirms apspriešanas labdarības Tad jums nav, un jums ir piedevis Allah, tad [vismaz] izveido lūgšanu un sniedz zakah un paklausīt Allah un viņa Messenger. Un Allah ir iepazinies ar to, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to untruth while they know [they are lying].
trans-unit.target: Vai jums nevar uzskatīt, ka tie, kas padara cilvēkiem, ar kuriem Allah ir kļuvis dusmīgs sabiedrotie Tie no jums, nedz arī no tiem, un tie zvēru nepatiesība, kamēr viņi zina [tie atrodas].

trans-unit.source: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Allah ir sagatavojis tos bargu sodu. Patiešām, tas bija ļaunums, ko viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: They took their [false] oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah, and for them is a humiliating punishment.
trans-unit.target: Viņi paņēma [viltus] zvērestam kā tādu pārvalku, tāpēc tās novērsis [cilvēku] no Allah, un viņiem ir pazemojoša sodīšana.

trans-unit.source: Never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally
trans-unit.target: Nekad netiks savu bagātību vai viņu bērniem izmantot tos pret Allāhu vispār. Tie ir biedri no uguns; tie būs ievērot tajā mūžīgi

trans-unit.source: On the Day Allah will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are [standing] on something. Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.
trans-unit.target: Par dienu Allah būs atdzīvināt tos visus, un tie būs zvēru, viņam kā jums to zvēru, un domāju, ka tie [pastāvīgā] par kaut ko. Neapšaubāmi, tas ir tie, kuri ir liars.

trans-unit.source: Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.
trans-unit.target: Sātans ir tos pārvarēt un padarīja viņus aizmirst Allah piemiņai. Tie ir puse no sātans. Neapšaubāmi, puse no sātans - tie būs zaudētāji.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, the ones who oppose Allah and His Messenger - those will be among the most humbled.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tie, kas iebilst pret Allāhu un viņa Messenger - tiem būs vidū visvairāk pazemīgs.

trans-unit.source: Allah has written, "I will surely overcome, I and My messengers." Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
trans-unit.target: Allah ir rakstījis, "Es noteikti atrisinās, es un mans kurjeri." Patiešām, Allah ir visspēcīgākais un izredzētais iespējams.

trans-unit.source: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of Allah. Unquestionably, the party of Allah - they are the successful.
trans-unit.target: Jūs nevarēsiet atrast cilvēku, kas tic Allah un pēdējā dienā ņemot siltas jūtas pret tiem, kuri iebilst pret Allāhu un viņa Messenger, pat ja tie ir viņu tēvi vai viņu dēli vai brāļus, vai viņu radi. Tiem - viņš ir izsludinājusi ietvaros ticību viņu sirdīs un atbalstīja viņus ar garu no viņa. Un mēs viņus uzņemt dārzi, zem kura upju plūsma, kur viņi ievēro mūžīgi. Allah ir apmierināts ar viņiem, un viņi ir apmierināti ar viņu - tie ir partijas Allah. Neapšaubāmi, puse Allāha - tie ir veiksmīgi.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Neatkarīgi no debesīs un visu, kas atrodas zemes exalts Allah, un viņš ir izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: It is He who expelled the ones who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah; but [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tas, kas izraidīts tie, kuri disbelieved rakstiem no savām mājām pirmajā sapulcē cilvēku vidū. Jūs nedomājat, aizies, un viņi domāja, ka viņu cietokšņi aizsargāt tos no Allah; bet [dekrētu] Allah sastapa tos no tā, kur tie nav paredzēts, un viņš pameta terors viņu sirdīs, [tā] viņi iznīcina savas mājas, savas [] plaukstas un rokas ticīgajiem. Tātad ņemt brīdinājuma, O cilvēku vīzijas.

trans-unit.source: And if not that Allah had decreed for them evacuation, He would have punished them in [this] world, and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja nav, ka Allāhs bija izsludinājusi par tiem evakuāciju, viņš varētu sodīt tos [šajā] pasaulē, un tos turpmāk ir sods par uguns.

trans-unit.source: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tāpēc, ka viņi iebilda pret Allāhu un viņa Messenger. Un tas, kurš iebilst pret Allāhu -, tad patiešām, Allah ir smags sods.

trans-unit.source: Whatever you have cut down of [their] palm trees or left standing on their trunks - it was by permission of Allah and so He would disgrace the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Neatkarīgi no jums ir samazināt [to] palmu koki vai palikuši stāvam snuķiem - tas bija ar atļauju no Allah un viņš būtu kauns tik izaicinoši nepaklausīga.

trans-unit.source: And what Allah restored [of property] to His Messenger from them - you did not spur for it [in an expedition] any horses or camels, but Allah gives His messengers power over whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Un kādi Allah atjaunota [no īpašuma] viņa Messenger no tiem - jums nebija ne stimulēt to [šajā ekspedīcijā] visiem zirgiem vai kamieļi, bet Allah dod varenību kurjeriem pār kuriem viņš vēlas, un Allah ir pār visām lietām, kas ir kompetentas.

trans-unit.source: And what Allah restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for Allah and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and orphans and the [stranded] traveler - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
trans-unit.target: Un kādi Allah atjaunot viņa Messenger no pilsētām - cilvēki ir Allah par Messenger un [viņa] pie radiniekiem un bāreņiem un ceļotājs [balasta] - tā, ka tas nevar būt mūžīgas sadalījumu starp jums bagāts. Un neatkarīgi no Messenger ir devusi jūs - jānotiek; un ko viņš ir aizliegts - atturas. Un bailes Allah; patiešām, Allah ir smags sods.

trans-unit.source: For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from Allah and [His] approval and supporting Allah and His Messenger, [there is also a share]. Those are the truthful.
trans-unit.target: Par nabaga emigranti, kuri tika izraidīti no savām mājām un to rekvizītiem, meklējot devība no Allah un [viņa] apstiprināšanu un atbalsta Allah un viņa Messenger [tur ir arī daļa]. Tās ir patiesas.

trans-unit.source: And [also for] those who were settled in al-Madinah and [adopted] the faith before them. They love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what the emigrants were given but give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Un [arī] tie, kuri bija apmetušies al Madinah un [pieņēma] ticībā pirms tām. Viņi mīl tos, kuri emigrēja uz viņiem un atrast nav kāds vēlas savas krūtis no emigrantu tika dota, bet [tiem] dod priekšroku pār sevi, pat ja tie ir nabadzība. Un tas, kurš ir aizsargāts pret skopumu dvēseles - ir tie, kuri būs veiksmīga.

trans-unit.source: And [there is a share for] those who came after them, saying, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful."
trans-unit.target: Un [ir akciju par] tie, kas nāca pēc viņiem, sacīdams: "mūsu kungs, piedod mums un mūsu brāļiem, kuri pirms tam mūs ticībā un nav iekļauti mūsu sirdis [visas] aizvainojums pret tiem, kuri ir uzskats. Mūsu kungs, tik tiešām tu esi laipns un žēlsirdīgs."

trans-unit.source: Have you not considered those who practice hypocrisy, saying to their brothers who have disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, "If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey, in regard to you, anyone - ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you." But Allah testifies that they are liars.
trans-unit.target: Jūs neuzskata par tiem, kas praksē liekulība, sakot ar saviem brāļiem, kuri ir disbelieved rakstiem, kas cilvēku vidū, "Ja tiek izraidīts, mēs noteikti atstās Jums un mums būs klausīt, attiecībā uz jums, ikvienam - kādreiz; un, ja jums ir cīnījies, mēs noteikti atbalstu jums." Bet Allāha liecina, tie ir liars.

trans-unit.source: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And [even] if they should aid them, they will surely turn their backs; then [thereafter] they will not be aided.
trans-unit.target: Ja viņi ir izslēgts, tie nevar atstāt ar viņiem, un, ja viņi ir cīnījušies, tie nav atbalsta tos. Un [pat], ja tie būtu atbalsta tos, viņi noteikti kļūs viņu mugurām; tad [tam] tie tiks nevar palīdzēt.

trans-unit.source: You [believers] are more fearful within their breasts than Allah. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
trans-unit.target: [Ticīgie] jums ir vairāk baismīgs ietvaros savas krūtis nekā Allah. Tas ir tāpēc, ka tie cilvēki, kas nesaprot.

trans-unit.source: They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
trans-unit.target: Tie nav cīņa jums visu, izņemot stiprinātie pilsētas vai caur sienas. Viņu starpā vardarbība ir smaga. Jūs domājat, ka viņi ir kopā, bet viņu sirdis ir daudzveidīga. Tas ir tāpēc, ka tie ir cilvēki, kuri nav iemesla.

trans-unit.source: [Theirs is] like the example of those shortly before them: they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: [Savējo ir], piemēram, tiem, kas neilgi pirms tam piemērs: tie garšoja piederas sliktas sekas, un tie būs sāpīgi sods.

trans-unit.source: [The hypocrites are] like the example of Satan when he says to man, "Disbelieve." But when he disbelieves, he says, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds."
trans-unit.target: [Liekuļi ir] sātans piemēru, piemēram, kad viņš saka vīram "Neticēt." Bet, kad viņš disbelieves, viņš saka: "patiesībā es esmu piesaiste noņemta no jums. Patiešām, es baidos, Allah, Lord no pasaules."

trans-unit.source: So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrong-doers.
trans-unit.target: Tātad par abiem iznākums būs uguns, ievērojot tur mūžīgi. Un tas ir nepareizi-darītāji atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, fear Allah. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: O tu, kas ticējusi, bailes Allah. Un ļaut katru dvēseli skatīties uz to, ko tā ir izstrādājusi tālāk rīt - un bailes Allah. Patiešām, Allah ir iepazinies ar to, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: And be not like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.
trans-unit.target: Un nevar būt, piemēram, tiem, kuri aizmirsa Allah, tāpēc viņš lika aizmirst sevi. Tie ir izaicinoši nepaklausību.

trans-unit.source: Not equal are the companions of the Fire and the companions of Paradise. The companions of Paradise - they are the attainers [of success].
trans-unit.target: Nav vienāda ir uguns biedrus un paradīze kompanjoni. Companions paradīze - tie attainers [par panākumiem].

trans-unit.source: If We had sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and coming apart from fear of Allah. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.
trans-unit.target: Ja mums nosūtīja uz leju šo Qur uz kalnu, ko esmu redzējis to humbled un kurus ieved ne tikai Allah bailes. Un šie piemēri mums klāt cilvēkiem, kas varbūt viņi dos domāja.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed. He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Viņš atšķiras no Allah, kam nav nekādas dievība, zinātājam neredzēts un pieredzējusi. Viņš ir pilnīgi žēlsirdīgs, it īpaši žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Bestower of Faith, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior. Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
trans-unit.target: Viņš atšķiras no Allah, kam nav nekādas dievība, suverēnas, Pure, pilnību, ticības Bestower, uzraugs, izredzētais, iespējams, Compeller, Superior. Izredzētie ir Allah iepriekš neatkarīgi no viņi saista ar viņu.

trans-unit.source: He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner; to Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Viņš ir Allah, radītājs, izgudrotājs, Fashioner; viņam pieder labākos vārdus. Kāda ir debesu un zemes exalting viņu. Un viņš ir izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, extending to them affection while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth, having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only] because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out for jihad in My cause and seeking means to My approval, [take them not as friends]. You confide to them affection, but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared. And whoever does it among you has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, neesat lietojis mani ienaidnieki, un savu ienaidnieku kā sabiedrotie, paplašinot viņiem simpātijas, kamēr tie ir disbelieved, kas sekos jums patiesību, kam padzīti pravieti un sev [tikai], tāpēc, ka viņš tic Allah, savu kungu. Ja jums ir iznācis Jihad, mans iemesls un meklē līdzekļus, lai manas apstiprināšanas [ņemt tos nevis kā draugu]. Uzticēties viņiem simpātijas, bet esmu visvairāk zinot to, kas ir noslēptas un ko ir paziņojuši. Un tas, kurš to dara jūsu vidū noteikti ir noklīdis no tā stabilitāti.

trans-unit.source: If they gain dominance over you, they would be to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disbelieve.
trans-unit.target: Ja viņi gūtu dominance pār jums, viņi būtu jums kā ienaidniekus un paplašināt pret jums viņu rokās un mēles ar ļauno, un viņi vēlas, vai neticēt.

trans-unit.source: Never will your relatives or your children benefit you; the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Nekad nav jūsu radiniekiem vai jūsu bērni iegūs jums; Dienā no augšāmcelšanās viņš vērtēs starp jums. Un Allah, par to, ko jūs darīt, ir redzēt.

trans-unit.source: There has already been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone" except for the saying of Abraham to his father, "I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allah. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Tur jau ir jums lielisku modeli, Abraham, un tiem līdzi, kad viņi teica, ka to cilvēku, "Protams, mēs piesaiste ir noņemta no jums un no kāda jūs dievkalpojumu citiem mērķiem kā vien Allāhs. Mēs jums ir liegta, un tur ir parādījies starp mums un jums naids un naidu uz visiem laikiem, līdz jums ticēt Allah tikai"izņemot Abraham saka tēvam:" es noteikti Lūdzu piedošanu par jums, bet man nav [vara] jums neko pret Allah. Mūsu kungs pār jums, mums ir balstījusies un jums mēs esam atgriezušies, un jums ir galamērķis.

trans-unit.source: Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
trans-unit.target: Mūsu kungs, padara mūs ne [objekti] mokas par disbelievers un piedod mums mūsu Kungu. Patiešām, tas ir jums, kas ir izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs."

trans-unit.source: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: Tur noteikti ir bijis jums tiem lielisku modeli ikvienam, kuru cerība ir Allah un pēdējā dienā. Un kurš aizgriežas -, tad patiešām, Allah ir vajadzība Praiseworthy bezmaksas.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps Allah will put, between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection. And Allah is competent, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: Varbūt uzliks Allah, starp jums un tiem, kam ir bijuši ienaidnieki to vidū simpātijas. Allah ir kompetents un Allah ir piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: Allah does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
trans-unit.target: Allah neaizliedz jums no tiem, kas nav cīņa dēļ reliģijas un nevis izraidīt no jūsu mājām - taisnīgs pret viņiem un rīkojoties pamatoti viņiem pretī. Patiešām, Allah mīl tos, kuri pamatoti rīkoties.

trans-unit.source: Allah only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Allah tikai aizliedz no tiem, kas jūs cīņa dēļ reliģijas un jūs izraidīt no mājām un atbalstu jūsu izraidīšanu - [aizliedz], ko veicat sabiedrotajiem no tiem. Un tas, kurš liek sabiedrotajiem no tiem, tad tas ir tiem, kuri pārkāpējus.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. Allah is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disbelievers what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgement of Allah; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ir uzskats, ja ticēt sievietēm nākt pie jums kā emigranti, izskatīt tos. Allah ir visvairāk zinot par savu ticību. Un ja jūs zināt, tie ir ticīgie, tad nedrīkst atgriezties tos disbelievers; tie nav likumīga [sievas] viņiem, ne tie likumīgo vīru par viņiem. Bet dot disbelievers to, ko viņi ir pavadījuši. Un nav nekādas vainas, pār jums, ja jums precēties tos, ja jums ir devis viņiem to pienākas kompensācija. Un turēt nav laulībā obligācijām ar neticīgi sievietēm, bet lūgt to, kas jums ir iztērēti un ļaut viņiem lūgt to, ko viņi ir pavadījuši. Tas ir spriedums par Allah; Viņš tiesnešu starp jums. Un Allah ir zinot un gudrs.

trans-unit.source: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers and you subsequently obtain [something], then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
trans-unit.target: Un, ja jums ir zaudējuši nevienu no jūsu sievas disbelievers un jūs pēc tam saņemt [kaut], tad arī tie, kuru sievas ir izgājušas to, ko viņi bija pavadījuši ekvivalents. Un bailes Allah, kam jūs esat ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor will they steal, nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse, nor will they kill their children, nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented between their arms and legs, nor will they disobey you in what is right - then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, ja ticēt sievietēm nākt pie tevis ieķīlāšanu, lai jūs, ka viņi neko nesaistīs ar Allah, ne tās nozagt, ne tās apņemsies prettiesisku dzimumaktu, ne tie nogalināt savus bērnus, viņi nesīs tālāk neslava, viņi ir izgudrojuši starp savas rokas un kājas, ne viņi nepakļaujas jums, kas ir labi - tad pieņemt savu solījumu un lūgt piedošanu tiem Allah. Patiešām, Allah ir piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, do not make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry. They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the inhabitants of the graves.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, netiek veikta sabiedrotajiem no cilvēkiem, ar kuriem Allah ir kļuvis dusmīgs. Tie ir izmisis par [alga] tāpat kā disbelievers turpmāk ir izmisis [sēdes] iedzīvotājiem no kapiem.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Neatkarīgi no debesīs un visu, kas atrodas zemes exalts Allah, un viņš ir izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do?
trans-unit.target: Ak tu, kas ticējusi, kāpēc jūs sakāt, ko jūs nevar darīt?

trans-unit.source: Great is hatred in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do.
trans-unit.target: Liels ir naids, Allah, ka jūs sakāt, ka jums nav aktuāli.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.
trans-unit.target: Patiešām, Allah patīk tiem, kas cīnās savu aicinājumu pēc kārtas, tā, it kā tie [vienu] struktūra stingri iestājos.

trans-unit.source: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allah to you?" And when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: Un [pieminēt, O Muhammad], kad Moses teica savai tautai, "Mana tauta, kāpēc jums kaitēt mani, kamēr jūs noteikti zināt, ka es esmu Allah messenger jums O?" Un kad viņi atkāpies, Allah izraisīja viņu sirdis, lai atkāptos. Un Allah guide ne izaicinoši nepaklausīgi cilvēki.

trans-unit.source: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."
trans-unit.target: Un [min], kad Jēzus, Marija, dēls teica: "O Izraēla, tik tiešām es esmu Allah messenger jūs apstiprinot to, kas nāca pirms manis Toras un atnest labas vēstis Messenger nāk pēc manis, kura vārds ir Ahmad bērniem." Bet, kad viņš nāca pie viņiem ar skaidrus pierādījumus, viņi teica: "Šis ir acīmredzami burvju".

trans-unit.source: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah untruth while he is being invited to Islam. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Un kurš ir netaisna vairāk nekā viens, kurš izdomā par Allah nepatiesība, kamēr viņš uzaicina islāmu. Un Allah guide nav grēks cilvēku.

trans-unit.source: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.
trans-unit.target: Viņi vēlas, lai nodzēst Allāha gaismu, bet Allah būs ideāls savu gaismu, gan disbelievers nepatīk tas.

trans-unit.source: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with Allah dislike it.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir viņš, kurš nosūtīja viņa Messenger ar vadlīniju un patiesību paust to pār visas reliģijas, ticības, gan tiem, kas citiem saistīt ar Allah nepatīk tas.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?
trans-unit.target: O jums, kas ir uzskats, sniedz man palīdzēs transakcijā, kas ietaupīs jums no sāpīga sods?

trans-unit.source: [It is that] you believe in Allah and His Messenger and strive in the cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you should know.
trans-unit.target: [Kas ir] ticēt Allah un viņa Messenger un censties Allah cēloni ar savu bagātību un savu dzīvi. Tas ir labākais, lai jūs, ja jums būtu jāzina.

trans-unit.source: He will forgive for you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Viņš jums jūsu grēkus piedot un uzņemt dārzi, zem kuras upes plūsmu un patīkamu dzīvokļiem dārzos pastāvīgas dzīvesvietas. Tas ir liels sasniegšana.

trans-unit.source: And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from Allah and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the believers.
trans-unit.target: Un [jūs saņemsiet] cita [labu], ka jums patīk - uzvara no Allah un nenovēršamu uzvara; un dot labas vēstis ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, be supporters of Allah, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters for Allah?" The disciples said, "We are supporters of Allah." And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, esiet atbalstītāju Allah, kā kad Jēzus, Marija, dēls teica pie mācekļiem, "kas ir mana atbalstītājiem par Allah?" Mācekļiem sacīja: "Mēs esam Allah atbalstītājiem." Un frakcija uzskatīja, ka Izraēlas bērniem un disbelieved frakcija. Tāpēc mēs atbalsta tie, kuri uzskatīja, ka pret saviem ienaidniekiem, un tie kļuva par dominējošo.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Kāds ir debesis un visu, kas atrodas zemes ir exalting Allah, Sovereign, Pure, izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: It is He who has sent among the unlettered a Messenger from themselves reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom - although they were before in clear error -
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tas, kas ir nosūtīta starp neizglītots ziņnesis no pašiem skandējam viņiem savas vārsmas un attīrīšanas tos un mācot viņiem grāmatas un gudrību - lai gan tie bija pirms programmā skaidri kļūda-

trans-unit.source: And [to] others of them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Un [ar] citiem no tiem kas nav vēl pievienojās tiem. Un viņš ir izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: That is the bounty of Allah, which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
trans-unit.target: Allāh, ko viņš dod, kam viņš vēlas, devība un Allah ir lielu devība valdītāju.

trans-unit.source: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kuri tika uzticēta Toras un tad neņēma to piemēru ir tāpat kā ēzelis, kas nes apjomu [grāmatas]. Nožēlojama ir cilvēkiem, kuri noliedz Allah zīmes piemērs. Un Allah guide nav grēks cilvēku.

trans-unit.source: Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allah, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."
trans-unit.target: Saka: "O jums, kas ir ebrejiem, ja jūs apgalvojat, ka esat sabiedrotajiem Allāha, izņemot [citiem] cilvēkiem, tad vēlos nāves, ja jums ir jābūt patiesam."

trans-unit.source: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
trans-unit.target: Bet tie nav vēlēsies, kādreiz, sakarā ar to, ko viņu rokās ir nodot tālāk. Un Allah ir zinot pārkāpējus.

trans-unit.source: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."
trans-unit.target: Teikt: "patiešām, nāvi, no kuras jūs bēgt - patiešām, tas jūs sagaidīs. Tad jūs tiksit atgriezts zinātājs neredzēts un pieredzējusi, un jūs informēs par to, ko esat pieradis veikt."

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, when [the adhan] is called for the prayer on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allah and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, kad [adhan] sauc par lūgšanu dienā Jumu'ah [otrdiena], pēc tam turpināt Allah piemiņai un atstāt tirdzniecības. Kas ir labāks par jums, ja vien tu zinātu.

trans-unit.source: And when the prayer has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of Allah, and remember Allah often that you may succeed.
trans-unit.target: Un kad lūgšana ir noslēgts, izkliedēšanai ietvaros zemes meklēt no Allah devība un atcerēties bieži vien Allāhs, tas var izdoties.

trans-unit.source: But when they saw a transaction or a diversion, [O Muhammad], they rushed to it and left you standing. Say, "What is with Allah is better than diversion and than a transaction, and Allah is the best of providers."
trans-unit.target: Bet, ieraudzījušas darījums vai novirzīšanos, [O Muhammad], viņi steidzās uz to un atstājuši jums pastāvīgu. Teiksim, "ar Allah ir labāk nekā novirzīšanu un nekā darbība un Allah ir labākais no pakalpojumu sniedzējiem."

trans-unit.source: When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muhammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allah." And Allah knows that you are His Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are liars.
trans-unit.target: Kad liekuļi nākt pie jums, [O Muhammad], viņi saka: "Mēs apliecinām, ka esat Messenger Allah". Un Allah zina, ka tu esi viņa Messenger un Allah liecina, ka liekuļi ir liars.

trans-unit.source: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
trans-unit.target: Tās ir veikušas zvērestam segšanai, tāpēc tās novērsis [cilvēku] no Allah veidā. Patiešām, tas bija ļaunums, ko viņi dara.

trans-unit.source: That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tāpēc, ka viņi ticēja, un tad viņi disbelieved; Tātad viņu sirdis tika noslēgta virs, un viņi nesaprot.

trans-unit.source: And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
trans-unit.target: Tos ieraugot, veidlapām, lūdzu jums un ja viņi runā, jums klausīties savu runu. [Tie ir], ja tie bija izslējies - koka gabalu viņi domā, ka ik kliedziens ir pret tiem. Tie ir ienaidnieks, tāpēc Uzmanieties no tiem. Allah; iznīcināt kā viņi tiek maldināts?

trans-unit.source: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.
trans-unit.target: Un, kad tas ir teikts, lai viņiem, "Nāc, Messenger Allah lūgs piedošanu jums", viņi nenovērsīsies galvas un redzat tos izvairīties, kaut arī tie ir augstprātīgi.

trans-unit.source: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; never will Allah forgive them. Indeed, Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir visas tās pašas viņiem lūgt piedošanu tiem vai nav lūgt piedošanu tiem; nekad neesmu Allah piedot tiem. Patiešām, Allah nav ceļveža izaicinoši nepaklausīgi cilvēki.

trans-unit.source: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah until they disband." And to Allah belongs the depositories of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
trans-unit.target: Viņi ir tie, kuri saka: "nevar tērēt par tiem, kuri ar Messenger Allah līdz tās izformēt." Un Allah pieder depozitārijiem, kas debesis un zemi, bet nesaprotu liekuļi.

trans-unit.source: They say, "If we return to al-Madinah, the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." And to Allah belongs [all] honor, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.
trans-unit.target: Viņi saka: "Ja mēs atgrieztos pie al-Madinah, vairāk cienījams [varas], tiks noteikti izraidīt no tās vairāk pazemīgs." Un Allah pieder [visas] godu, un viņa Messenger un ticīgo, bet nezinu liekuļi.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, ļauj ne savu bagātību un jūsu bērniem novirzīt jūs no Allah piemiņai. Un tas, kurš dara to - tad tie ir zaudētāji.

trans-unit.source: And spend [in the way of Allah] from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, "My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term so I would give charity and be among the righteous."
trans-unit.target: Un pavadīt [Allah] kā arī no to, ko esam nodrošinājuši jums pirms nāves tuvojas viens no jums, un viņš saka: "mans kungs, ja tikai varētu aizkavēt mani uz īsu termiņu, lai varētu dot labdarība, un būt starp taisns."

trans-unit.source: But never will Allah delay a soul when its time has come. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Bet nekad Allah aizkavēs dvēsele, kad tās laiks ir pienācis. Un Allah ir iepazinies ar to, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah. To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.
trans-unit.target: Kāds ir debesis un visu, kas atrodas zemes ir exalting Allah. Viņam pieder valdīšana, un viņam pieder [visi] atzinību, un viņš ir pār visām lietām, kas ir kompetentas.

trans-unit.source: It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir viņš, kurš izveidojis, jūsu vidū ir disbeliever un jūsu vidū ir ticīgais. Un Allah, par to, ko jūs darīt, ir redzēt.

trans-unit.source: He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.
trans-unit.target: Viņš radīja debesis un zemi patiesību un veidoja jums un pilnveidotas veidlapas; un viņam ir [gala] galamērķa.

trans-unit.source: He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
trans-unit.target: Viņš zina, kas debesis un zemi un zina, ko jūs slēpt un ko jūs deklarēt. Un Allah ir zinot, ka pēc krūtis.

trans-unit.source: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
trans-unit.target: Tur nav pienācis jums ziņas par tiem, kuri pirms disbelieved? Tāpēc tie garšoja piederas sliktas sekas, un tie būs sāpīgi sods.

trans-unit.source: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And Allah dispensed [with them]; and Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir tāpēc, ka to kurjeriem mēdza bieži nākt uz tiem ar skaidras liecības, bet viņi teica, "Ir cilvēku ceļvedis mūs?" un disbelieved un novērsās. Un Allah iztikt [tiem]; un Allah ir nepieciešams brīvs un Praiseworthy.

trans-unit.source: Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allah, is easy."
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kuri neticēt apgalvoja, ka viņi nekad nav augšāmcēlies. Teikt: "Jā, mans kungs, jums būs noteikti ir augšāmcēlies; tad jūs noteikti informēs par visu, ko jūs darāt. Un ka par Allāhu, ir viegli."

trans-unit.source: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Qur'an which We have sent down. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
trans-unit.target: Tātad tic Allah un viņa Messenger un Korāns, kas mēs esam nosūtījuši uz leju. Un Allah ir iepazinies ar to, ko jūs darīt.

trans-unit.source: The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
trans-unit.target: Dienā viņš organizēsim montāžai diena - tas ir zaudējums dienā. Un tas, kurš tic Allah un nav taisnības - viņš noņemtu no viņu viņa ļaundarībām un atzīt viņu dārzi, zem kura upju plūsma, kur tos ievērot uz visiem laikiem. Tas ir liels sasniegšana.

trans-unit.source: But the ones who disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Bet tie, kas disbelieved un noliedza mūsu vārsmas - tie ir biedri no uguns, ievērojot mūžīgi tajā; un nabaga galamērķi.

trans-unit.source: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allah. And whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
trans-unit.target: Nr katastrofa izņemot ar atļauju no Allah. Un tas, kurš tic Allah - viņš vadīs viņa sirdi. Un Allah ir zinot visas lietas.

trans-unit.source: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.
trans-unit.target: Un ievērojiet Allah un paklausīt Messenger; bet, ja jūs savukārt prom - tad pēc mūsu kurjers ir tikai [pienākums] skaidrs paziņojums.

trans-unit.source: Allah - there is no deity except Him. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
trans-unit.target: Allah - nav neviens, izņemot viņu dievība. Paļaujoties uz ļaujiet Allah ticīgie.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, indeed, among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, patiešām, vidū sievām un bērniem esat ienaidniekiem, jums, Tātad piesargāties no tiem. Bet, ja jūs apžēlot un aizmirst un piedot - patiešām, tad Allah piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and Allah has with Him a great reward.
trans-unit.target: Savu bagātību un jūsu bērniem ir tikai izmēģinājuma un Allah ir līdzi liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: So fear Allah as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of Allah]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
trans-unit.target: Tāpēc bailes Allah, cik spējam un klausīties un paklausīt un tērēt, [Allah]; kā arī tas ir labāk, lai jūsu paši. Un tas, kurš ir aizsargāts pret skopumu dvēseles - ir tie, kuri būs veiksmīga.

trans-unit.source: If you loan Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allah is Most Appreciative and Forbearing.
trans-unit.target: Ja jūs aizdevums Allah pamatīgs aizdevumu, viņš vairoties to jums un jums piedot. Un Allah ir visvairāk pateicīgs un Forbearing.

trans-unit.source: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Zinātājs neredzēts un pieredzējusi, izredzētais, kas, iespējams, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear Allah, your Lord. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave [during that period] unless they are committing a clear immorality. And those are the limits [set by] Allah. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps Allah will bring about after that a [different] matter.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet, kad jūs [musulmaņi] šķiršanās sievietes, šķiršanās viņiem [Sākt] to nogaidīšanas periods un saglabāt skaits nogaidīšanas periods un bailes Allah, savu kungu. Nav pagriežas [vīriem] māju, kā arī paši [] jāatstāj [minētajā laikposmā], ja vien viņi izdara skaidri netikumība. Un tiem ir ierobežojumi [noteiktajam] Allah. Un kurš transgresses Allah limiti ir noteikti pāri sev. Jūs zināt, nav; varbūt Allah sniegs pēc tam [dažādi] jautājums.

trans-unit.source: And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or part with them according to acceptable terms. And bring to witness two just men from among you and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] Allah. That is instructed to whoever should believe in Allah and the Last day. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out
trans-unit.target: Un kad tās būs izpildījušas [gandrīz] termiņš, vai nu tos saglabāt saskaņā ar pieņemamiem nosacījumiem vai daļa ar tām saskaņā ar pieņemamiem nosacījumiem. Un dot liecības pieņemšanai [] liecinieks tikai diviem no jums un Allah. Tas ir norādīts, kurš būtu ticēt Allah un pēdējā dienā. Un tas, kurš baidās no Allah - viņš dos viņam izeju

trans-unit.source: And will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Allah has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.
trans-unit.target: Un sniegs viņam no kur viņš negaida. Un kurš ir atkarīga no Allah - tad viņš ir pilnīgi pietiekams, lai viņu. Patiešām, Allah būs izpildīt savu mērķi. Allah jau iestatīts visam [izsludinājusi] apmērā.

trans-unit.source: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you doubt, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him of his matter ease.
trans-unit.target: Un tie, kuri vairs gaidīt menstruācijas starp sievietēm - ja jūs šaubāties, tad to termiņš ir trīs mēneši, un [arī] tiem, kas nevar būt menstruated. Un tiem, kas ir grūtniecības stāvoklī, termiņš ir līdz brīdim, kad viņi dzemdēt. Un tas, kurš baidās no Allah - viņš dos viņam viņa jautājumu vieglumu.

trans-unit.source: That is the command of Allah, which He has sent down to you; and whoever fears Allah - He will remove for him his misdeeds and make great for him his reward.
trans-unit.target: Kas ir komandu Allah, kas viņš ir sūtījis uz leju jums; un tas, kurš baidās no Allah - viņš noņemt viņam viņa ļaundarībām un padarīt liels viņam viņa atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means and do not harm them in order to oppress them. And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you are in discord, then there may breastfeed for the father another woman.
trans-unit.target: Viņiem [sadaļā], kur vērsusi uzmanību no jūsu līdzekļus un nevar nodarīt ļaunumu, lai apspiest tos iesniegt. Un, ja viņi būtu iestājusies grūtniecība, tad tērēt tos, līdz tie dzemdēt. Un, ja viņi bērnu ar krūti, tad dot viņiem to maksājumu un piešķir starp sev pieņemamā veidā; bet, ja jums ir nesaskaņas, tad tur var zīdīt tēvs vēl kāda sieviete.

trans-unit.source: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. Allah will bring about, after hardship, ease.
trans-unit.target: Ļaujiet bagātības cilvēks pavada no savas bagātības, un viņš kuru noteikums ir ierobežots - ļaut viņam pavadīt no kāda Allah ir devis viņam. Allah dvēsele, izņemot [pēc] viņš ir devis to neietur. Allah dos apmēram, pēc grūtību, vieglumu.

trans-unit.source: And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.
trans-unit.target: Un cik pilsētas uzvedās bezkaunīgi pret komandu, tā kunga un viņa kurjeriem, tāpēc mēs ņēmām to nopietnu kontu un sodīti ar briesmīgs sods.

trans-unit.source: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair, and the outcome of its affair was loss.
trans-unit.target: Tas garšoja sliktas sekas tā lieta, un tā lieta rezultāts bija zaudējumi.

trans-unit.source: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allah, O you of understanding who have believed. Allah has sent down to you the Qur'an.
trans-unit.target: Allah ir sagatavojis tos bargu sodu; Tāpēc bailes Allah, O tu izpratni, kas ticējusi. Allah ir nosūtīts uz leju Korāns.

trans-unit.source: [He sent] a Messenger [Muhammad] reciting to you the distinct verses of Allah that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever. Allah will have perfected for him a provision.
trans-unit.target: [Viņš nosūtīja] Messenger [Muhammad] skandētu jums atsevišķi panti Allah, ka viņš var izcelt tos, kuri domāt un darīt taisns darbus no darknesses uz gaismu. Un tas, kurš tic Allah un neatbilst taisnības - viņš atzīst viņu dārzos, zem kura upes plūsmas norunājām tajā uz visiem laikiem. Allah būs ir pilnveidojies viņu noteikums.

trans-unit.source: It is Allah who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge.
trans-unit.target: Tas ir Allah, kas radījusi septiņu debess un zemes, līdzīgi tiem. [Viņa] komandu nolaižas starp tiem, lai jūs zināt, ka Allāhs ir pār visām lietām, kas ir kompetentas un ka Allah ir ietvēra visas lietas zināšanas.

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allah has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
trans-unit.target: O pareģe, sakiet, kāpēc jūs aizliegtu [sevi no] kādi Allah ir padarījusi likumīga tu meklē apstiprinājumu par sievām? Un Allah, piedošanu un žēlsirdīgs.

trans-unit.source: Allah has already ordained for you [Muslims] the dissolution of your oaths. And Allah is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.
trans-unit.target: Allah ir jau ordinēts jūs [musulmaņi] likvidēšanas savu zvērestu. Un Allah ir jūsu aizstāvis, un viņš zinot, gudrs.

trans-unit.source: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and Allah showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Acquainted."
trans-unit.target: Un [atceros] kad pravietis uzticējis vienam no viņa sievas paziņojumu; un, kad viņa informēja [vēl] un Allah parādīja viņam, viņš veica zināmu daļu un ignorēt daļa. Un kad viņš informēja viņu par to, viņa sacīja: "kas tev tas?" Viņš teica: "Es biju informēja zinot, Acquainted."

trans-unit.source: If you two [wives] repent to Allah, [it is best], for your hearts have deviated. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed Allah is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.
trans-unit.target: Ja jūs abi [sievas] nožēlot Allah, [tas ir labākais], lai jūsu sirdis ir atkāpies no noteikumiem. Bet ja tu liegsies sadarboties pret viņu - tad tiešām Allah ir viņa aizsargs un Gabriel un ticīgie taisns un eņģeļiem, turklāt ir [viņa] palīgi.

trans-unit.source: Perhaps his Lord, if he divorced you [all], would substitute for him wives better than you - submitting [to Allah], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling - [ones] previously married and virgins.
trans-unit.target: Varbūt viņa kungs, ja viņš šķīries jūs [visi], varētu aizstāt viņu sievas labāk nekā jūs - iesniedzot [Allah], ticot, dievbijīga paklausīgs, nožēlojošs, worshipping un ceļojumā - [tiem] iepriekš precējies un jaunavas.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.
trans-unit.target: O kas ticējusi, aizsargāt sevi un savas ģimenes no uguns, kura degvielas ir cilvēki un akmeņiem, kuru [ieceļ] eņģeļi, skarbu un smagas; viņi nepakļaujas Allah, ko viņš tiem komandas, bet darīt to, ko viņi ir pavēlējis.

trans-unit.source: O you who have disbelieved, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.
trans-unit.target: O kas ir disbelieved pārliecināties, nav excuses dienā. Jums būs recompensed tikai par to, ko esat pieradis veikt.

trans-unit.source: O you who have believed, repent to Allah with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent."
trans-unit.target: Ak jūs, kas ticējusi, nožēlot Allahu ar nožēlošanu. Varbūt savu kungu noņemt jūs no jūsu ļaundarībām un uzņemt jūs dārzos, zem kura upes plūsmas [ieslēgts] tajā dienā, kad Allah būs nav kauns, pravietis, un tie, kuri uzskatīja, ka ar viņu. To gaisma tiks turpināts pirms viņiem un par viņu tiesībām; viņi saka, "mūsu Kunga, ideāls par mums mūsu gaisma un piedod mums. Protams, tu esi pār visām lietām, kas ir kompetenta."

trans-unit.source: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: O Prophet tiekties pret disbelievers un liekuļi un bargi pār viņiem. Un to patvērumu ir elle un nožēlojams ir galamērķis.

trans-unit.source: Allah presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so those prophets did not avail them from Allah at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."
trans-unit.target: Allāhs rada piemēru, kuri disbelieved: Noah un daudz sieva sieva. Tie bija pakļauti divi no mūsu taisnais ierēdņi, bet nodevuši, tāpēc šie pravieši bija nevis izmantot tos no Allah vispār, un tas tika teikts, "Ievadiet ar tiem, kuri ierodas ugunsgrēka".

trans-unit.source: And Allah presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people."
trans-unit.target: Un Allāhs rada piemēru, kuri ticēja: faraons, kad viņa teica sieva, "milord, cels mani pie jums māju paradīzē un glābt mani no faraons, un viņa darbiem un glābt mani no grēks cilvēku."

trans-unit.source: And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel, and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.
trans-unit.target: Un [piemēram] Marija, meita ' Imran, kuri sargāja viņas šķīstība, tāpēc mums pūta vērā [viņas tērpa] caur mūsu eņģelis, un viņa uzskatīja par savu kungu un viņa rakstos vārdiem un bija dievbijīga paklausīgs.

trans-unit.source: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -
trans-unit.target: Laimīgs ir viņš, kuru rokās ir vara, un viņš ir pār visām lietām, kas ir kompetenta-

trans-unit.source: [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -
trans-unit.target: [Viņš] izveidotājam nāve un dzīve jums testēt [par to], kuri jums ir labākais darbos - un viņš ir izredzētais, kas, iespējams, piedošanu -

trans-unit.source: [And] who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?
trans-unit.target: [Un] kas izveidota septiņu debess slāņos. Jūs neredzat izveidi vairums žēlsirdīgs jebkura nekonsekvence. Lai atgrieztos [savu] redzējumu [debesis]; jūs redzat jebkuru pārtraukumu?

trans-unit.source: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.
trans-unit.target: Tiek atgriezts [savu] redzējumu divreiz vēlreiz. [Jūsu] redzējums tiek atgriezts jums humbled esot noguruši.

trans-unit.source: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Un mēs noteikti izdaiļojis tuvāko debesīs mirdzēja zvaigznes un ir veikuši [no] tos, ko izmet pie velni un esam gatavi tās spožās sods.

trans-unit.source: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
trans-unit.target: Tiem, kuri disbelieved ar savu kungu ir sods par elli un nožēlojams ir galamērķis.

trans-unit.source: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.
trans-unit.target: Kad viņi to ir iemesta, viņi dzird no tā [baigi] ieelpo, kamēr tas vārās uz augšu.

trans-unit.source: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
trans-unit.target: Tas gandrīz pārrāvumi dusmās. Katru reizi, kad tiek iemesta sabiedrība, tās apsaimniekotājiem uzdot viņiem, "Nebija tur nevar atnākt pie tevis-warner?"

trans-unit.source: They will say," Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"
trans-unit.target: Viņi saka,"Jā, warner, ieradies pie mums, bet mēs noliegt un teica:" Allah lejā kaut kas nav nosūtījusi. Jūs neesat, bet lielā kļūda. ""

trans-unit.source: And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."
trans-unit.target: Un viņi saka, "Ja tikai mums bija klausīšanās vai argumentāciju, mēs nebūtu starp aizsvilties biedriem."

trans-unit.source: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation for the companions of the Blaze.
trans-unit.target: Un viņi atzīs savu grēku, tātad [ir] atsavināšanas aizsvilties par ceļabiedriem.

trans-unit.source: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.
trans-unit.target: Protams, tiem, kuri baidās to Lord neredzētas būs piedošanu un liela atlīdzība.

trans-unit.source: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
